45# elif defined HAVE_MALLOC_SIZE

47# define malloc_usable_size(a) malloc_size(a)
48# endif
49#endif

56# elif defined(HAVE_MALLOC_NP_H)

141#if !defined(MAP_ANONYMOUS) && defined(MAP_ANON)

144
145static inline struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag
146size_add_overflow(size_t x, size_t y)
147{
148 size_t z;
149 bool p;
150#if 0
151
152#elif __has_builtin(__builtin_add_overflow)
153 p = __builtin_add_overflow(x, y, &z);
154
155#elif defined(DSIZE_T)
156 RB_GNUC_EXTENSION DSIZE_T dx = x;
157 RB_GNUC_EXTENSION DSIZE_T dy = y;
158 RB_GNUC_EXTENSION DSIZE_T dz = dx + dy;
159 p = dz > SIZE_MAX;
160 z = (size_t)dz;
161
162#else
163 z = x + y;
164 p = z < y;
165
166#endif
167 return (struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag) { p, z, };
168}
169
170static inline struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag
171size_mul_add_overflow(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z) /* x * y + z */
172{
173 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag t = rbimpl_size_mul_overflow(x, y);
174 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag u = size_add_overflow(t.right, z);
175 return (struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag) { t.left || u.left, u.right };
176}
177
178static inline struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag
179size_mul_add_mul_overflow(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z, size_t w) /* x * y + z * w */
180{
181 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag t = rbimpl_size_mul_overflow(x, y);
182 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag u = rbimpl_size_mul_overflow(z, w);
183 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag v = size_add_overflow(t.right, u.right);
184 return (struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag) { t.left || u.left || v.left, v.right };
185}
186
187PRINTF_ARGS(NORETURN(static void gc_raise(VALUE, const char*, ...)), 2, 3);
188
189static inline size_t
190size_mul_or_raise(size_t x, size_t y, VALUE exc)
191{
192 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag t = rbimpl_size_mul_overflow(x, y);
193 if (LIKELY(!t.left)) {
194 return t.right;
195 }
196 else if (rb_during_gc()) {
197 rb_memerror(); /* or...? */
198 }
199 else {
200 gc_raise(
201 exc,
202 "integer overflow: %"PRIuSIZE
203 " * %"PRIuSIZE
204 " > %"PRIuSIZE,
205 x, y, (size_t)SIZE_MAX);
206 }
207}
208
209size_t
210rb_size_mul_or_raise(size_t x, size_t y, VALUE exc)
211{
212 return size_mul_or_raise(x, y, exc);
213}
214
215static inline size_t
216size_mul_add_or_raise(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z, VALUE exc)
217{
218 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag t = size_mul_add_overflow(x, y, z);
219 if (LIKELY(!t.left)) {
220 return t.right;
221 }
222 else if (rb_during_gc()) {
223 rb_memerror(); /* or...? */
224 }
225 else {
226 gc_raise(
227 exc,
228 "integer overflow: %"PRIuSIZE
229 " * %"PRIuSIZE
230 " + %"PRIuSIZE
231 " > %"PRIuSIZE,
232 x, y, z, (size_t)SIZE_MAX);
233 }
234}
235
236size_t
237rb_size_mul_add_or_raise(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z, VALUE exc)
238{
239 return size_mul_add_or_raise(x, y, z, exc);
240}
241
242static inline size_t
243size_mul_add_mul_or_raise(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z, size_t w, VALUE exc)
244{
245 struct rbimpl_size_mul_overflow_tag t = size_mul_add_mul_overflow(x, y, z, w);
246 if (LIKELY(!t.left)) {
247 return t.right;
248 }
249 else if (rb_during_gc()) {
250 rb_memerror(); /* or...? */
251 }
252 else {
253 gc_raise(
254 exc,
255 "integer overflow: %"PRIdSIZE
256 " * %"PRIdSIZE
257 " + %"PRIdSIZE
258 " * %"PRIdSIZE
259 " > %"PRIdSIZE,
260 x, y, z, w, (size_t)SIZE_MAX);
261 }
262}
263
264#if defined(HAVE_RB_GC_GUARDED_PTR_VAL) && HAVE_RB_GC_GUARDED_PTR_VAL
265/* trick the compiler into thinking a external signal handler uses this */
266volatile VALUE rb_gc_guarded_val;
267volatile VALUE *
268rb_gc_guarded_ptr_val(volatile VALUE *ptr, VALUE val)
269{
270 rb_gc_guarded_val = val;
271
272 return ptr;
273}
274#endif

276#ifndef GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS
277#define GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS 10000
278#endif
279#ifndef GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS
280#define GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS 4096
281#endif
282#ifndef GC_HEAP_GROWTH_FACTOR
283#define GC_HEAP_GROWTH_FACTOR 1.8
284#endif
285#ifndef GC_HEAP_GROWTH_MAX_SLOTS
286#define GC_HEAP_GROWTH_MAX_SLOTS 0 /* 0 is disable */
287#endif
288#ifndef GC_HEAP_OLDOBJECT_LIMIT_FACTOR
289#define GC_HEAP_OLDOBJECT_LIMIT_FACTOR 2.0
290#endif
291
292#ifndef GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MIN_RATIO
293#define GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MIN_RATIO 0.20
294#endif
295#ifndef GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_GOAL_RATIO
296#define GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_GOAL_RATIO 0.40
297#endif
298#ifndef GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MAX_RATIO
299#define GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MAX_RATIO 0.65
300#endif
301
302#ifndef GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MIN
303#define GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MIN (16 * 1024 * 1024 /* 16MB */)
304#endif
305#ifndef GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MAX
306#define GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MAX (32 * 1024 * 1024 /* 32MB */)
307#endif
308#ifndef GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR
309#define GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR 1.4
310#endif
311
312#ifndef GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MIN
313#define GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MIN (16 * 1024 * 1024 /* 16MB */)
314#endif
315#ifndef GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR
316#define GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR 1.2
317#endif
318#ifndef GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MAX
319#define GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MAX (128 * 1024 * 1024 /* 128MB */)
320#endif
321
322#ifndef PRINT_MEASURE_LINE
323#define PRINT_MEASURE_LINE 0
324#endif
325#ifndef PRINT_ENTER_EXIT_TICK
326#define PRINT_ENTER_EXIT_TICK 0
327#endif
328#ifndef PRINT_ROOT_TICKS
329#define PRINT_ROOT_TICKS 0
330#endif
331
332#define USE_TICK_T (PRINT_ENTER_EXIT_TICK || PRINT_MEASURE_LINE || PRINT_ROOT_TICKS)
333#define TICK_TYPE 1
334
335typedef struct {
336 size_t heap_init_slots;
337 size_t heap_free_slots;
338 double growth_factor;
339 size_t growth_max_slots;
340
341 double heap_free_slots_min_ratio;
342 double heap_free_slots_goal_ratio;
343 double heap_free_slots_max_ratio;
344 double oldobject_limit_factor;
345
346 size_t malloc_limit_min;
347 size_t malloc_limit_max;
348 double malloc_limit_growth_factor;
349
350 size_t oldmalloc_limit_min;
351 size_t oldmalloc_limit_max;
352 double oldmalloc_limit_growth_factor;
353
354 VALUE gc_stress;
355} ruby_gc_params_t;
356
357static ruby_gc_params_t gc_params = {
358 GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS,
359 GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS,
360 GC_HEAP_GROWTH_FACTOR,
361 GC_HEAP_GROWTH_MAX_SLOTS,
362
363 GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MIN_RATIO,
364 GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_GOAL_RATIO,
365 GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MAX_RATIO,
366 GC_HEAP_OLDOBJECT_LIMIT_FACTOR,
367
368 GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MIN,
369 GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MAX,
370 GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR,
371
372 GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MIN,
373 GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MAX,
374 GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR,
375
376 FALSE,
377};
378
379/* GC_DEBUG:
380 * enable to embed GC debugging information.
381 */
382#ifndef GC_DEBUG
383#define GC_DEBUG 0
384#endif
385
386/* RGENGC_DEBUG:
387 * 1: basic information
388 * 2: remember set operation
389 * 3: mark
390 * 4:
391 * 5: sweep
392 */
393#ifndef RGENGC_DEBUG
394#ifdef RUBY_DEVEL
395#define RGENGC_DEBUG -1
396#else
397#define RGENGC_DEBUG 0
398#endif
399#endif
400#if RGENGC_DEBUG < 0 && !defined(_MSC_VER)
401# define RGENGC_DEBUG_ENABLED(level) (-(RGENGC_DEBUG) >= (level) && ruby_rgengc_debug >= (level))
402#elif defined(HAVE_VA_ARGS_MACRO)
403# define RGENGC_DEBUG_ENABLED(level) ((RGENGC_DEBUG) >= (level))
404#else
405# define RGENGC_DEBUG_ENABLED(level) 0
406#endif
407int ruby_rgengc_debug;
408
409/* RGENGC_CHECK_MODE
410 * 0: disable all assertions
411 * 1: enable assertions (to debug RGenGC)
412 * 2: enable internal consistency check at each GC (for debugging)
413 * 3: enable internal consistency check at each GC steps (for debugging)
414 * 4: enable liveness check
415 * 5: show all references
416 */
417#ifndef RGENGC_CHECK_MODE
418#define RGENGC_CHECK_MODE 0
419#endif
420
421// Note: using RUBY_ASSERT_WHEN() extend a macro in expr (info by nobu).
422#define GC_ASSERT(expr) RUBY_ASSERT_MESG_WHEN(RGENGC_CHECK_MODE > 0, expr, #expr)
423
424/* RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK
425 * 0: disable all assertions
426 * >0: make a OLD object when new object creation.
427 *
428 * Make one OLD object per RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK WB protected objects creation.
429 */
430#ifndef RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK
431#define RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK 0
432#endif
433
434/* RGENGC_PROFILE
435 * 0: disable RGenGC profiling
436 * 1: enable profiling for basic information
437 * 2: enable profiling for each types
438 */
439#ifndef RGENGC_PROFILE
440#define RGENGC_PROFILE 0
441#endif
442
443/* RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
444 * Enable/disable to estimate increase size of malloc'ed size by old objects.
445 * If estimation exceeds threshold, then will invoke full GC.
446 * 0: disable estimation.
447 * 1: enable estimation.
448 */
449#ifndef RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
450#define RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC 1
451#endif
452
453/* RGENGC_FORCE_MAJOR_GC
454 * Force major/full GC if this macro is not 0.
455 */
456#ifndef RGENGC_FORCE_MAJOR_GC
457#define RGENGC_FORCE_MAJOR_GC 0
458#endif
459
460#ifndef GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
461#define GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL 0
462#endif
463#ifndef GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY
464#define GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY 0
465#endif
466#ifndef GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
467#define GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK USE_RINCGC
468#endif
469#ifndef GC_ENABLE_LAZY_SWEEP
470#define GC_ENABLE_LAZY_SWEEP 1
471#endif
472#ifndef CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
473#define CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
474#endif
475#if defined(HAVE_MALLOC_USABLE_SIZE) || CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE > 0
476#ifndef MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
477#define MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE 0
478#endif
479#else
480#define MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE 0
481#endif
482#ifndef MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE_CHECK
483#define MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE_CHECK 0
484#endif
485
486#ifndef GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS
487#define GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS 0
488#endif
489
490#ifndef RGENGC_OBJ_INFO
491#define RGENGC_OBJ_INFO (RGENGC_DEBUG | RGENGC_CHECK_MODE)
492#endif
493
494typedef enum {
495 GPR_FLAG_NONE = 0x000,
496 /* major reason */
497 GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_BY_NOFREE = 0x001,
498 GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_BY_OLDGEN = 0x002,
499 GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_BY_SHADY = 0x004,
500 GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_BY_FORCE = 0x008,
501#if RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
502 GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_BY_OLDMALLOC = 0x020,
503#endif
504 GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_MASK = 0x0ff,
505
506 /* gc reason */
507 GPR_FLAG_NEWOBJ = 0x100,
508 GPR_FLAG_MALLOC = 0x200,
509 GPR_FLAG_METHOD = 0x400,
510 GPR_FLAG_CAPI = 0x800,
511 GPR_FLAG_STRESS = 0x1000,
512
513 /* others */
514 GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_SWEEP = 0x2000,
515 GPR_FLAG_HAVE_FINALIZE = 0x4000,
516 GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_MARK = 0x8000,
517 GPR_FLAG_FULL_MARK = 0x10000,
518 GPR_FLAG_COMPACT = 0x20000,
519
520 GPR_DEFAULT_REASON =
521 (GPR_FLAG_FULL_MARK | GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_MARK |
522 GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_SWEEP | GPR_FLAG_CAPI),
523} gc_profile_record_flag;
524
525typedef struct gc_profile_record {
526 unsigned int flags;
527
528 double gc_time;
529 double gc_invoke_time;
530
531 size_t heap_total_objects;
532 size_t heap_use_size;
533 size_t heap_total_size;
534 size_t moved_objects;
535
536#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
537 double gc_mark_time;
538 double gc_sweep_time;
539
540 size_t heap_use_pages;
541 size_t heap_live_objects;
542 size_t heap_free_objects;
543
544 size_t allocate_increase;
545 size_t allocate_limit;
546
547 double prepare_time;
548 size_t removing_objects;
549 size_t empty_objects;
550#if GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY
551 long maxrss;
552 long minflt;
553 long majflt;
554#endif
555#endif
556#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
557 size_t allocated_size;
558#endif
559
560#if RGENGC_PROFILE > 0
561 size_t old_objects;
562 size_t remembered_normal_objects;
563 size_t remembered_shady_objects;
564#endif
565} gc_profile_record;
566
567struct RMoved {
568 VALUE flags;
569 VALUE dummy;
570 VALUE destination;
571};
572
573#define RMOVED(obj) ((struct RMoved *)(obj))
574
575typedef struct RVALUE {
576 union {
577 struct {
578 VALUE flags; /* always 0 for freed obj */
579 struct RVALUE *next;
580 } free;
581 struct RMoved moved;
582 struct RBasic basic;
583 struct RObject object;
584 struct RClass klass;
585 struct RFloat flonum;
586 struct RString string;
587 struct RArray array;
588 struct RRegexp regexp;
589 struct RHash hash;
590 struct RData data;
591 struct RTypedData typeddata;
592 struct RStruct rstruct;
593 struct RBignum bignum;
594 struct RFile file;
595 struct RMatch match;
596 struct RRational rational;
597 struct RComplex complex;
598 struct RSymbol symbol;
599 union {
600 rb_cref_t cref;
601 struct vm_svar svar;
602 struct vm_throw_data throw_data;
603 struct vm_ifunc ifunc;
604 struct MEMO memo;
605 struct rb_method_entry_struct ment;
606 const rb_iseq_t iseq;
607 rb_env_t env;
608 struct rb_imemo_tmpbuf_struct alloc;
609 rb_ast_t ast;
610 } imemo;
611 struct {
612 struct RBasic basic;
613 VALUE v1;
614 VALUE v2;
615 VALUE v3;
616 } values;
617 } as;
618#if GC_DEBUG
619 const char *file;
620 int line;
621#endif
622} RVALUE;
623
624#if GC_DEBUG
625STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof_rvalue, offsetof(RVALUE, file) == SIZEOF_VALUE * 5);
626#else
627STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof_rvalue, sizeof(RVALUE) == SIZEOF_VALUE * 5);
628#endif
629STATIC_ASSERT(alignof_rvalue, RUBY_ALIGNOF(RVALUE) == SIZEOF_VALUE);
630
631typedef uintptr_t bits_t;
632enum {
633 BITS_SIZE = sizeof(bits_t),
634 BITS_BITLENGTH = ( BITS_SIZE * CHAR_BIT )
635};
636#define popcount_bits rb_popcount_intptr
637
638struct heap_page_header {
639 struct heap_page *page;
640};
641
642struct heap_page_body {
643 struct heap_page_header header;
644 /* char gap[]; */
645 /* RVALUE values[]; */
646};
647
648struct gc_list {
649 VALUE *varptr;
650 struct gc_list *next;
651};
652
653#define STACK_CHUNK_SIZE 500
654
655typedef struct stack_chunk {
656 VALUE data[STACK_CHUNK_SIZE];
657 struct stack_chunk *next;
658} stack_chunk_t;
659
660typedef struct mark_stack {
661 stack_chunk_t *chunk;
662 stack_chunk_t *cache;
663 int index;
664 int limit;
665 size_t cache_size;
666 size_t unused_cache_size;
667} mark_stack_t;
668
669#define SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool) (&(size_pool)->eden_heap)
670#define SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool) (&(size_pool)->tomb_heap)
671
672typedef struct rb_heap_struct {
673 struct heap_page *free_pages;
674 struct ccan_list_head pages;
675 struct heap_page *sweeping_page; /* iterator for .pages */
676 struct heap_page *compact_cursor;
677 uintptr_t compact_cursor_index;
678#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
679 struct heap_page *pooled_pages;
680#endif
681 size_t total_pages; /* total page count in a heap */
682 size_t total_slots; /* total slot count (about total_pages * HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT) */
683} rb_heap_t;
684
685typedef struct rb_size_pool_struct {
686 short slot_size;
687
688 size_t allocatable_pages;
689
690 /* Basic statistics */
691 size_t total_allocated_pages;
692 size_t total_freed_pages;
693 size_t force_major_gc_count;
694
695#if USE_RVARGC
696 /* Sweeping statistics */
697 size_t freed_slots;
698 size_t empty_slots;
699#endif
700
701 rb_heap_t eden_heap;
702 rb_heap_t tomb_heap;
703} rb_size_pool_t;
704
705enum gc_mode {
706 gc_mode_none,
707 gc_mode_marking,
708 gc_mode_sweeping,
709 gc_mode_compacting,
710};
711
712typedef struct rb_objspace {
713 struct {
714 size_t limit;
715 size_t increase;
716#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
717 size_t allocated_size;
718 size_t allocations;
719#endif
720
721 } malloc_params;
722
723 struct {
724 unsigned int mode : 2;
725 unsigned int immediate_sweep : 1;
726 unsigned int dont_gc : 1;
727 unsigned int dont_incremental : 1;
728 unsigned int during_gc : 1;
729 unsigned int during_compacting : 1;
730 unsigned int gc_stressful: 1;
731 unsigned int has_hook: 1;
732 unsigned int during_minor_gc : 1;
733#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
734 unsigned int during_incremental_marking : 1;
735#endif
736 unsigned int measure_gc : 1;
737 } flags;
738
739 rb_event_flag_t hook_events;
740 size_t total_allocated_objects;
741 VALUE next_object_id;
742
743 rb_size_pool_t size_pools[SIZE_POOL_COUNT];
744
745 struct {
746 rb_atomic_t finalizing;
747 } atomic_flags;
748
749 mark_stack_t mark_stack;
750 size_t marked_slots;
751
752 struct {
753 struct heap_page **sorted;
754 size_t allocated_pages;
755 size_t allocatable_pages;
756 size_t sorted_length;
757 uintptr_t range[2];
758 size_t freeable_pages;
759
760 /* final */
761 size_t final_slots;
762 VALUE deferred_final;
763 } heap_pages;
764
765 st_table *finalizer_table;
766
767 struct {
768 int run;
769 unsigned int latest_gc_info;
770 gc_profile_record *records;
771 gc_profile_record *current_record;
772 size_t next_index;
773 size_t size;
774
775#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
776 double prepare_time;
777#endif
778 double invoke_time;
779
780 size_t minor_gc_count;
781 size_t major_gc_count;
782 size_t compact_count;
783 size_t read_barrier_faults;
784#if RGENGC_PROFILE > 0
785 size_t total_generated_normal_object_count;
786 size_t total_generated_shady_object_count;
787 size_t total_shade_operation_count;
788 size_t total_promoted_count;
789 size_t total_remembered_normal_object_count;
790 size_t total_remembered_shady_object_count;
791
792#if RGENGC_PROFILE >= 2
793 size_t generated_normal_object_count_types[RUBY_T_MASK];
794 size_t generated_shady_object_count_types[RUBY_T_MASK];
795 size_t shade_operation_count_types[RUBY_T_MASK];
796 size_t promoted_types[RUBY_T_MASK];
797 size_t remembered_normal_object_count_types[RUBY_T_MASK];
798 size_t remembered_shady_object_count_types[RUBY_T_MASK];
799#endif
800#endif /* RGENGC_PROFILE */
801
802 /* temporary profiling space */
803 double gc_sweep_start_time;
804 size_t total_allocated_objects_at_gc_start;
805 size_t heap_used_at_gc_start;
806
807 /* basic statistics */
808 size_t count;
809 size_t total_freed_objects;
810 uint64_t total_time_ns;
811 struct timespec start_time;
812 } profile;
813 struct gc_list *global_list;
814
815 VALUE gc_stress_mode;
816
817 struct {
818 VALUE parent_object;
819 int need_major_gc;
820 size_t last_major_gc;
821 size_t uncollectible_wb_unprotected_objects;
822 size_t uncollectible_wb_unprotected_objects_limit;
823 size_t old_objects;
824 size_t old_objects_limit;
825
826#if RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
827 size_t oldmalloc_increase;
828 size_t oldmalloc_increase_limit;
829#endif
830
831#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE >= 2
832 struct st_table *allrefs_table;
833 size_t error_count;
834#endif
835 } rgengc;
836
837 struct {
838 size_t considered_count_table[T_MASK];
839 size_t moved_count_table[T_MASK];
840 size_t total_moved;
841 } rcompactor;
842
843#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
844 struct {
845 size_t pooled_slots;
846 size_t step_slots;
847 } rincgc;
848#endif
849
850 st_table *id_to_obj_tbl;
851 st_table *obj_to_id_tbl;
852
853#if GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS
854 VALUE stress_to_class;
855#endif
856} rb_objspace_t;
857
858
859#ifndef HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_LOG
860/* default tiny heap size: 64KiB */
861#define HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_LOG 16
862#endif
863
864#define BASE_SLOT_SIZE sizeof(RVALUE)
865
866#define CEILDIV(i, mod) (((i) + (mod) - 1)/(mod))
867enum {
868 HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN = (1UL << HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_LOG),
869 HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_MASK = (~(~0UL << HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_LOG)),
870 HEAP_PAGE_SIZE = HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN,
871 HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT = (unsigned int)((HEAP_PAGE_SIZE - sizeof(struct heap_page_header)) / BASE_SLOT_SIZE),
872 HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT = CEILDIV(CEILDIV(HEAP_PAGE_SIZE, BASE_SLOT_SIZE), BITS_BITLENGTH),
873 HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_SIZE = (BITS_SIZE * HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT),
874};
875#define HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN (1 << HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_LOG)
876#define HEAP_PAGE_SIZE HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN
877
878#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK && !defined(INCREMENTAL_MARK_STEP_ALLOCATIONS)
879# define INCREMENTAL_MARK_STEP_ALLOCATIONS 500
880#endif
881
882#ifdef HAVE_MMAP
883/* wasmtime does not have proper support for mmap.
884 * See https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/blob/main/docs/WASI-rationale.md#why-no-mmap-and-friends
885 */
886# if defined(__wasm__)
887static const bool HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP = false;
888# elif HAVE_CONST_PAGE_SIZE
889/* If we have the HEAP_PAGE and it is a constant, then we can directly use it. */
890static const bool HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP = (PAGE_SIZE <= HEAP_PAGE_SIZE);
891# elif defined(PAGE_MAX_SIZE) && (PAGE_MAX_SIZE <= HEAP_PAGE_SIZE)
892/* PAGE_SIZE <= HEAP_PAGE_SIZE */
893static const bool HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP = true;
894# else
895/* Otherwise, fall back to determining if we can use mmap during runtime. */
896# define HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP (heap_page_alloc_use_mmap != false)
897
898static bool heap_page_alloc_use_mmap;
899# endif
900#elif !defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(_WIN32)
901static const bool HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP = false;
902#endif
903
904struct heap_page {
905 short slot_size;
906 short total_slots;
907 short free_slots;
908 short pinned_slots;
909 short final_slots;
910 struct {
911 unsigned int before_sweep : 1;
912 unsigned int has_remembered_objects : 1;
913 unsigned int has_uncollectible_shady_objects : 1;
914 unsigned int in_tomb : 1;
915 } flags;
916
917 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool;
918
919 struct heap_page *free_next;
920 uintptr_t start;
921 RVALUE *freelist;
922 struct ccan_list_node page_node;
923
924 bits_t wb_unprotected_bits[HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT];
925 /* the following three bitmaps are cleared at the beginning of full GC */
926 bits_t mark_bits[HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT];
927 bits_t uncollectible_bits[HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT];
928 bits_t marking_bits[HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT];
929
930 /* If set, the object is not movable */
931 bits_t pinned_bits[HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_LIMIT];
932};
933
934#define GET_PAGE_BODY(x) ((struct heap_page_body *)((bits_t)(x) & ~(HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_MASK)))
935#define GET_PAGE_HEADER(x) (&GET_PAGE_BODY(x)->header)
936#define GET_HEAP_PAGE(x) (GET_PAGE_HEADER(x)->page)
937
938#define NUM_IN_PAGE(p) (((bits_t)(p) & HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN_MASK) / BASE_SLOT_SIZE)
939#define BITMAP_INDEX(p) (NUM_IN_PAGE(p) / BITS_BITLENGTH )
940#define BITMAP_OFFSET(p) (NUM_IN_PAGE(p) & (BITS_BITLENGTH-1))
941#define BITMAP_BIT(p) ((bits_t)1 << BITMAP_OFFSET(p))
942
943/* Bitmap Operations */
944#define MARKED_IN_BITMAP(bits, p) ((bits)[BITMAP_INDEX(p)] & BITMAP_BIT(p))
945#define MARK_IN_BITMAP(bits, p) ((bits)[BITMAP_INDEX(p)] = (bits)[BITMAP_INDEX(p)] | BITMAP_BIT(p))
946#define CLEAR_IN_BITMAP(bits, p) ((bits)[BITMAP_INDEX(p)] = (bits)[BITMAP_INDEX(p)] & ~BITMAP_BIT(p))
947
948/* getting bitmap */
949#define GET_HEAP_MARK_BITS(x) (&GET_HEAP_PAGE(x)->mark_bits[0])
950#define GET_HEAP_PINNED_BITS(x) (&GET_HEAP_PAGE(x)->pinned_bits[0])
951#define GET_HEAP_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITS(x) (&GET_HEAP_PAGE(x)->uncollectible_bits[0])
952#define GET_HEAP_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITS(x) (&GET_HEAP_PAGE(x)->wb_unprotected_bits[0])
953#define GET_HEAP_MARKING_BITS(x) (&GET_HEAP_PAGE(x)->marking_bits[0])
954
955#define GC_SWEEP_PAGES_FREEABLE_PER_STEP 3
956
957/* Aliases */
958#define rb_objspace (*rb_objspace_of(GET_VM()))
959#define rb_objspace_of(vm) ((vm)->objspace)
960
961#define ruby_initial_gc_stress gc_params.gc_stress
962
963VALUE *ruby_initial_gc_stress_ptr = &ruby_initial_gc_stress;
964
965#define malloc_limit objspace->malloc_params.limit
966#define malloc_increase objspace->malloc_params.increase
967#define malloc_allocated_size objspace->malloc_params.allocated_size
968#define heap_pages_sorted objspace->heap_pages.sorted
969#define heap_allocated_pages objspace->heap_pages.allocated_pages
970#define heap_pages_sorted_length objspace->heap_pages.sorted_length
971#define heap_pages_lomem objspace->heap_pages.range[0]
972#define heap_pages_himem objspace->heap_pages.range[1]
973#define heap_pages_freeable_pages objspace->heap_pages.freeable_pages
974#define heap_pages_final_slots objspace->heap_pages.final_slots
975#define heap_pages_deferred_final objspace->heap_pages.deferred_final
976#define size_pools objspace->size_pools
977#define during_gc objspace->flags.during_gc
978#define finalizing objspace->atomic_flags.finalizing
979#define finalizer_table objspace->finalizer_table
980#define global_list objspace->global_list
981#define ruby_gc_stressful objspace->flags.gc_stressful
982#define ruby_gc_stress_mode objspace->gc_stress_mode
983#if GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS
984#define stress_to_class objspace->stress_to_class
985#else
986#define stress_to_class 0
987#endif
988
989#if 0
990#define dont_gc_on() (fprintf(stderr, "dont_gc_on@%s:%d\n", __FILE__, __LINE__), objspace->flags.dont_gc = 1)
991#define dont_gc_off() (fprintf(stderr, "dont_gc_off@%s:%d\n", __FILE__, __LINE__), objspace->flags.dont_gc = 0)
992#define dont_gc_set(b) (fprintf(stderr, "dont_gc_set(%d)@%s:%d\n", __FILE__, __LINE__), (int)b), objspace->flags.dont_gc = (b))
993#define dont_gc_val() (objspace->flags.dont_gc)
994#else
995#define dont_gc_on() (objspace->flags.dont_gc = 1)
996#define dont_gc_off() (objspace->flags.dont_gc = 0)
997#define dont_gc_set(b) (((int)b), objspace->flags.dont_gc = (b))
998#define dont_gc_val() (objspace->flags.dont_gc)
999#endif
1000
1001static inline enum gc_mode
1002gc_mode_verify(enum gc_mode mode)
1003{
1004#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE > 0
1005 switch (mode) {
1006 case gc_mode_none:
1007 case gc_mode_marking:
1008 case gc_mode_sweeping:
1009 case gc_mode_compacting:
1010 break;
1011 default:
1012 rb_bug("gc_mode_verify: unreachable (%d)", (int)mode);
1013 }
1014#endif
1015 return mode;
1016}
1017
1018static inline bool
1019has_sweeping_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1020{
1021 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1022 if (SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(&size_pools[i])->sweeping_page) {
1023 return TRUE;
1024 }
1025 }
1026 return FALSE;
1027}
1028
1029static inline size_t
1030heap_eden_total_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1031{
1032 size_t count = 0;
1033 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1034 count += SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(&size_pools[i])->total_pages;
1035 }
1036 return count;
1037}
1038
1039static inline size_t
1040heap_eden_total_slots(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1041{
1042 size_t count = 0;
1043 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1044 count += SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(&size_pools[i])->total_slots;
1045 }
1046 return count;
1047}
1048
1049static inline size_t
1050heap_tomb_total_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1051{
1052 size_t count = 0;
1053 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1054 count += SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(&size_pools[i])->total_pages;
1055 }
1056 return count;
1057}
1058
1059static inline size_t
1060heap_allocatable_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1061{
1062 size_t count = 0;
1063 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1064 count += size_pools[i].allocatable_pages;
1065 }
1066 return count;
1067}
1068
1069static inline size_t
1070heap_allocatable_slots(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1071{
1072 size_t count = 0;
1073 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1074 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1075 int slot_size_multiple = size_pool->slot_size / BASE_SLOT_SIZE;
1076 count += size_pool->allocatable_pages * HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT / slot_size_multiple;
1077 }
1078 return count;
1079}
1080
1081static inline size_t
1082total_allocated_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1083{
1084 size_t count = 0;
1085 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1086 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1087 count += size_pool->total_allocated_pages;
1088 }
1089 return count;
1090}
1091
1092static inline size_t
1093total_freed_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1094{
1095 size_t count = 0;
1096 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1097 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1098 count += size_pool->total_freed_pages;
1099 }
1100 return count;
1101}
1102
1103#define gc_mode(objspace) gc_mode_verify((enum gc_mode)(objspace)->flags.mode)
1104#define gc_mode_set(objspace, mode) ((objspace)->flags.mode = (unsigned int)gc_mode_verify(mode))
1105
1106#define is_marking(objspace) (gc_mode(objspace) == gc_mode_marking)
1107#define is_sweeping(objspace) (gc_mode(objspace) == gc_mode_sweeping)
1108#define is_full_marking(objspace) ((objspace)->flags.during_minor_gc == FALSE)
1109#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
1110#define is_incremental_marking(objspace) ((objspace)->flags.during_incremental_marking != FALSE)
1111#else
1112#define is_incremental_marking(objspace) FALSE
1113#endif
1114#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
1115#define will_be_incremental_marking(objspace) ((objspace)->rgengc.need_major_gc != GPR_FLAG_NONE)
1116#else
1117#define will_be_incremental_marking(objspace) FALSE
1118#endif
1119#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
1120#define GC_INCREMENTAL_SWEEP_SLOT_COUNT 2048
1121#endif
1122#define is_lazy_sweeping(objspace) (GC_ENABLE_LAZY_SWEEP && has_sweeping_pages(objspace))
1123
1124#if SIZEOF_LONG == SIZEOF_VOIDP
1125# define nonspecial_obj_id(obj) (VALUE)((SIGNED_VALUE)(obj)|FIXNUM_FLAG)
1126# define obj_id_to_ref(objid) ((objid) ^ FIXNUM_FLAG) /* unset FIXNUM_FLAG */
1127#elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == SIZEOF_VOIDP
1128# define nonspecial_obj_id(obj) LL2NUM((SIGNED_VALUE)(obj) / 2)
1129# define obj_id_to_ref(objid) (FIXNUM_P(objid) ? \
1130 ((objid) ^ FIXNUM_FLAG) : (NUM2PTR(objid) << 1))
1131#else
1132# error not supported
1133#endif
1134
1135#define RANY(o) ((RVALUE*)(o))

1137struct RZombie {
1138 struct RBasic basic;
1139 VALUE next;
1140 void (*dfree)(void *);
1141 void *data;
1142};
1143
1144#define RZOMBIE(o) ((struct RZombie *)(o))

1146#define nomem_error GET_VM()->special_exceptions[ruby_error_nomemory]

1148#if RUBY_MARK_FREE_DEBUG
1149int ruby_gc_debug_indent = 0;
1150#endif
1151VALUE rb_mGC;
1152int ruby_disable_gc = 0;
1153int ruby_enable_autocompact = 0;

1156void rb_iseq_update_references(rb_iseq_t *iseq);
1157void rb_iseq_free(const rb_iseq_t *iseq);
1158size_t rb_iseq_memsize(const rb_iseq_t *iseq);
1159void rb_vm_update_references(void *ptr);
1160
1161void rb_gcdebug_print_obj_condition(VALUE obj);

1163static VALUE define_final0(VALUE obj, VALUE block);

1165NORETURN(static void *gc_vraise(void *ptr));
1166NORETURN(static void gc_raise(VALUE exc, const char *fmt, ...));
1167NORETURN(static void negative_size_allocation_error(const char *));

1178enum gc_enter_event {
1179 gc_enter_event_start,
1180 gc_enter_event_mark_continue,
1181 gc_enter_event_sweep_continue,
1182 gc_enter_event_rest,
1183 gc_enter_event_finalizer,
1184 gc_enter_event_rb_memerror,
1185};

1200#endif

1236static inline void gc_prof_timer_stop(rb_objspace_t *);

1244#define TYPED_UPDATE_IF_MOVED(_objspace, _type, _thing) do { \
1245 if (gc_object_moved_p((_objspace), (VALUE)(_thing))) { \
1246 *(_type *)&(_thing) = (_type)RMOVED(_thing)->destination; \
1247 } \
1248} while (0)
1249
1250#define UPDATE_IF_MOVED(_objspace, _thing) TYPED_UPDATE_IF_MOVED(_objspace, VALUE, _thing)
1251
1252#define gc_prof_record(objspace) (objspace)->profile.current_record
1253#define gc_prof_enabled(objspace) ((objspace)->profile.run && (objspace)->profile.current_record)
1254
1255#ifdef HAVE_VA_ARGS_MACRO
1256# define gc_report(level, objspace, ...) \
1257 if (!RGENGC_DEBUG_ENABLED(level)) {} else gc_report_body(level, objspace, __VA_ARGS__)
1258#else
1259# define gc_report if (!RGENGC_DEBUG_ENABLED(0)) {} else gc_report_body
1260#endif
1261PRINTF_ARGS(static void gc_report_body(int level, rb_objspace_t *objspace, const char *fmt, ...), 3, 4);
1262static const char *obj_info(VALUE obj);
1263static const char *obj_type_name(VALUE obj);
1264
1265/*
1266 * 1 - TSC (H/W Time Stamp Counter)
1267 * 2 - getrusage
1268 */
1269#ifndef TICK_TYPE
1270#define TICK_TYPE 1
1271#endif
1272
1273#if USE_TICK_T
1274
1275#if TICK_TYPE == 1
1276/* the following code is only for internal tuning. */
1277
1278/* Source code to use RDTSC is quoted and modified from
1279 * https://www.mcs.anl.gov/~kazutomo/rdtsc.html
1280 * written by Kazutomo Yoshii <kazutomo@mcs.anl.gov>
1281 */
1282
1283#if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
1284typedef unsigned long long tick_t;
1285#define PRItick "llu"
1286static inline tick_t
1287tick(void)
1288{
1289 unsigned long long int x;
1290 __asm__ __volatile__ ("rdtsc" : "=A" (x));
1291 return x;
1292}
1293
1294#elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__x86_64__)
1295typedef unsigned long long tick_t;
1296#define PRItick "llu"
1297
1298static __inline__ tick_t
1299tick(void)
1300{
1301 unsigned long hi, lo;
1302 __asm__ __volatile__ ("rdtsc" : "=a"(lo), "=d"(hi));
1303 return ((unsigned long long)lo)|( ((unsigned long long)hi)<<32);
1304}
1305
1306#elif defined(__powerpc64__) && GCC_VERSION_SINCE(4,8,0)
1307typedef unsigned long long tick_t;
1308#define PRItick "llu"
1309
1310static __inline__ tick_t
1311tick(void)
1312{
1313 unsigned long long val = __builtin_ppc_get_timebase();
1314 return val;
1315}
1316
1317#elif defined(__aarch64__) && defined(__GNUC__)
1318typedef unsigned long tick_t;
1319#define PRItick "lu"
1320
1321static __inline__ tick_t
1322tick(void)
1323{
1324 unsigned long val;
1325 __asm__ __volatile__ ("mrs %0, cntvct_el0" : "=r" (val));
1326 return val;
1327}
1328
1329
1330#elif defined(_WIN32) && defined(_MSC_VER)
1331#include <intrin.h>
1332typedef unsigned __int64 tick_t;
1333#define PRItick "llu"
1334
1335static inline tick_t
1336tick(void)
1337{
1338 return __rdtsc();
1339}
1340
1341#else /* use clock */
1342typedef clock_t tick_t;
1343#define PRItick "llu"
1344
1345static inline tick_t
1346tick(void)
1347{
1348 return clock();
1349}
1350#endif /* TSC */
1351
1352#elif TICK_TYPE == 2
1353typedef double tick_t;
1354#define PRItick "4.9f"
1355
1356static inline tick_t
1357tick(void)
1358{
1359 return getrusage_time();
1360}
1361#else /* TICK_TYPE */
1362#error "choose tick type"
1363#endif /* TICK_TYPE */
1364
1365#define MEASURE_LINE(expr) do { \
1366 volatile tick_t start_time = tick(); \
1367 volatile tick_t end_time; \
1368 expr; \
1369 end_time = tick(); \
1370 fprintf(stderr, "0\t%"PRItick"\t%s\n", end_time - start_time, #expr); \
1371} while (0)
1372
1373#else /* USE_TICK_T */
1374#define MEASURE_LINE(expr) expr
1375#endif /* USE_TICK_T */
1376
1377static inline void *
1378asan_unpoison_object_temporary(VALUE obj)
1379{
1380 void *ptr = asan_poisoned_object_p(obj);
1381 asan_unpoison_object(obj, false);
1382 return ptr;
1383}
1384
1385#define FL_CHECK2(name, x, pred) \
1386 ((RGENGC_CHECK_MODE && SPECIAL_CONST_P(x)) ? \
1387 (rb_bug(name": SPECIAL_CONST (%p)", (void *)(x)), 0) : (pred))
1388#define FL_TEST2(x,f) FL_CHECK2("FL_TEST2", x, FL_TEST_RAW((x),(f)) != 0)
1389#define FL_SET2(x,f) FL_CHECK2("FL_SET2", x, RBASIC(x)->flags |= (f))
1390#define FL_UNSET2(x,f) FL_CHECK2("FL_UNSET2", x, RBASIC(x)->flags &= ~(f))
1391
1392#define RVALUE_MARK_BITMAP(obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_MARK_BITS(obj), (obj))
1393#define RVALUE_PIN_BITMAP(obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_PINNED_BITS(obj), (obj))
1394#define RVALUE_PAGE_MARKED(page, obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP((page)->mark_bits, (obj))
1395
1396#define RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITMAP(obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITS(obj), (obj))
1397#define RVALUE_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITMAP(obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITS(obj), (obj))
1398#define RVALUE_MARKING_BITMAP(obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_MARKING_BITS(obj), (obj))
1399
1400#define RVALUE_PAGE_WB_UNPROTECTED(page, obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP((page)->wb_unprotected_bits, (obj))
1401#define RVALUE_PAGE_UNCOLLECTIBLE(page, obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP((page)->uncollectible_bits, (obj))
1402#define RVALUE_PAGE_MARKING(page, obj) MARKED_IN_BITMAP((page)->marking_bits, (obj))
1403
1404#define RVALUE_OLD_AGE 3
1405#define RVALUE_AGE_SHIFT 5 /* FL_PROMOTED0 bit */
1406
1407static int rgengc_remembered(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj);
1408static int rgengc_remembered_sweep(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj);
1409static int rgengc_remember(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj);
1410static void rgengc_mark_and_rememberset_clear(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_heap_t *heap);
1411static void rgengc_rememberset_mark(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_heap_t *heap);
1412
1413static inline int
1414RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE(VALUE flags)
1415{
1416 return (int)((flags & (FL_PROMOTED0 | FL_PROMOTED1)) >> RVALUE_AGE_SHIFT);
1417}
1418
1419static int
1420check_rvalue_consistency_force(const VALUE obj, int terminate)
1421{
1422 int err = 0;
1423 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
1424
1425 RB_VM_LOCK_ENTER_NO_BARRIER();
1426 {
1427 if (SPECIAL_CONST_P(obj)) {
1428 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %p is a special const.\n", (void *)obj);
1429 err++;
1430 }
1431 else if (!is_pointer_to_heap(objspace, (void *)obj)) {
1432 /* check if it is in tomb_pages */
1433 struct heap_page *page = NULL;
1434 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1435 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1436 ccan_list_for_each(&size_pool->tomb_heap.pages, page, page_node) {
1437 if (page->start <= (uintptr_t)obj &&
1438 (uintptr_t)obj < (page->start + (page->total_slots * size_pool->slot_size))) {
1439 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %p is in a tomb_heap (%p).\n",
1440 (void *)obj, (void *)page);
1441 err++;
1442 goto skip;
1443 }
1444 }
1445 }
1446 bp();
1447 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %p is not a Ruby object.\n", (void *)obj);
1448 err++;
1449 skip:
1450 ;
1451 }
1452 else {
1453 const int wb_unprotected_bit = RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1454 const int uncollectible_bit = RVALUE_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1455 const int mark_bit = RVALUE_MARK_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1456 const int marking_bit = RVALUE_MARKING_BITMAP(obj) != 0, remembered_bit = marking_bit;
1457 const int age = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE(RBASIC(obj)->flags);
1458
1459 if (GET_HEAP_PAGE(obj)->flags.in_tomb) {
1460 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is in tomb page.\n", obj_info(obj));
1461 err++;
1462 }
1463 if (BUILTIN_TYPE(obj) == T_NONE) {
1464 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is T_NONE.\n", obj_info(obj));
1465 err++;
1466 }
1467 if (BUILTIN_TYPE(obj) == T_ZOMBIE) {
1468 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is T_ZOMBIE.\n", obj_info(obj));
1469 err++;
1470 }
1471
1472 obj_memsize_of((VALUE)obj, FALSE);
1473
1474 /* check generation
1475 *
1476 * OLD == age == 3 && old-bitmap && mark-bit (except incremental marking)
1477 */
1478 if (age > 0 && wb_unprotected_bit) {
1479 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is not WB protected, but age is %d > 0.\n", obj_info(obj), age);
1480 err++;
1481 }
1482
1483 if (!is_marking(objspace) && uncollectible_bit && !mark_bit) {
1484 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is uncollectible, but is not marked while !gc.\n", obj_info(obj));
1485 err++;
1486 }
1487
1488 if (!is_full_marking(objspace)) {
1489 if (uncollectible_bit && age != RVALUE_OLD_AGE && !wb_unprotected_bit) {
1490 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is uncollectible, but not old (age: %d) and not WB unprotected.\n",
1491 obj_info(obj), age);
1492 err++;
1493 }
1494 if (remembered_bit && age != RVALUE_OLD_AGE) {
1495 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is remembered, but not old (age: %d).\n",
1496 obj_info(obj), age);
1497 err++;
1498 }
1499 }
1500
1501 /*
1502 * check coloring
1503 *
1504 * marking:false marking:true
1505 * marked:false white *invalid*
1506 * marked:true black grey
1507 */
1508 if (is_incremental_marking(objspace) && marking_bit) {
1509 if (!is_marking(objspace) && !mark_bit) {
1510 fprintf(stderr, "check_rvalue_consistency: %s is marking, but not marked.\n", obj_info(obj));
1511 err++;
1512 }
1513 }
1514 }
1515 }
1516 RB_VM_LOCK_LEAVE_NO_BARRIER();
1517
1518 if (err > 0 && terminate) {
1519 rb_bug("check_rvalue_consistency_force: there is %d errors.", err);
1520 }
1521 return err;
1522}
1523
1524#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE == 0
1525static inline VALUE
1526check_rvalue_consistency(const VALUE obj)
1527{
1528 return obj;
1529}
1530#else
1531static VALUE
1532check_rvalue_consistency(const VALUE obj)
1533{
1534 check_rvalue_consistency_force(obj, TRUE);
1535 return obj;
1536}
1537#endif
1538
1539static inline int
1540gc_object_moved_p(rb_objspace_t * objspace, VALUE obj)
1541{
1542 if (RB_SPECIAL_CONST_P(obj)) {
1543 return FALSE;
1544 }
1545 else {
1546 void *poisoned = asan_poisoned_object_p(obj);
1547 asan_unpoison_object(obj, false);
1548
1549 int ret = BUILTIN_TYPE(obj) == T_MOVED;
1550 /* Re-poison slot if it's not the one we want */
1551 if (poisoned) {
1552 GC_ASSERT(BUILTIN_TYPE(obj) == T_NONE);
1553 asan_poison_object(obj);
1554 }
1555 return ret;
1556 }
1557}
1558
1559static inline int
1560RVALUE_MARKED(VALUE obj)
1561{
1562 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1563 return RVALUE_MARK_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1564}
1565
1566static inline int
1567RVALUE_PINNED(VALUE obj)
1568{
1569 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1570 return RVALUE_PIN_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1571}
1572
1573static inline int
1574RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED(VALUE obj)
1575{
1576 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1577 return RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1578}
1579
1580static inline int
1581RVALUE_MARKING(VALUE obj)
1582{
1583 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1584 return RVALUE_MARKING_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1585}
1586
1587static inline int
1588RVALUE_REMEMBERED(VALUE obj)
1589{
1590 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1591 return RVALUE_MARKING_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1592}
1593
1594static inline int
1595RVALUE_UNCOLLECTIBLE(VALUE obj)
1596{
1597 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1598 return RVALUE_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITMAP(obj) != 0;
1599}
1600
1601static inline int
1602RVALUE_OLD_P_RAW(VALUE obj)
1603{
1604 const VALUE promoted = FL_PROMOTED0 | FL_PROMOTED1;
1605 return (RBASIC(obj)->flags & promoted) == promoted;
1606}
1607
1608static inline int
1609RVALUE_OLD_P(VALUE obj)
1610{
1611 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1612 return RVALUE_OLD_P_RAW(obj);
1613}
1614
1615#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE || GC_DEBUG
1616static inline int
1617RVALUE_AGE(VALUE obj)
1618{
1619 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1620 return RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE(RBASIC(obj)->flags);
1621}
1622#endif
1623
1624static inline void
1625RVALUE_PAGE_OLD_UNCOLLECTIBLE_SET(rb_objspace_t *objspace, struct heap_page *page, VALUE obj)
1626{
1627 MARK_IN_BITMAP(&page->uncollectible_bits[0], obj);
1628 objspace->rgengc.old_objects++;
1629 rb_transient_heap_promote(obj);
1630
1631#if RGENGC_PROFILE >= 2
1632 objspace->profile.total_promoted_count++;
1633 objspace->profile.promoted_types[BUILTIN_TYPE(obj)]++;
1634#endif
1635}
1636
1637static inline void
1638RVALUE_OLD_UNCOLLECTIBLE_SET(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
1639{
1640 RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC(obj_promote);
1641 RVALUE_PAGE_OLD_UNCOLLECTIBLE_SET(objspace, GET_HEAP_PAGE(obj), obj);
1642}
1643
1644static inline VALUE
1645RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE_SET(VALUE flags, int age)
1646{
1647 flags &= ~(FL_PROMOTED0 | FL_PROMOTED1);
1648 flags |= (age << RVALUE_AGE_SHIFT);
1649 return flags;
1650}
1651
1652/* set age to age+1 */
1653static inline void
1654RVALUE_AGE_INC(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
1655{
1656 VALUE flags = RBASIC(obj)->flags;
1657 int age = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE(flags);
1658
1659 if (RGENGC_CHECK_MODE && age == RVALUE_OLD_AGE) {
1660 rb_bug("RVALUE_AGE_INC: can not increment age of OLD object %s.", obj_info(obj));
1661 }
1662
1663 age++;
1664 RBASIC(obj)->flags = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE_SET(flags, age);
1665
1666 if (age == RVALUE_OLD_AGE) {
1667 RVALUE_OLD_UNCOLLECTIBLE_SET(objspace, obj);
1668 }
1669 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1670}
1671
1672/* set age to RVALUE_OLD_AGE */
1673static inline void
1674RVALUE_AGE_SET_OLD(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
1675{
1676 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1677 GC_ASSERT(!RVALUE_OLD_P(obj));
1678
1679 RBASIC(obj)->flags = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE_SET(RBASIC(obj)->flags, RVALUE_OLD_AGE);
1680 RVALUE_OLD_UNCOLLECTIBLE_SET(objspace, obj);
1681
1682 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1683}
1684
1685/* set age to RVALUE_OLD_AGE - 1 */
1686static inline void
1687RVALUE_AGE_SET_CANDIDATE(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
1688{
1689 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1690 GC_ASSERT(!RVALUE_OLD_P(obj));
1691
1692 RBASIC(obj)->flags = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE_SET(RBASIC(obj)->flags, RVALUE_OLD_AGE - 1);
1693
1694 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1695}
1696
1697static inline void
1698RVALUE_DEMOTE_RAW(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
1699{
1700 RBASIC(obj)->flags = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE_SET(RBASIC(obj)->flags, 0);
1701 CLEAR_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITS(obj), obj);
1702}
1703
1704static inline void
1705RVALUE_DEMOTE(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
1706{
1707 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1708 GC_ASSERT(RVALUE_OLD_P(obj));
1709
1710 if (!is_incremental_marking(objspace) && RVALUE_REMEMBERED(obj)) {
1711 CLEAR_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_MARKING_BITS(obj), obj);
1712 }
1713
1714 RVALUE_DEMOTE_RAW(objspace, obj);
1715
1716 if (RVALUE_MARKED(obj)) {
1717 objspace->rgengc.old_objects--;
1718 }
1719
1720 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1721}
1722
1723static inline void
1724RVALUE_AGE_RESET_RAW(VALUE obj)
1725{
1726 RBASIC(obj)->flags = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE_SET(RBASIC(obj)->flags, 0);
1727}
1728
1729static inline void
1730RVALUE_AGE_RESET(VALUE obj)
1731{
1732 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1733 GC_ASSERT(!RVALUE_OLD_P(obj));
1734
1735 RVALUE_AGE_RESET_RAW(obj);
1736 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
1737}
1738
1739static inline int
1740RVALUE_BLACK_P(VALUE obj)
1741{
1742 return RVALUE_MARKED(obj) && !RVALUE_MARKING(obj);
1743}
1744
1745#if 0
1746static inline int
1747RVALUE_GREY_P(VALUE obj)
1748{
1749 return RVALUE_MARKED(obj) && RVALUE_MARKING(obj);
1750}
1751#endif
1752
1753static inline int
1754RVALUE_WHITE_P(VALUE obj)
1755{
1756 return RVALUE_MARKED(obj) == FALSE;
1757}
1758
1759/*
1760 --------------------------- ObjectSpace -----------------------------
1761*/
1762
1763static inline void *
1764calloc1(size_t n)
1765{
1766 return calloc(1, n);
1767}
1768
1769rb_objspace_t *
1770rb_objspace_alloc(void)
1771{
1772 rb_objspace_t *objspace = calloc1(sizeof(rb_objspace_t));
1773 objspace->flags.measure_gc = 1;
1774 malloc_limit = gc_params.malloc_limit_min;
1775
1776 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1777 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1778
1779 size_pool->slot_size = (1 << i) * BASE_SLOT_SIZE;
1780
1781 ccan_list_head_init(&SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool)->pages);
1782 ccan_list_head_init(&SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool)->pages);
1783 }
1784
1785 dont_gc_on();
1786
1787 return objspace;
1788}
1789
1790static void free_stack_chunks(mark_stack_t *);
1791static void mark_stack_free_cache(mark_stack_t *);
1792static void heap_page_free(rb_objspace_t *objspace, struct heap_page *page);
1793
1794void
1795rb_objspace_free(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1796{
1797 if (is_lazy_sweeping(objspace))
1798 rb_bug("lazy sweeping underway when freeing object space");
1799
1800 if (objspace->profile.records) {
1801 free(objspace->profile.records);
1802 objspace->profile.records = 0;
1803 }
1804
1805 if (global_list) {
1806 struct gc_list *list, *next;
1807 for (list = global_list; list; list = next) {
1808 next = list->next;
1809 xfree(list);
1810 }
1811 }
1812 if (heap_pages_sorted) {
1813 size_t i;
1814 for (i = 0; i < heap_allocated_pages; ++i) {
1815 heap_page_free(objspace, heap_pages_sorted[i]);
1816 }
1817 free(heap_pages_sorted);
1818 heap_allocated_pages = 0;
1819 heap_pages_sorted_length = 0;
1820 heap_pages_lomem = 0;
1821 heap_pages_himem = 0;
1822
1823 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1824 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1825 SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool)->total_pages = 0;
1826 SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool)->total_slots = 0;
1827 }
1828 }
1829 st_free_table(objspace->id_to_obj_tbl);
1830 st_free_table(objspace->obj_to_id_tbl);
1831
1832 free_stack_chunks(&objspace->mark_stack);
1833 mark_stack_free_cache(&objspace->mark_stack);
1834
1835 free(objspace);
1836}
1837
1838static void
1839heap_pages_expand_sorted_to(rb_objspace_t *objspace, size_t next_length)
1840{
1841 struct heap_page **sorted;
1842 size_t size = size_mul_or_raise(next_length, sizeof(struct heap_page *), rb_eRuntimeError);
1843
1844 gc_report(3, objspace, "heap_pages_expand_sorted: next_length: %"PRIdSIZE", size: %"PRIdSIZE"\n",
1845 next_length, size);
1846
1847 if (heap_pages_sorted_length > 0) {
1848 sorted = (struct heap_page **)realloc(heap_pages_sorted, size);
1849 if (sorted) heap_pages_sorted = sorted;
1850 }
1851 else {
1852 sorted = heap_pages_sorted = (struct heap_page **)malloc(size);
1853 }
1854
1855 if (sorted == 0) {
1856 rb_memerror();
1857 }
1858
1859 heap_pages_sorted_length = next_length;
1860}
1861
1862static void
1863heap_pages_expand_sorted(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1864{
1865 /* usually heap_allocatable_pages + heap_eden->total_pages == heap_pages_sorted_length
1866 * because heap_allocatable_pages contains heap_tomb->total_pages (recycle heap_tomb pages).
1867 * however, if there are pages which do not have empty slots, then try to create new pages
1868 * so that the additional allocatable_pages counts (heap_tomb->total_pages) are added.
1869 */
1870 size_t next_length = heap_allocatable_pages(objspace);
1871 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1872 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
1873 next_length += SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool)->total_pages;
1874 next_length += SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool)->total_pages;
1875 }
1876
1877 if (next_length > heap_pages_sorted_length) {
1878 heap_pages_expand_sorted_to(objspace, next_length);
1879 }
1880
1881 GC_ASSERT(heap_allocatable_pages(objspace) + heap_eden_total_pages(objspace) <= heap_pages_sorted_length);
1882 GC_ASSERT(heap_allocated_pages <= heap_pages_sorted_length);
1883}
1884
1885static void
1886size_pool_allocatable_pages_set(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, size_t s)
1887{
1888 size_pool->allocatable_pages = s;
1889 heap_pages_expand_sorted(objspace);
1890}
1891
1892static inline void
1893heap_page_add_freeobj(rb_objspace_t *objspace, struct heap_page *page, VALUE obj)
1894{
1895 ASSERT_vm_locking();
1896
1897 RVALUE *p = (RVALUE *)obj;
1898
1899 asan_unpoison_object(obj, false);
1900
1901 asan_unpoison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*), false);
1902
1903 p->as.free.flags = 0;
1904 p->as.free.next = page->freelist;
1905 page->freelist = p;
1906 asan_poison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*));
1907
1908 if (RGENGC_CHECK_MODE &&
1909 /* obj should belong to page */
1910 !(page->start <= (uintptr_t)obj &&
1911 (uintptr_t)obj < ((uintptr_t)page->start + (page->total_slots * page->slot_size)) &&
1912 obj % BASE_SLOT_SIZE == 0)) {
1913 rb_bug("heap_page_add_freeobj: %p is not rvalue.", (void *)p);
1914 }
1915
1916 asan_poison_object(obj);
1917 gc_report(3, objspace, "heap_page_add_freeobj: add %p to freelist\n", (void *)obj);
1918}
1919
1920static inline void
1921heap_add_freepage(rb_heap_t *heap, struct heap_page *page)
1922{
1923 asan_unpoison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*), false);
1924 GC_ASSERT(page->free_slots != 0);
1925 GC_ASSERT(page->freelist != NULL);
1926
1927 page->free_next = heap->free_pages;
1928 heap->free_pages = page;
1929
1930 RUBY_DEBUG_LOG("page:%p freelist:%p", (void *)page, (void *)page->freelist);
1931
1932 asan_poison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*));
1933}
1934
1935#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
1936static inline void
1937heap_add_poolpage(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_heap_t *heap, struct heap_page *page)
1938{
1939 asan_unpoison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*), false);
1940 GC_ASSERT(page->free_slots != 0);
1941 GC_ASSERT(page->freelist != NULL);
1942
1943 page->free_next = heap->pooled_pages;
1944 heap->pooled_pages = page;
1945 objspace->rincgc.pooled_slots += page->free_slots;
1946
1947 asan_poison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*));
1948}
1949#endif
1950
1951static void
1952heap_unlink_page(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_heap_t *heap, struct heap_page *page)
1953{
1954 ccan_list_del(&page->page_node);
1955 heap->total_pages--;
1956 heap->total_slots -= page->total_slots;
1957}
1958
1959static void rb_aligned_free(void *ptr, size_t size);
1960
1961static void
1962heap_page_body_free(struct heap_page_body *page_body)
1963{
1964 GC_ASSERT((uintptr_t)page_body % HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN == 0);
1965
1966#ifdef HAVE_MMAP
1967 if (HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP) {
1968 GC_ASSERT(HEAP_PAGE_SIZE % sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE) == 0);
1969 if (munmap(page_body, HEAP_PAGE_SIZE)) {
1970 rb_bug("heap_page_body_free: munmap failed");
1971 }
1972 }
1973 else {
1974 rb_aligned_free(page_body, HEAP_PAGE_SIZE);
1975 }
1976#else
1977 rb_aligned_free(page_body, HEAP_PAGE_SIZE);
1978#endif
1979}
1980
1981static void
1982heap_page_free(rb_objspace_t *objspace, struct heap_page *page)
1983{
1984 heap_allocated_pages--;
1985 page->size_pool->total_freed_pages++;
1986 heap_page_body_free(GET_PAGE_BODY(page->start));
1987 free(page);
1988}
1989
1990static void
1991heap_pages_free_unused_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
1992{
1993 size_t i, j;
1994
1995 bool has_pages_in_tomb_heap = FALSE;
1996 for (i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
1997 if (!ccan_list_empty(&SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(&size_pools[i])->pages)) {
1998 has_pages_in_tomb_heap = TRUE;
1999 break;
2000 }
2001 }
2002
2003 if (has_pages_in_tomb_heap) {
2004 for (i = j = 1; j < heap_allocated_pages; i++) {
2005 struct heap_page *page = heap_pages_sorted[i];
2006
2007 if (page->flags.in_tomb && page->free_slots == page->total_slots) {
2008 heap_unlink_page(objspace, SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(page->size_pool), page);
2009 heap_page_free(objspace, page);
2010 }
2011 else {
2012 if (i != j) {
2013 heap_pages_sorted[j] = page;
2014 }
2015 j++;
2016 }
2017 }
2018
2019 struct heap_page *hipage = heap_pages_sorted[heap_allocated_pages - 1];
2020 uintptr_t himem = (uintptr_t)hipage->start + (hipage->total_slots * hipage->slot_size);
2021 GC_ASSERT(himem <= heap_pages_himem);
2022 heap_pages_himem = himem;
2023
2024 GC_ASSERT(j == heap_allocated_pages);
2025 }
2026}
2027
2028static struct heap_page_body *
2029heap_page_body_allocate(void)
2030{
2031 struct heap_page_body *page_body;
2032
2033#ifdef HAVE_MMAP
2034 if (HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP) {
2035 GC_ASSERT(HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN % sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE) == 0);
2036
2037 char *ptr = mmap(NULL, HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN + HEAP_PAGE_SIZE,
2038 PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_PRIVATE | MAP_ANONYMOUS, -1, 0);
2039 if (ptr == MAP_FAILED) {
2040 return NULL;
2041 }
2042
2043 char *aligned = ptr + HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN;
2044 aligned -= ((VALUE)aligned & (HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN - 1));
2045 GC_ASSERT(aligned > ptr);
2046 GC_ASSERT(aligned <= ptr + HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN);
2047
2048 size_t start_out_of_range_size = aligned - ptr;
2049 GC_ASSERT(start_out_of_range_size % sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE) == 0);
2050 if (start_out_of_range_size > 0) {
2051 if (munmap(ptr, start_out_of_range_size)) {
2052 rb_bug("heap_page_body_allocate: munmap failed for start");
2053 }
2054 }
2055
2056 size_t end_out_of_range_size = HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN - start_out_of_range_size;
2057 GC_ASSERT(end_out_of_range_size % sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE) == 0);
2058 if (end_out_of_range_size > 0) {
2059 if (munmap(aligned + HEAP_PAGE_SIZE, end_out_of_range_size)) {
2060 rb_bug("heap_page_body_allocate: munmap failed for end");
2061 }
2062 }
2063
2064 page_body = (struct heap_page_body *)aligned;
2065 }
2066 else {
2067 page_body = rb_aligned_malloc(HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN, HEAP_PAGE_SIZE);
2068 }
2069#else
2070 page_body = rb_aligned_malloc(HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN, HEAP_PAGE_SIZE);
2071#endif
2072
2073 GC_ASSERT((uintptr_t)page_body % HEAP_PAGE_ALIGN == 0);
2074
2075 return page_body;
2076}
2077
2078static struct heap_page *
2079heap_page_allocate(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool)
2080{
2081 uintptr_t start, end, p;
2082 struct heap_page *page;
2083 uintptr_t hi, lo, mid;
2084 size_t stride = size_pool->slot_size;
2085 unsigned int limit = (unsigned int)((HEAP_PAGE_SIZE - sizeof(struct heap_page_header)))/(int)stride;
2086
2087 /* assign heap_page body (contains heap_page_header and RVALUEs) */
2088 struct heap_page_body *page_body = heap_page_body_allocate();
2089 if (page_body == 0) {
2090 rb_memerror();
2091 }
2092
2093 /* assign heap_page entry */
2094 page = calloc1(sizeof(struct heap_page));
2095 if (page == 0) {
2096 heap_page_body_free(page_body);
2097 rb_memerror();
2098 }
2099
2100 /* adjust obj_limit (object number available in this page) */
2101 start = (uintptr_t)((VALUE)page_body + sizeof(struct heap_page_header));
2102
2103 if (start % BASE_SLOT_SIZE != 0) {
2104 int delta = BASE_SLOT_SIZE - (start % BASE_SLOT_SIZE);
2105 start = start + delta;
2106 GC_ASSERT(NUM_IN_PAGE(start) == 0 || NUM_IN_PAGE(start) == 1);
2107
2108 /* Find a num in page that is evenly divisible by `stride`.
2109 * This is to ensure that objects are aligned with bit planes.
2110 * In other words, ensure there are an even number of objects
2111 * per bit plane. */
2112 if (NUM_IN_PAGE(start) == 1) {
2113 start += stride - BASE_SLOT_SIZE;
2114 }
2115
2116 GC_ASSERT(NUM_IN_PAGE(start) * BASE_SLOT_SIZE % stride == 0);
2117
2118 limit = (HEAP_PAGE_SIZE - (int)(start - (uintptr_t)page_body))/(int)stride;
2119 }
2120 end = start + (limit * (int)stride);
2121
2122 /* setup heap_pages_sorted */
2123 lo = 0;
2124 hi = (uintptr_t)heap_allocated_pages;
2125 while (lo < hi) {
2126 struct heap_page *mid_page;
2127
2128 mid = (lo + hi) / 2;
2129 mid_page = heap_pages_sorted[mid];
2130 if ((uintptr_t)mid_page->start < start) {
2131 lo = mid + 1;
2132 }
2133 else if ((uintptr_t)mid_page->start > start) {
2134 hi = mid;
2135 }
2136 else {
2137 rb_bug("same heap page is allocated: %p at %"PRIuVALUE, (void *)page_body, (VALUE)mid);
2138 }
2139 }
2140
2141 if (hi < (uintptr_t)heap_allocated_pages) {
2142 MEMMOVE(&heap_pages_sorted[hi+1], &heap_pages_sorted[hi], struct heap_page_header*, heap_allocated_pages - hi);
2143 }
2144
2145 heap_pages_sorted[hi] = page;
2146
2147 heap_allocated_pages++;
2148
2149 GC_ASSERT(heap_eden_total_pages(objspace) + heap_allocatable_pages(objspace) <= heap_pages_sorted_length);
2150 GC_ASSERT(heap_eden_total_pages(objspace) + heap_tomb_total_pages(objspace) == heap_allocated_pages - 1);
2151 GC_ASSERT(heap_allocated_pages <= heap_pages_sorted_length);
2152
2153 size_pool->total_allocated_pages++;
2154
2155 if (heap_allocated_pages > heap_pages_sorted_length) {
2156 rb_bug("heap_page_allocate: allocated(%"PRIdSIZE") > sorted(%"PRIdSIZE")",
2157 heap_allocated_pages, heap_pages_sorted_length);
2158 }
2159
2160 if (heap_pages_lomem == 0 || heap_pages_lomem > start) heap_pages_lomem = start;
2161 if (heap_pages_himem < end) heap_pages_himem = end;
2162
2163 page->start = start;
2164 page->total_slots = limit;
2165 page->slot_size = size_pool->slot_size;
2166 page->size_pool = size_pool;
2167 page_body->header.page = page;
2168
2169 for (p = start; p != end; p += stride) {
2170 gc_report(3, objspace, "assign_heap_page: %p is added to freelist\n", (void *)p);
2171 heap_page_add_freeobj(objspace, page, (VALUE)p);
2172 }
2173 page->free_slots = limit;
2174
2175 asan_poison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*));
2176 return page;
2177}
2178
2179static struct heap_page *
2180heap_page_resurrect(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool)
2181{
2182 struct heap_page *page = 0, *next;
2183
2184 ccan_list_for_each_safe(&SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool)->pages, page, next, page_node) {
2185 asan_unpoison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*), false);
2186 if (page->freelist != NULL) {
2187 heap_unlink_page(objspace, &size_pool->tomb_heap, page);
2188 asan_poison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*));
2189 return page;
2190 }
2191 }
2192
2193 return NULL;
2194}
2195
2196static struct heap_page *
2197heap_page_create(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool)
2198{
2199 struct heap_page *page;
2200 const char *method = "recycle";
2201
2202 size_pool->allocatable_pages--;
2203
2204 page = heap_page_resurrect(objspace, size_pool);
2205
2206 if (page == NULL) {
2207 page = heap_page_allocate(objspace, size_pool);
2208 method = "allocate";
2209 }
2210 if (0) fprintf(stderr, "heap_page_create: %s - %p, "
2211 "heap_allocated_pages: %"PRIdSIZE", "
2212 "heap_allocated_pages: %"PRIdSIZE", "
2213 "tomb->total_pages: %"PRIdSIZE"\n",
2214 method, (void *)page, heap_pages_sorted_length, heap_allocated_pages, SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool)->total_pages);
2215 return page;
2216}
2217
2218static void
2219heap_add_page(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap, struct heap_page *page)
2220{
2221 /* Adding to eden heap during incremental sweeping is forbidden */
2222 GC_ASSERT(!(heap == SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool) && heap->sweeping_page));
2223 page->flags.in_tomb = (heap == SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool));
2224 ccan_list_add_tail(&heap->pages, &page->page_node);
2225 heap->total_pages++;
2226 heap->total_slots += page->total_slots;
2227}
2228
2229static void
2230heap_assign_page(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap)
2231{
2232 struct heap_page *page = heap_page_create(objspace, size_pool);
2233 heap_add_page(objspace, size_pool, heap, page);
2234 heap_add_freepage(heap, page);
2235}
2236
2237static void
2238heap_add_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap, size_t add)
2239{
2240 size_t i;
2241
2242 size_pool_allocatable_pages_set(objspace, size_pool, add);
2243
2244 for (i = 0; i < add; i++) {
2245 heap_assign_page(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2246 }
2247
2248 GC_ASSERT(size_pool->allocatable_pages == 0);
2249}
2250
2251static size_t
2252heap_extend_pages(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, size_t free_slots, size_t total_slots, size_t used)
2253{
2254 double goal_ratio = gc_params.heap_free_slots_goal_ratio;
2255 size_t next_used;
2256
2257 if (goal_ratio == 0.0) {
2258 next_used = (size_t)(used * gc_params.growth_factor);
2259 }
2260 else if (total_slots == 0) {
2261 int multiple = size_pool->slot_size / BASE_SLOT_SIZE;
2262 next_used = (gc_params.heap_init_slots * multiple) / HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT;
2263 }
2264 else {
2265 /* Find `f' where free_slots = f * total_slots * goal_ratio
2266 * => f = (total_slots - free_slots) / ((1 - goal_ratio) * total_slots)
2267 */
2268 double f = (double)(total_slots - free_slots) / ((1 - goal_ratio) * total_slots);
2269
2270 if (f > gc_params.growth_factor) f = gc_params.growth_factor;
2271 if (f < 1.0) f = 1.1;
2272
2273 next_used = (size_t)(f * used);
2274
2275 if (0) {
2276 fprintf(stderr,
2277 "free_slots(%8"PRIuSIZE")/total_slots(%8"PRIuSIZE")=%1.2f,"
2278 " G(%1.2f), f(%1.2f),"
2279 " used(%8"PRIuSIZE") => next_used(%8"PRIuSIZE")\n",
2280 free_slots, total_slots, free_slots/(double)total_slots,
2281 goal_ratio, f, used, next_used);
2282 }
2283 }
2284
2285 if (gc_params.growth_max_slots > 0) {
2286 size_t max_used = (size_t)(used + gc_params.growth_max_slots/HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT);
2287 if (next_used > max_used) next_used = max_used;
2288 }
2289
2290 size_t extend_page_count = next_used - used;
2291 /* Extend by at least 1 page. */
2292 if (extend_page_count == 0) extend_page_count = 1;
2293
2294 return extend_page_count;
2295}
2296
2297static int
2298heap_increment(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap)
2299{
2300 if (size_pool->allocatable_pages > 0) {
2301 gc_report(1, objspace, "heap_increment: heap_pages_sorted_length: %"PRIdSIZE", "
2302 "heap_pages_inc: %"PRIdSIZE", heap->total_pages: %"PRIdSIZE"\n",
2303 heap_pages_sorted_length, size_pool->allocatable_pages, heap->total_pages);
2304
2305 GC_ASSERT(heap_allocatable_pages(objspace) + heap_eden_total_pages(objspace) <= heap_pages_sorted_length);
2306 GC_ASSERT(heap_allocated_pages <= heap_pages_sorted_length);
2307
2308 heap_assign_page(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2309 return TRUE;
2310 }
2311 return FALSE;
2312}
2313
2314static void
2315gc_continue(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap)
2316{
2317 /* Continue marking if in incremental marking. */
2318 if (heap->free_pages == NULL && is_incremental_marking(objspace)) {
2319 gc_marks_continue(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2320 }
2321
2322 /* Continue sweeping if in lazy sweeping or the previous incremental
2323 * marking finished and did not yield a free page. */
2324 if (heap->free_pages == NULL && is_lazy_sweeping(objspace)) {
2325 gc_sweep_continue(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2326 }
2327}
2328
2329static void
2330heap_prepare(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap)
2331{
2332 GC_ASSERT(heap->free_pages == NULL);
2333
2334 /* Continue incremental marking or lazy sweeping, if in any of those steps. */
2335 gc_continue(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2336
2337 /* If we still don't have a free page and not allowed to create a new page,
2338 * we should start a new GC cycle. */
2339 if (heap->free_pages == NULL &&
2340 (will_be_incremental_marking(objspace) ||
2341 (heap_increment(objspace, size_pool, heap) == FALSE))) {
2342 if (gc_start(objspace, GPR_FLAG_NEWOBJ) == FALSE) {
2343 rb_memerror();
2344 }
2345 else {
2346 /* Do steps of incremental marking or lazy sweeping if the GC run permits. */
2347 gc_continue(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2348
2349 /* If we're not incremental marking (e.g. a minor GC) or finished
2350 * sweeping and still don't have a free page, then
2351 * gc_sweep_finish_size_pool should allow us to create a new page. */
2352 if (heap->free_pages == NULL && !heap_increment(objspace, size_pool, heap)) {
2353 if (objspace->rgengc.need_major_gc == GPR_FLAG_NONE) {
2354 rb_bug("cannot create a new page after GC");
2355 }
2356 else { // Major GC is required, which will allow us to create new page
2357 if (gc_start(objspace, GPR_FLAG_NEWOBJ) == FALSE) {
2358 rb_memerror();
2359 }
2360 else {
2361 /* Do steps of incremental marking or lazy sweeping. */
2362 gc_continue(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2363
2364 if (heap->free_pages == NULL &&
2365 !heap_increment(objspace, size_pool, heap)) {
2366 rb_bug("cannot create a new page after major GC");
2367 }
2368 }
2369 }
2370 }
2371 }
2372 }
2373
2374 GC_ASSERT(heap->free_pages != NULL);
2375}
2376
2377void
2378rb_objspace_set_event_hook(const rb_event_flag_t event)
2379{
2380 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
2381 objspace->hook_events = event & RUBY_INTERNAL_EVENT_OBJSPACE_MASK;
2382 objspace->flags.has_hook = (objspace->hook_events != 0);
2383}
2384
2385static void
2386gc_event_hook_body(rb_execution_context_t *ec, rb_objspace_t *objspace, const rb_event_flag_t event, VALUE data)
2387{
2388 const VALUE *pc = ec->cfp->pc;
2389 if (pc && VM_FRAME_RUBYFRAME_P(ec->cfp)) {
2390 /* increment PC because source line is calculated with PC-1 */
2391 ec->cfp->pc++;
2392 }
2393 EXEC_EVENT_HOOK(ec, event, ec->cfp->self, 0, 0, 0, data);
2394 ec->cfp->pc = pc;
2395}
2396
2397#define gc_event_hook_available_p(objspace) ((objspace)->flags.has_hook)
2398#define gc_event_hook_needed_p(objspace, event) ((objspace)->hook_events & (event))
2399
2400#define gc_event_hook_prep(objspace, event, data, prep) do { \
2401 if (UNLIKELY(gc_event_hook_needed_p(objspace, event))) { \
2402 prep; \
2403 gc_event_hook_body(GET_EC(), (objspace), (event), (data)); \
2404 } \
2405} while (0)
2406
2407#define gc_event_hook(objspace, event, data) gc_event_hook_prep(objspace, event, data, (void)0)
2408
2409static inline VALUE
2410newobj_init(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, int wb_protected, rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
2411{
2412#if !__has_feature(memory_sanitizer)
2413 GC_ASSERT(BUILTIN_TYPE(obj) == T_NONE);
2414 GC_ASSERT((flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED) == 0);
2415#endif
2416 RVALUE *p = RANY(obj);
2417 p->as.basic.flags = flags;
2418 *((VALUE *)&p->as.basic.klass) = klass;
2419
2420#if RACTOR_CHECK_MODE
2421 rb_ractor_setup_belonging(obj);
2422#endif
2423
2424#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE
2425 p->as.values.v1 = p->as.values.v2 = p->as.values.v3 = 0;
2426
2427 RB_VM_LOCK_ENTER_NO_BARRIER();
2428 {
2429 check_rvalue_consistency(obj);
2430
2431 GC_ASSERT(RVALUE_MARKED(obj) == FALSE);
2432 GC_ASSERT(RVALUE_MARKING(obj) == FALSE);
2433 GC_ASSERT(RVALUE_OLD_P(obj) == FALSE);
2434 GC_ASSERT(RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED(obj) == FALSE);
2435
2436 if (flags & FL_PROMOTED1) {
2437 if (RVALUE_AGE(obj) != 2) rb_bug("newobj: %s of age (%d) != 2.", obj_info(obj), RVALUE_AGE(obj));
2438 }
2439 else {
2440 if (RVALUE_AGE(obj) > 0) rb_bug("newobj: %s of age (%d) > 0.", obj_info(obj), RVALUE_AGE(obj));
2441 }
2442 if (rgengc_remembered(objspace, (VALUE)obj)) rb_bug("newobj: %s is remembered.", obj_info(obj));
2443 }
2444 RB_VM_LOCK_LEAVE_NO_BARRIER();
2445#endif
2446
2447 if (UNLIKELY(wb_protected == FALSE)) {
2448 ASSERT_vm_locking();
2449 MARK_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITS(obj), obj);
2450 }
2451
2452 // TODO: make it atomic, or ractor local
2453 objspace->total_allocated_objects++;
2454
2455#if RGENGC_PROFILE
2456 if (wb_protected) {
2457 objspace->profile.total_generated_normal_object_count++;
2458#if RGENGC_PROFILE >= 2
2459 objspace->profile.generated_normal_object_count_types[BUILTIN_TYPE(obj)]++;
2460#endif
2461 }
2462 else {
2463 objspace->profile.total_generated_shady_object_count++;
2464#if RGENGC_PROFILE >= 2
2465 objspace->profile.generated_shady_object_count_types[BUILTIN_TYPE(obj)]++;
2466#endif
2467 }
2468#endif
2469
2470#if GC_DEBUG
2471 RANY(obj)->file = rb_source_location_cstr(&RANY(obj)->line);
2472 GC_ASSERT(!SPECIAL_CONST_P(obj)); /* check alignment */
2473#endif
2474
2475 gc_report(5, objspace, "newobj: %s\n", obj_info(obj));
2476
2477#if RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK > 0
2478 {
2479 static int newobj_cnt = RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK;
2480
2481 if (!is_incremental_marking(objspace) &&
2482 flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED && /* do not promote WB unprotected objects */
2483 ! RB_TYPE_P(obj, T_ARRAY)) { /* array.c assumes that allocated objects are new */
2484 if (--newobj_cnt == 0) {
2485 newobj_cnt = RGENGC_OLD_NEWOBJ_CHECK;
2486
2487 gc_mark_set(objspace, obj);
2488 RVALUE_AGE_SET_OLD(objspace, obj);
2489
2490 rb_gc_writebarrier_remember(obj);
2491 }
2492 }
2493 }
2494#endif
2495 // RUBY_DEBUG_LOG("obj:%p (%s)", (void *)obj, obj_type_name(obj));
2496 return obj;
2497}
2498
2499size_t
2500rb_gc_obj_slot_size(VALUE obj)
2501{
2502 return GET_HEAP_PAGE(obj)->slot_size;
2503}
2504
2505static inline size_t
2506size_pool_slot_size(unsigned char pool_id)
2507{
2508 GC_ASSERT(pool_id < SIZE_POOL_COUNT);
2509
2510 size_t slot_size = (1 << pool_id) * BASE_SLOT_SIZE;
2511
2512#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE
2513 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
2514 GC_ASSERT(size_pools[pool_id].slot_size == (short)slot_size);
2515#endif
2516
2517 return slot_size;
2518}
2519
2520bool
2521rb_gc_size_allocatable_p(size_t size)
2522{
2523 return size <= size_pool_slot_size(SIZE_POOL_COUNT - 1);
2524}
2525
2526static inline VALUE
2527ractor_cache_allocate_slot(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_newobj_cache_t *cache,
2528 size_t size_pool_idx)
2529{
2530 rb_ractor_newobj_size_pool_cache_t *size_pool_cache = &cache->size_pool_caches[size_pool_idx];
2531 RVALUE *p = size_pool_cache->freelist;
2532
2533#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
2534 if (is_incremental_marking(objspace)) {
2535 // Not allowed to allocate without running an incremental marking step
2536 if (cache->incremental_mark_step_allocated_slots >= INCREMENTAL_MARK_STEP_ALLOCATIONS) {
2537 return Qfalse;
2538 }
2539
2540 if (p) {
2541 cache->incremental_mark_step_allocated_slots++;
2542 }
2543 }
2544#endif
2545
2546 if (p) {
2547 VALUE obj = (VALUE)p;
2548 MAYBE_UNUSED(const size_t) stride = size_pool_slot_size(size_pool_idx);
2549 size_pool_cache->freelist = p->as.free.next;
2550#if USE_RVARGC
2551 asan_unpoison_memory_region(p, stride, true);
2552#else
2553 asan_unpoison_object(obj, true);
2554#endif
2555#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE
2556 GC_ASSERT(rb_gc_obj_slot_size(obj) == stride);
2557 // zero clear
2558 MEMZERO((char *)obj, char, stride);
2559#endif
2560 return obj;
2561 }
2562 else {
2563 return Qfalse;
2564 }
2565}
2566
2567static struct heap_page *
2568heap_next_free_page(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_size_pool_t *size_pool, rb_heap_t *heap)
2569{
2570 ASSERT_vm_locking();
2571
2572 struct heap_page *page;
2573
2574 if (heap->free_pages == NULL) {
2575 heap_prepare(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2576 }
2577
2578 page = heap->free_pages;
2579 heap->free_pages = page->free_next;
2580
2581 GC_ASSERT(page->free_slots != 0);
2582 RUBY_DEBUG_LOG("page:%p freelist:%p cnt:%d", (void *)page, (void *)page->freelist, page->free_slots);
2583
2584 asan_unpoison_memory_region(&page->freelist, sizeof(RVALUE*), false);
2585
2586 return page;
2587}
2588
2589static inline void
2590ractor_cache_set_page(rb_ractor_newobj_cache_t *cache, size_t size_pool_idx,
2591 struct heap_page *page)
2592{
2593 gc_report(3, &rb_objspace, "ractor_set_cache: Using page %p\n", (void *)GET_PAGE_BODY(page->start));
2594
2595 rb_ractor_newobj_size_pool_cache_t *size_pool_cache = &cache->size_pool_caches[size_pool_idx];
2596
2597 GC_ASSERT(size_pool_cache->freelist == NULL);
2598 GC_ASSERT(page->free_slots != 0);
2599 GC_ASSERT(page->freelist != NULL);
2600
2601 size_pool_cache->using_page = page;
2602 size_pool_cache->freelist = page->freelist;
2603 page->free_slots = 0;
2604 page->freelist = NULL;
2605
2606 asan_unpoison_object((VALUE)size_pool_cache->freelist, false);
2607 GC_ASSERT(RB_TYPE_P((VALUE)size_pool_cache->freelist, T_NONE));
2608 asan_poison_object((VALUE)size_pool_cache->freelist);
2609}
2610
2611static inline VALUE
2612newobj_fill(VALUE obj, VALUE v1, VALUE v2, VALUE v3)
2613{
2614 RVALUE *p = (RVALUE *)obj;
2615 p->as.values.v1 = v1;
2616 p->as.values.v2 = v2;
2617 p->as.values.v3 = v3;
2618 return obj;
2619}
2620
2621static inline size_t
2622size_pool_idx_for_size(size_t size)
2623{
2624#if USE_RVARGC
2625 size_t slot_count = CEILDIV(size, BASE_SLOT_SIZE);
2626
2627 /* size_pool_idx is ceil(log2(slot_count)) */
2628 size_t size_pool_idx = 64 - nlz_int64(slot_count - 1);
2629
2630 if (size_pool_idx >= SIZE_POOL_COUNT) {
2631 rb_bug("size_pool_idx_for_size: allocation size too large");
2632 }
2633
2634#if RGENGC_CHECK_MODE
2635 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
2636 GC_ASSERT(size <= (size_t)size_pools[size_pool_idx].slot_size);
2637 if (size_pool_idx > 0) GC_ASSERT(size > (size_t)size_pools[size_pool_idx - 1].slot_size);
2638#endif
2639
2640 return size_pool_idx;
2641#else
2642 GC_ASSERT(size <= sizeof(RVALUE));
2643 return 0;
2644#endif
2645}
2646
2647static VALUE
2648newobj_alloc(rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, size_t size_pool_idx, bool vm_locked)
2649{
2650 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[size_pool_idx];
2651 rb_heap_t *heap = SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool);
2652 rb_ractor_newobj_cache_t *cache = &cr->newobj_cache;
2653
2654 VALUE obj = ractor_cache_allocate_slot(objspace, cache, size_pool_idx);
2655
2656 if (UNLIKELY(obj == Qfalse)) {
2657 unsigned int lev;
2658 bool unlock_vm = false;
2659
2660 if (!vm_locked) {
2661 RB_VM_LOCK_ENTER_CR_LEV(cr, &lev);
2662 vm_locked = true;
2663 unlock_vm = true;
2664 }
2665
2666 {
2667 ASSERT_vm_locking();
2668
2669#if GC_ENABLE_INCREMENTAL_MARK
2670 if (is_incremental_marking(objspace)) {
2671 gc_marks_continue(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2672 cache->incremental_mark_step_allocated_slots = 0;
2673
2674 // Retry allocation after resetting incremental_mark_step_allocated_slots
2675 obj = ractor_cache_allocate_slot(objspace, cache, size_pool_idx);
2676 }
2677#endif
2678
2679 if (obj == Qfalse) {
2680 // Get next free page (possibly running GC)
2681 struct heap_page *page = heap_next_free_page(objspace, size_pool, heap);
2682 ractor_cache_set_page(cache, size_pool_idx, page);
2683
2684 // Retry allocation after moving to new page
2685 obj = ractor_cache_allocate_slot(objspace, cache, size_pool_idx);
2686
2687 GC_ASSERT(obj != Qfalse);
2688 }
2689 }
2690
2691 if (unlock_vm) {
2692 RB_VM_LOCK_LEAVE_CR_LEV(cr, &lev);
2693 }
2694 }
2695
2696 return obj;
2697}
2698
2699ALWAYS_INLINE(static VALUE newobj_slowpath(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, int wb_protected, size_t size_pool_idx));
2700
2701static inline VALUE
2702newobj_slowpath(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, int wb_protected, size_t size_pool_idx)
2703{
2704 VALUE obj;
2705 unsigned int lev;
2706
2707 RB_VM_LOCK_ENTER_CR_LEV(cr, &lev);
2708 {
2709 if (UNLIKELY(during_gc || ruby_gc_stressful)) {
2710 if (during_gc) {
2711 dont_gc_on();
2712 during_gc = 0;
2713 rb_bug("object allocation during garbage collection phase");
2714 }
2715
2716 if (ruby_gc_stressful) {
2717 if (!garbage_collect(objspace, GPR_FLAG_NEWOBJ)) {
2718 rb_memerror();
2719 }
2720 }
2721 }
2722
2723 obj = newobj_alloc(objspace, cr, size_pool_idx, true);
2724 newobj_init(klass, flags, wb_protected, objspace, obj);
2725
2726 gc_event_hook_prep(objspace, RUBY_INTERNAL_EVENT_NEWOBJ, obj, newobj_fill(obj, 0, 0, 0));
2727 }
2728 RB_VM_LOCK_LEAVE_CR_LEV(cr, &lev);
2729
2730 return obj;
2731}
2732
2733NOINLINE(static VALUE newobj_slowpath_wb_protected(VALUE klass, VALUE flags,
2734 rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, size_t size_pool_idx));
2735NOINLINE(static VALUE newobj_slowpath_wb_unprotected(VALUE klass, VALUE flags,
2736 rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, size_t size_pool_idx));
2737
2738static VALUE
2739newobj_slowpath_wb_protected(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, size_t size_pool_idx)
2740{
2741 return newobj_slowpath(klass, flags, objspace, cr, TRUE, size_pool_idx);
2742}
2743
2744static VALUE
2745newobj_slowpath_wb_unprotected(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, rb_objspace_t *objspace, rb_ractor_t *cr, size_t size_pool_idx)
2746{
2747 return newobj_slowpath(klass, flags, objspace, cr, FALSE, size_pool_idx);
2748}
2749
2750static inline VALUE
2751newobj_of0(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, int wb_protected, rb_ractor_t *cr, size_t alloc_size)
2752{
2753 VALUE obj;
2754 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
2755
2756 RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC(obj_newobj);
2757 (void)RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC_IF(obj_newobj_wb_unprotected, !wb_protected);
2758
2759#if GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS
2760 if (UNLIKELY(stress_to_class)) {
2761 long i, cnt = RARRAY_LEN(stress_to_class);
2762 for (i = 0; i < cnt; ++i) {
2763 if (klass == RARRAY_AREF(stress_to_class, i)) rb_memerror();
2764 }
2765 }
2766#endif
2767
2768 size_t size_pool_idx = size_pool_idx_for_size(alloc_size);
2769
2770 if (!UNLIKELY(during_gc ||
2771 ruby_gc_stressful ||
2772 gc_event_hook_available_p(objspace)) &&
2773 wb_protected) {
2774 obj = newobj_alloc(objspace, cr, size_pool_idx, false);
2775 newobj_init(klass, flags, wb_protected, objspace, obj);
2776 }
2777 else {
2778 RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC(obj_newobj_slowpath);
2779
2780 obj = wb_protected ?
2781 newobj_slowpath_wb_protected(klass, flags, objspace, cr, size_pool_idx) :
2782 newobj_slowpath_wb_unprotected(klass, flags, objspace, cr, size_pool_idx);
2783 }
2784
2785 return obj;
2786}
2787
2788static inline VALUE
2789newobj_of(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, VALUE v1, VALUE v2, VALUE v3, int wb_protected, size_t alloc_size)
2790{
2791 VALUE obj = newobj_of0(klass, flags, wb_protected, GET_RACTOR(), alloc_size);
2792 return newobj_fill(obj, v1, v2, v3);
2793}
2794
2795static inline VALUE
2796newobj_of_cr(rb_ractor_t *cr, VALUE klass, VALUE flags, VALUE v1, VALUE v2, VALUE v3, int wb_protected, size_t alloc_size)
2797{
2798 VALUE obj = newobj_of0(klass, flags, wb_protected, cr, alloc_size);
2799 return newobj_fill(obj, v1, v2, v3);
2800}
2801
2802VALUE
2803rb_wb_unprotected_newobj_of(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, size_t size)
2804{
2805 GC_ASSERT((flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED) == 0);
2806 return newobj_of(klass, flags, 0, 0, 0, FALSE, size);
2807}
2808
2809VALUE
2810rb_wb_protected_newobj_of(VALUE klass, VALUE flags, size_t size)
2811{
2812 GC_ASSERT((flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED) == 0);
2813 return newobj_of(klass, flags, 0, 0, 0, TRUE, size);
2814}
2815
2816VALUE
2817rb_ec_wb_protected_newobj_of(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE klass, VALUE flags, size_t size)
2818{
2819 GC_ASSERT((flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED) == 0);
2820 return newobj_of_cr(rb_ec_ractor_ptr(ec), klass, flags, 0, 0, 0, TRUE, size);
2821}
2822
2823/* for compatibility */
2824
2825VALUE
2826rb_newobj(void)
2827{
2828 return newobj_of(0, T_NONE, 0, 0, 0, FALSE, sizeof(RVALUE));
2829}
2830
2831VALUE
2832rb_newobj_of(VALUE klass, VALUE flags)
2833{
2834 if ((flags & RUBY_T_MASK) == T_OBJECT) {
2835 st_table *index_tbl = RCLASS_IV_INDEX_TBL(klass);
2836
2837 VALUE obj = newobj_of(klass, (flags | ROBJECT_EMBED) & ~FL_WB_PROTECTED , Qundef, Qundef, Qundef, flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED, sizeof(RVALUE));
2838
2839 if (index_tbl && index_tbl->num_entries > ROBJECT_EMBED_LEN_MAX) {
2840 rb_init_iv_list(obj);
2841 }
2842 return obj;
2843 }
2844 else {
2845 return newobj_of(klass, flags & ~FL_WB_PROTECTED, 0, 0, 0, flags & FL_WB_PROTECTED, sizeof(RVALUE));
2846 }
2847}
2848
2849#define UNEXPECTED_NODE(func) \
2850 rb_bug(#func"(): GC does not handle T_NODE 0x%x(%p) 0x%"PRIxVALUE, \
