10971 size_t value = gc_stat_internal(arg);
10972 return SIZET2NUM(value);
10973 }
10974 else if (RB_TYPE_P(arg, T_HASH)) {
10975 // ok
10976 }
10977 else {
10978 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError, "non-hash or symbol given");
10979 }
10980
10981 gc_stat_internal(arg);
10982 return arg;
10983}
10984
10985size_t
10986rb_gc_stat(VALUE key)
10987{
10988 if (SYMBOL_P(key)) {
10989 size_t value = gc_stat_internal(key);
10990 return value;
10991 }
10992 else {
10993 gc_stat_internal(key);
10994 return 0;
10995 }
10996}
10997
10998
10999enum gc_stat_heap_sym {
11000 gc_stat_heap_sym_slot_size,
11001 gc_stat_heap_sym_heap_allocatable_pages,
11002 gc_stat_heap_sym_heap_eden_pages,
11003 gc_stat_heap_sym_heap_eden_slots,
11004 gc_stat_heap_sym_heap_tomb_pages,
11005 gc_stat_heap_sym_heap_tomb_slots,
11006 gc_stat_heap_sym_total_allocated_pages,
11007 gc_stat_heap_sym_total_freed_pages,
11008 gc_stat_heap_sym_force_major_gc_count,
11009 gc_stat_heap_sym_last
11010};
11011
11012static VALUE gc_stat_heap_symbols[gc_stat_heap_sym_last];
11013
11014static void
11015setup_gc_stat_heap_symbols(void)
11016{
11017 if (gc_stat_heap_symbols[0] == 0) {
11018#define S(s) gc_stat_heap_symbols[gc_stat_heap_sym_##s] = ID2SYM(rb_intern_const(#s))
11019 S(slot_size);
11020 S(heap_allocatable_pages);
11021 S(heap_eden_pages);
11022 S(heap_eden_slots);
11023 S(heap_tomb_pages);
11024 S(heap_tomb_slots);
11025 S(total_allocated_pages);
11026 S(total_freed_pages);
11027 S(force_major_gc_count);
11028#undef S
11029 }
11030}
11031
11032static size_t
11033gc_stat_heap_internal(int size_pool_idx, VALUE hash_or_sym)
11034{
11035 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11036 VALUE hash = Qnil, key = Qnil;
11037
11038 setup_gc_stat_heap_symbols();
11039
11040 if (RB_TYPE_P(hash_or_sym, T_HASH)) {
11041 hash = hash_or_sym;
11042 }
11043 else if (SYMBOL_P(hash_or_sym)) {
11044 key = hash_or_sym;
11045 }
11046 else {
11047 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError, "non-hash or symbol argument");
11048 }
11049
11050 if (size_pool_idx < 0 || size_pool_idx >= SIZE_POOL_COUNT) {
11051 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "size pool index out of range");
11052 }
11053
11054 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[size_pool_idx];
11055
11056#define SET(name, attr) \
11057 if (key == gc_stat_heap_symbols[gc_stat_heap_sym_##name]) \
11058 return attr; \
11059 else if (hash != Qnil) \
11060 rb_hash_aset(hash, gc_stat_heap_symbols[gc_stat_heap_sym_##name], SIZET2NUM(attr));
11061
11062 SET(slot_size, size_pool->slot_size);
11063 SET(heap_allocatable_pages, size_pool->allocatable_pages);
11064 SET(heap_eden_pages, SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool)->total_pages);
11065 SET(heap_eden_slots, SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool)->total_slots);
11066 SET(heap_tomb_pages, SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool)->total_pages);
11067 SET(heap_tomb_slots, SIZE_POOL_TOMB_HEAP(size_pool)->total_slots);
11068 SET(total_allocated_pages, size_pool->total_allocated_pages);
11069 SET(total_freed_pages, size_pool->total_freed_pages);
11070 SET(force_major_gc_count, size_pool->force_major_gc_count);
11071#undef SET
11072
11073 if (!NIL_P(key)) { /* matched key should return above */
11074 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "unknown key: %"PRIsVALUE, rb_sym2str(key));
11075 }
11076
11077 return 0;
11078}
11079
11080static VALUE
11081gc_stat_heap(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE self, VALUE heap_name, VALUE arg)
11082{
11083 if (NIL_P(heap_name)) {
11084 if (NIL_P(arg)) {
11085 arg = rb_hash_new();
11086 }
11087 else if (RB_TYPE_P(arg, T_HASH)) {
11088 // ok
11089 }
11090 else {
11091 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError, "non-hash given");
11092 }
11093
11094 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
11095 VALUE hash = rb_hash_aref(arg, INT2FIX(i));
11096 if (NIL_P(hash)) {
11097 hash = rb_hash_new();
11098 rb_hash_aset(arg, INT2FIX(i), hash);
11099 }
11100 gc_stat_heap_internal(i, hash);
11101 }
11102 }
11103 else if (FIXNUM_P(heap_name)) {
11104 int size_pool_idx = FIX2INT(heap_name);
11105
11106 if (NIL_P(arg)) {
11107 arg = rb_hash_new();
11108 }
11109 else if (SYMBOL_P(arg)) {
11110 size_t value = gc_stat_heap_internal(size_pool_idx, arg);
11111 return SIZET2NUM(value);
11112 }
11113 else if (RB_TYPE_P(arg, T_HASH)) {
11114 // ok
11115 }
11116 else {
11117 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError, "non-hash or symbol given");
11118 }
11119
11120 gc_stat_heap_internal(size_pool_idx, arg);
11121 }
11122 else {
11123 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError, "heap_name must be nil or an Integer");
11124 }
11125
11126 return arg;
11127}
11128
11129static VALUE
11130gc_stress_get(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE self)
11131{
11132 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11133 return ruby_gc_stress_mode;
11134}
11135
11136static void
11137gc_stress_set(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE flag)
11138{
11139 objspace->flags.gc_stressful = RTEST(flag);
11140 objspace->gc_stress_mode = flag;
11141}
11142
11143static VALUE
11144gc_stress_set_m(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE self, VALUE flag)
11145{
11146 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11147 gc_stress_set(objspace, flag);
11148 return flag;
11149}
11150
11151VALUE
11152rb_gc_enable(void)
11153{
11154 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11155 return rb_objspace_gc_enable(objspace);
11156}
11157
11158VALUE
11159rb_objspace_gc_enable(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
11160{
11161 int old = dont_gc_val();
11162
11163 dont_gc_off();
11164 return RBOOL(old);
11165}
11166
11167static VALUE
11168gc_enable(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE _)
11169{
11170 return rb_gc_enable();
11171}
11172
11173VALUE
11174rb_gc_disable_no_rest(void)
11175{
11176 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11177 return gc_disable_no_rest(objspace);
11178}
11179
11180static VALUE
11181gc_disable_no_rest(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
11182{
11183 int old = dont_gc_val();
11184 dont_gc_on();
11185 return RBOOL(old);
11186}
11187
11188VALUE
11189rb_gc_disable(void)
11190{
11191 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11192 return rb_objspace_gc_disable(objspace);
11193}
11194
11195VALUE
11196rb_objspace_gc_disable(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
11197{
11198 gc_rest(objspace);
11199 return gc_disable_no_rest(objspace);
11200}
11201
11202static VALUE
11203gc_disable(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE _)
11204{
11205 return rb_gc_disable();
11206}
11207
11208#if GC_COMPACTION_SUPPORTED
11209/*
11210 * call-seq:
11211 * GC.auto_compact = flag
11212 *
11213 * Updates automatic compaction mode.
11214 *
11215 * When enabled, the compactor will execute on every major collection.
11216 *
11217 * Enabling compaction will degrade performance on major collections.
11218 */
11219static VALUE
11220gc_set_auto_compact(VALUE _, VALUE v)
11221{
11222 /* If not MinGW, Windows, or does not have mmap, we cannot use mprotect for
11223 * the read barrier, so we must disable automatic compaction. */
11224#if !defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(_WIN32)
11225 if (!HEAP_PAGE_ALLOC_USE_MMAP) {
11226 rb_raise(rb_eNotImpError, "Automatic compaction isn't available on this platform");
11227 }
11228#endif
11229
11230 ruby_enable_autocompact = RTEST(v);
11231 return v;
11232}
11233#else
11234# define gc_set_auto_compact rb_f_notimplement
11235#endif
11236
11237#if GC_COMPACTION_SUPPORTED
11238/*
11239 * call-seq:
11240 * GC.auto_compact -> true or false
11241 *
11242 * Returns whether or not automatic compaction has been enabled.
11243 */
11244static VALUE
11245gc_get_auto_compact(VALUE _)
11246{
11247 return RBOOL(ruby_enable_autocompact);
11248}
11249#else
11250# define gc_get_auto_compact rb_f_notimplement
11251#endif
11252
11253static int
11254get_envparam_size(const char *name, size_t *default_value, size_t lower_bound)
11255{
11256 const char *ptr = getenv(name);
11257 ssize_t val;
11258
11259 if (ptr != NULL && *ptr) {
11260 size_t unit = 0;
11261 char *end;
11262#if SIZEOF_SIZE_T == SIZEOF_LONG_LONG
11263 val = strtoll(ptr, &end, 0);
11264#else
11265 val = strtol(ptr, &end, 0);
11266#endif
11267 switch (*end) {
11268 case 'k': case 'K':
11269 unit = 1024;
11270 ++end;
11271 break;
11272 case 'm': case 'M':
11273 unit = 1024*1024;
11274 ++end;
11275 break;
11276 case 'g': case 'G':
11277 unit = 1024*1024*1024;
11278 ++end;
11279 break;
11280 }
11281 while (*end && isspace((unsigned char)*end)) end++;
11282 if (*end) {
11283 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) fprintf(stderr, "invalid string for %s: %s\n", name, ptr);
11284 return 0;
11285 }
11286 if (unit > 0) {
11287 if (val < -(ssize_t)(SIZE_MAX / 2 / unit) || (ssize_t)(SIZE_MAX / 2 / unit) < val) {
11288 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) fprintf(stderr, "%s=%s is ignored because it overflows\n", name, ptr);
11289 return 0;
11290 }
11291 val *= unit;
11292 }
11293 if (val > 0 && (size_t)val > lower_bound) {
11294 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) {
11295 fprintf(stderr, "%s=%"PRIdSIZE" (default value: %"PRIuSIZE")\n", name, val, *default_value);
11296 }
11297 *default_value = (size_t)val;
11298 return 1;
11299 }
11300 else {
11301 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) {
11302 fprintf(stderr, "%s=%"PRIdSIZE" (default value: %"PRIuSIZE") is ignored because it must be greater than %"PRIuSIZE".\n",
11303 name, val, *default_value, lower_bound);
11304 }
11305 return 0;
11306 }
11307 }
11308 return 0;
11309}
11310
11311static int
11312get_envparam_double(const char *name, double *default_value, double lower_bound, double upper_bound, int accept_zero)
11313{
11314 const char *ptr = getenv(name);
11315 double val;
11316
11317 if (ptr != NULL && *ptr) {
11318 char *end;
11319 val = strtod(ptr, &end);
11320 if (!*ptr || *end) {
11321 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) fprintf(stderr, "invalid string for %s: %s\n", name, ptr);
11322 return 0;
11323 }
11324
11325 if (accept_zero && val == 0.0) {
11326 goto accept;
11327 }
11328 else if (val <= lower_bound) {
11329 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) {
11330 fprintf(stderr, "%s=%f (default value: %f) is ignored because it must be greater than %f.\n",
11331 name, val, *default_value, lower_bound);
11332 }
11333 }
11334 else if (upper_bound != 0.0 && /* ignore upper_bound if it is 0.0 */
11335 val > upper_bound) {
11336 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) {
11337 fprintf(stderr, "%s=%f (default value: %f) is ignored because it must be lower than %f.\n",
11338 name, val, *default_value, upper_bound);
11339 }
11340 }
11341 else {
11342 goto accept;
11343 }
11344 }
11345 return 0;
11346
11347 accept:
11348 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) fprintf(stderr, "%s=%f (default value: %f)\n", name, val, *default_value);
11349 *default_value = val;
11350 return 1;
11351}
11352
11353static void
11354gc_set_initial_pages(void)
11355{
11356 size_t min_pages;
11357 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11358
11359 gc_rest(objspace);
11360
11361 min_pages = gc_params.heap_init_slots / HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT;
11362
11363 size_t pages_per_class = (min_pages - heap_eden_total_pages(objspace)) / SIZE_POOL_COUNT;
11364
11365 for (int i = 0; i < SIZE_POOL_COUNT; i++) {
11366 rb_size_pool_t *size_pool = &size_pools[i];
11367
11368 heap_add_pages(objspace, size_pool, SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(size_pool), pages_per_class);
11369 }
11370
11371 heap_add_pages(objspace, &size_pools[0], SIZE_POOL_EDEN_HEAP(&size_pools[0]), min_pages - heap_eden_total_pages(objspace));
11372}
11373
11374/*
11375 * GC tuning environment variables
11376 *
11377 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS
11378 * - Initial allocation slots.
11379 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS
11380 * - Prepare at least this amount of slots after GC.
11381 * - Allocate slots if there are not enough slots.
11382 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_GROWTH_FACTOR (new from 2.1)
11383 * - Allocate slots by this factor.
11384 * - (next slots number) = (current slots number) * (this factor)
11385 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_GROWTH_MAX_SLOTS (new from 2.1)
11386 * - Allocation rate is limited to this number of slots.
11387 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MIN_RATIO (new from 2.4)
11388 * - Allocate additional pages when the number of free slots is
11389 * lower than the value (total_slots * (this ratio)).
11390 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_GOAL_RATIO (new from 2.4)
11391 * - Allocate slots to satisfy this formula:
11392 * free_slots = total_slots * goal_ratio
11393 * - In other words, prepare (total_slots * goal_ratio) free slots.
11394 * - if this value is 0.0, then use RUBY_GC_HEAP_GROWTH_FACTOR directly.
11395 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MAX_RATIO (new from 2.4)
11396 * - Allow to free pages when the number of free slots is
11397 * greater than the value (total_slots * (this ratio)).
11398 * * RUBY_GC_HEAP_OLDOBJECT_LIMIT_FACTOR (new from 2.1.1)
11399 * - Do full GC when the number of old objects is more than R * N
11400 * where R is this factor and
11401 * N is the number of old objects just after last full GC.
11402 *
11403 * * obsolete
11404 * * RUBY_FREE_MIN -> RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS (from 2.1)
11405 * * RUBY_HEAP_MIN_SLOTS -> RUBY_GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS (from 2.1)
11406 *
11407 * * RUBY_GC_MALLOC_LIMIT
11408 * * RUBY_GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MAX (new from 2.1)
11409 * * RUBY_GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR (new from 2.1)
11410 *
11411 * * RUBY_GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT (new from 2.1)
11412 * * RUBY_GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MAX (new from 2.1)
11413 * * RUBY_GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR (new from 2.1)
11414 */
11415
11416void
11417ruby_gc_set_params(void)
11418{
11419 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11420 /* RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS */
11421 if (get_envparam_size("RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS", &gc_params.heap_free_slots, 0)) {
11422 /* ok */
11423 }
11424
11425 /* RUBY_GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS */
11426 if (get_envparam_size("RUBY_GC_HEAP_INIT_SLOTS", &gc_params.heap_init_slots, 0)) {
11427 gc_set_initial_pages();
11428 }
11429
11430 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_HEAP_GROWTH_FACTOR", &gc_params.growth_factor, 1.0, 0.0, FALSE);
11431 get_envparam_size ("RUBY_GC_HEAP_GROWTH_MAX_SLOTS", &gc_params.growth_max_slots, 0);
11432 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MIN_RATIO", &gc_params.heap_free_slots_min_ratio,
11433 0.0, 1.0, FALSE);
11434 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_MAX_RATIO", &gc_params.heap_free_slots_max_ratio,
11435 gc_params.heap_free_slots_min_ratio, 1.0, FALSE);
11436 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_HEAP_FREE_SLOTS_GOAL_RATIO", &gc_params.heap_free_slots_goal_ratio,
11437 gc_params.heap_free_slots_min_ratio, gc_params.heap_free_slots_max_ratio, TRUE);
11438 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_HEAP_OLDOBJECT_LIMIT_FACTOR", &gc_params.oldobject_limit_factor, 0.0, 0.0, TRUE);
11439
11440 if (get_envparam_size("RUBY_GC_MALLOC_LIMIT", &gc_params.malloc_limit_min, 0)) {
11441 malloc_limit = gc_params.malloc_limit_min;
11442 }
11443 get_envparam_size ("RUBY_GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_MAX", &gc_params.malloc_limit_max, 0);
11444 if (!gc_params.malloc_limit_max) { /* ignore max-check if 0 */
11445 gc_params.malloc_limit_max = SIZE_MAX;
11446 }
11447 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_MALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR", &gc_params.malloc_limit_growth_factor, 1.0, 0.0, FALSE);
11448
11449#if RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
11450 if (get_envparam_size("RUBY_GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT", &gc_params.oldmalloc_limit_min, 0)) {
11451 objspace->rgengc.oldmalloc_increase_limit = gc_params.oldmalloc_limit_min;
11452 }
11453 get_envparam_size ("RUBY_GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_MAX", &gc_params.oldmalloc_limit_max, 0);
11454 get_envparam_double("RUBY_GC_OLDMALLOC_LIMIT_GROWTH_FACTOR", &gc_params.oldmalloc_limit_growth_factor, 1.0, 0.0, FALSE);
11455#endif
11456}
11457
11458static void
11459reachable_objects_from_callback(VALUE obj)
11460{
11461 rb_ractor_t *cr = GET_RACTOR();
11462 cr->mfd->mark_func(obj, cr->mfd->data);
11463}
11464
11465void
11466rb_objspace_reachable_objects_from(VALUE obj, void (func)(VALUE, void *), void *data)
11467{
11468 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11469
11470 RB_VM_LOCK_ENTER();
11471 {
11472 if (during_gc) rb_bug("rb_objspace_reachable_objects_from() is not supported while during_gc == true");
11473
11474 if (is_markable_object(objspace, obj)) {
11475 rb_ractor_t *cr = GET_RACTOR();
11476 struct gc_mark_func_data_struct mfd = {
11477 .mark_func = func,
11478 .data = data,
11479 }, *prev_mfd = cr->mfd;
11480
11481 cr->mfd = &mfd;
11482 gc_mark_children(objspace, obj);
11483 cr->mfd = prev_mfd;
11484 }
11485 }
11486 RB_VM_LOCK_LEAVE();
11487}
11488
11489struct root_objects_data {
11490 const char *category;
11491 void (*func)(const char *category, VALUE, void *);
11492 void *data;
11493};
11494
11495static void
11496root_objects_from(VALUE obj, void *ptr)
11497{
11498 const struct root_objects_data *data = (struct root_objects_data *)ptr;
11499 (*data->func)(data->category, obj, data->data);
11500}
11501
11502void
11503rb_objspace_reachable_objects_from_root(void (func)(const char *category, VALUE, void *), void *passing_data)
11504{
11505 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
11506 objspace_reachable_objects_from_root(objspace, func, passing_data);
11507}
11508
11509static void
11510objspace_reachable_objects_from_root(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void (func)(const char *category, VALUE, void *), void *passing_data)
11511{
11512 if (during_gc) rb_bug("objspace_reachable_objects_from_root() is not supported while during_gc == true");
11513
11514 rb_ractor_t *cr = GET_RACTOR();
11515 struct root_objects_data data = {
11516 .func = func,
11517 .data = passing_data,
11518 };
11519 struct gc_mark_func_data_struct mfd = {
11520 .mark_func = root_objects_from,
11521 .data = &data,
11522 }, *prev_mfd = cr->mfd;
11523
11524 cr->mfd = &mfd;
11525 gc_mark_roots(objspace, &data.category);
11526 cr->mfd = prev_mfd;
11527}
11528
11529/*
11530 ------------------------ Extended allocator ------------------------
11531*/
11532
11533struct gc_raise_tag {
11534 VALUE exc;
11535 const char *fmt;
11536 va_list *ap;
11537};
11538
11539static void *
11540gc_vraise(void *ptr)
11541{
11542 struct gc_raise_tag *argv = ptr;
11543 rb_vraise(argv->exc, argv->fmt, *argv->ap);
11544 UNREACHABLE_RETURN(NULL);
11545}
11546
11547static void
11548gc_raise(VALUE exc, const char *fmt, ...)
11549{
11550 va_list ap;
11551 va_start(ap, fmt);
11552 struct gc_raise_tag argv = {
11553 exc, fmt, &ap,
11554 };
11555
11556 if (ruby_thread_has_gvl_p()) {
11557 gc_vraise(&argv);
11558 UNREACHABLE;
11559 }
11560 else if (ruby_native_thread_p()) {
11561 rb_thread_call_with_gvl(gc_vraise, &argv);
11562 UNREACHABLE;
11563 }
11564 else {
11565 /* Not in a ruby thread */
11566 fprintf(stderr, "%s", "[FATAL] ");
11567 vfprintf(stderr, fmt, ap);
11568 }
11569
11570 va_end(ap);
11571 abort();
11572}
11573
11574static void objspace_xfree(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *ptr, size_t size);
11575
11576static void
11577negative_size_allocation_error(const char *msg)
11578{
11579 gc_raise(rb_eNoMemError, "%s", msg);
11580}
11581
11582static void *
11583ruby_memerror_body(void *dummy)
11584{
11585 rb_memerror();
11586 return 0;
11587}
11588
11589NORETURN(static void ruby_memerror(void));
11590RBIMPL_ATTR_MAYBE_UNUSED()
11591static void
11592ruby_memerror(void)
11593{
11594 if (ruby_thread_has_gvl_p()) {
11595 rb_memerror();
11596 }
11597 else {
11598 if (ruby_native_thread_p()) {
11599 rb_thread_call_with_gvl(ruby_memerror_body, 0);
11600 }
11601 else {
11602 /* no ruby thread */
11603 fprintf(stderr, "[FATAL] failed to allocate memory\n");
11604 }
11605 }
11606 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
11607}
11608
11609void
11610rb_memerror(void)
11611{
11612 rb_execution_context_t *ec = GET_EC();
11613 rb_objspace_t *objspace = rb_objspace_of(rb_ec_vm_ptr(ec));
11614 VALUE exc;
11615
11616 if (0) {
11617 // Print out pid, sleep, so you can attach debugger to see what went wrong:
11618 fprintf(stderr, "rb_memerror pid=%"PRI_PIDT_PREFIX"d\n", getpid());
11619 sleep(60);
11620 }
11621
11622 if (during_gc) {
11623 // TODO: OMG!! How to implement it?
11624 gc_exit(objspace, gc_enter_event_rb_memerror, NULL);
11625 }
11626
11627 exc = nomem_error;
11628 if (!exc ||
11629 rb_ec_raised_p(ec, RAISED_NOMEMORY)) {
11630 fprintf(stderr, "[FATAL] failed to allocate memory\n");
11631 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
11632 }
11633 if (rb_ec_raised_p(ec, RAISED_NOMEMORY)) {
11634 rb_ec_raised_clear(ec);
11635 }
11636 else {
11637 rb_ec_raised_set(ec, RAISED_NOMEMORY);
11638 exc = ruby_vm_special_exception_copy(exc);
11639 }
11640 ec->errinfo = exc;
11641 EC_JUMP_TAG(ec, TAG_RAISE);
11642}
11643
11644void *
11645rb_aligned_malloc(size_t alignment, size_t size)
11646{
11647 /* alignment must be a power of 2 */
11648 GC_ASSERT(((alignment - 1) & alignment) == 0);
11649 GC_ASSERT(alignment % sizeof(void*) == 0);
11650
11651 void *res;
11652
11653#if defined __MINGW32__
11654 res = __mingw_aligned_malloc(size, alignment);
11655#elif defined _WIN32
11656 void *_aligned_malloc(size_t, size_t);
11657 res = _aligned_malloc(size, alignment);
11658#elif defined(HAVE_POSIX_MEMALIGN)
11659 if (posix_memalign(&res, alignment, size) != 0) {
11660 return NULL;
11661 }
11662#elif defined(HAVE_MEMALIGN)
11663 res = memalign(alignment, size);
11664#else
11665 char* aligned;
11666 res = malloc(alignment + size + sizeof(void*));
11667 aligned = (char*)res + alignment + sizeof(void*);
11668 aligned -= ((VALUE)aligned & (alignment - 1));
11669 ((void**)aligned)[-1] = res;
11670 res = (void*)aligned;
11671#endif
11672
11673 GC_ASSERT((uintptr_t)res % alignment == 0);
11674
11675 return res;
11676}
11677
11678static void
11679rb_aligned_free(void *ptr, size_t size)
11680{
11681#if defined __MINGW32__
11682 __mingw_aligned_free(ptr);
11683#elif defined _WIN32
11684 _aligned_free(ptr);
11685#elif defined(HAVE_POSIX_MEMALIGN) || defined(HAVE_MEMALIGN)
11686 free(ptr);
11687#else
11688 free(((void**)ptr)[-1]);
11689#endif
11690}
11691
11692static inline size_t
11693objspace_malloc_size(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *ptr, size_t hint)
11694{
11695#ifdef HAVE_MALLOC_USABLE_SIZE
11696 return malloc_usable_size(ptr);
11697#else
11698 return hint;
11699#endif
11700}
11701
11702enum memop_type {
11703 MEMOP_TYPE_MALLOC = 0,
11704 MEMOP_TYPE_FREE,
11705 MEMOP_TYPE_REALLOC
11706};
11707
11708static inline void
11709atomic_sub_nounderflow(size_t *var, size_t sub)
11710{
11711 if (sub == 0) return;
11712
11713 while (1) {
11714 size_t val = *var;
11715 if (val < sub) sub = val;
11716 if (ATOMIC_SIZE_CAS(*var, val, val-sub) == val) break;
11717 }
11718}
11719
11720static void
11721objspace_malloc_gc_stress(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
11722{
11723 if (ruby_gc_stressful && ruby_native_thread_p()) {
11724 unsigned int reason = (GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_MARK | GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_SWEEP |
11725 GPR_FLAG_STRESS | GPR_FLAG_MALLOC);
11726
11727 if (gc_stress_full_mark_after_malloc_p()) {
11728 reason |= GPR_FLAG_FULL_MARK;
11729 }
11730 garbage_collect_with_gvl(objspace, reason);
11731 }
11732}
11733
11734static inline bool
11735objspace_malloc_increase_report(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *mem, size_t new_size, size_t old_size, enum memop_type type)
11736{
11737 if (0) fprintf(stderr, "increase - ptr: %p, type: %s, new_size: %"PRIdSIZE", old_size: %"PRIdSIZE"\n",
11738 mem,
11739 type == MEMOP_TYPE_MALLOC ? "malloc" :
11740 type == MEMOP_TYPE_FREE ? "free " :
11741 type == MEMOP_TYPE_REALLOC ? "realloc": "error",
11742 new_size, old_size);
11743 return false;
11744}
11745
11746static bool
11747objspace_malloc_increase_body(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *mem, size_t new_size, size_t old_size, enum memop_type type)
11748{
11749 if (new_size > old_size) {
11750 ATOMIC_SIZE_ADD(malloc_increase, new_size - old_size);
11751#if RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
11752 ATOMIC_SIZE_ADD(objspace->rgengc.oldmalloc_increase, new_size - old_size);
11753#endif
11754 }
11755 else {
11756 atomic_sub_nounderflow(&malloc_increase, old_size - new_size);
11757#if RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
11758 atomic_sub_nounderflow(&objspace->rgengc.oldmalloc_increase, old_size - new_size);
11759#endif
11760 }
11761
11762 if (type == MEMOP_TYPE_MALLOC) {
11763 retry:
11764 if (malloc_increase > malloc_limit && ruby_native_thread_p() && !dont_gc_val()) {
11765 if (ruby_thread_has_gvl_p() && is_lazy_sweeping(objspace)) {
11766 gc_rest(objspace); /* gc_rest can reduce malloc_increase */
11767 goto retry;
11768 }
11769 garbage_collect_with_gvl(objspace, GPR_FLAG_MALLOC);
11770 }
11771 }
11772
11773#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
11774 if (new_size >= old_size) {
11775 ATOMIC_SIZE_ADD(objspace->malloc_params.allocated_size, new_size - old_size);
11776 }
11777 else {
11778 size_t dec_size = old_size - new_size;
11779 size_t allocated_size = objspace->malloc_params.allocated_size;
11780
11781#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE_CHECK
11782 if (allocated_size < dec_size) {
11783 rb_bug("objspace_malloc_increase: underflow malloc_params.allocated_size.");
11784 }
11785#endif
11786 atomic_sub_nounderflow(&objspace->malloc_params.allocated_size, dec_size);
11787 }
11788
11789 switch (type) {
11790 case MEMOP_TYPE_MALLOC:
11791 ATOMIC_SIZE_INC(objspace->malloc_params.allocations);
11792 break;
11793 case MEMOP_TYPE_FREE:
11794 {
11795 size_t allocations = objspace->malloc_params.allocations;
11796 if (allocations > 0) {
11797 atomic_sub_nounderflow(&objspace->malloc_params.allocations, 1);
11798 }
11799#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE_CHECK
11800 else {
11801 GC_ASSERT(objspace->malloc_params.allocations > 0);
11802 }
11803#endif
11804 }
11805 break;
11806 case MEMOP_TYPE_REALLOC: /* ignore */ break;
11807 }
11808#endif
11809 return true;
11810}
11811
11812#define objspace_malloc_increase(...) \
11813 for (bool malloc_increase_done = objspace_malloc_increase_report(__VA_ARGS__); \
11814 !malloc_increase_done; \
11815 malloc_increase_done = objspace_malloc_increase_body(__VA_ARGS__))
11816
11817struct malloc_obj_info { /* 4 words */
11818 size_t size;
11819#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
11820 size_t gen;
11821 const char *file;
11822 size_t line;
11823#endif
11824};
11825
11826#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
11827const char *ruby_malloc_info_file;
11828int ruby_malloc_info_line;
11829#endif
11830
11831static inline size_t
11832objspace_malloc_prepare(rb_objspace_t *objspace, size_t size)
11833{
11834 if (size == 0) size = 1;
11835
11836#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
11837 size += sizeof(struct malloc_obj_info);
11838#endif
11839
11840 return size;
11841}
11842
11843static inline void *
11844objspace_malloc_fixup(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *mem, size_t size)
11845{
11846 size = objspace_malloc_size(objspace, mem, size);
11847 objspace_malloc_increase(objspace, mem, size, 0, MEMOP_TYPE_MALLOC);
11848
11849#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
11850 {
11851 struct malloc_obj_info *info = mem;
11852 info->size = size;
11853#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
11854 info->gen = objspace->profile.count;
11855 info->file = ruby_malloc_info_file;
11856 info->line = info->file ? ruby_malloc_info_line : 0;
11857#endif
11858 mem = info + 1;
11859 }
11860#endif
11861
11862 return mem;
11863}
11864
11865#if defined(__GNUC__) && RUBY_DEBUG
11866#define RB_BUG_INSTEAD_OF_RB_MEMERROR
11867#endif
11868
11869#ifdef RB_BUG_INSTEAD_OF_RB_MEMERROR
11870#define TRY_WITH_GC(siz, expr) do { \
11871 const gc_profile_record_flag gpr = \
11872 GPR_FLAG_FULL_MARK | \
11873 GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_MARK | \
11874 GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_SWEEP | \
11875 GPR_FLAG_MALLOC; \
11876 objspace_malloc_gc_stress(objspace); \
11877 \
11878 if (LIKELY((expr))) { \
11879 /* Success on 1st try */ \
11880 } \
11881 else if (!garbage_collect_with_gvl(objspace, gpr)) { \
11882 /* @shyouhei thinks this doesn't happen */ \
11883 rb_bug("TRY_WITH_GC: could not GC"); \
11884 } \
11885 else if ((expr)) { \
11886 /* Success on 2nd try */ \
11887 } \
11888 else { \
11889 rb_bug("TRY_WITH_GC: could not allocate:" \
11890 "%"PRIdSIZE" bytes for %s", \
11891 siz, # expr); \
11892 } \
11893 } while (0)
11894#else
11895#define TRY_WITH_GC(siz, alloc) do { \
11896 objspace_malloc_gc_stress(objspace); \
11897 if (!(alloc) && \
11898 (!garbage_collect_with_gvl(objspace, GPR_FLAG_FULL_MARK | \
11899 GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_MARK | GPR_FLAG_IMMEDIATE_SWEEP | \
11900 GPR_FLAG_MALLOC) || \
11901 !(alloc))) { \
11902 ruby_memerror(); \
11903 } \
11904 } while (0)
11905#endif
11906
11907/* these shouldn't be called directly.
11908 * objspace_* functions do not check allocation size.
11909 */
11910static void *
11911objspace_xmalloc0(rb_objspace_t *objspace, size_t size)
11912{
11913 void *mem;
11914
11915 size = objspace_malloc_prepare(objspace, size);
11916 TRY_WITH_GC(size, mem = malloc(size));
11917 RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC(heap_xmalloc);
11918 return objspace_malloc_fixup(objspace, mem, size);
11919}
11920
11921static inline size_t
11922xmalloc2_size(const size_t count, const size_t elsize)
11923{
11924 return size_mul_or_raise(count, elsize, rb_eArgError);
11925}
11926
11927static void *
11928objspace_xrealloc(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *ptr, size_t new_size, size_t old_size)
11929{
11930 void *mem;
11931
11932 if (!ptr) return objspace_xmalloc0(objspace, new_size);
11933
11934 /*
11935 * The behavior of realloc(ptr, 0) is implementation defined.
11936 * Therefore we don't use realloc(ptr, 0) for portability reason.
11937 * see http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg14/www/docs/dr_400.htm
11938 */
11939 if (new_size == 0) {
11940 if ((mem = objspace_xmalloc0(objspace, 0)) != NULL) {
11941 /*
11942 * - OpenBSD's malloc(3) man page says that when 0 is passed, it
11943 * returns a non-NULL pointer to an access-protected memory page.
11944 * The returned pointer cannot be read / written at all, but
11945 * still be a valid argument of free().
11946 *
11947 * https://man.openbsd.org/malloc.3
11948 *
11949 * - Linux's malloc(3) man page says that it _might_ perhaps return
11950 * a non-NULL pointer when its argument is 0. That return value
11951 * is safe (and is expected) to be passed to free().
11952 *
11953 * https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/malloc.3.html
11954 *
11955 * - As I read the implementation jemalloc's malloc() returns fully
11956 * normal 16 bytes memory region when its argument is 0.
11957 *
11958 * - As I read the implementation musl libc's malloc() returns
11959 * fully normal 32 bytes memory region when its argument is 0.
11960 *
11961 * - Other malloc implementations can also return non-NULL.
11962 */
11963 objspace_xfree(objspace, ptr, old_size);
11964 return mem;
11965 }
11966 else {
11967 /*
11968 * It is dangerous to return NULL here, because that could lead to
11969 * RCE. Fallback to 1 byte instead of zero.
11970 *
11971 * https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-11932
11972 */
11973 new_size = 1;
11974 }
11975 }
11976
11977#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
11978 {
11979 struct malloc_obj_info *info = (struct malloc_obj_info *)ptr - 1;
11980 new_size += sizeof(struct malloc_obj_info);
11981 ptr = info;
11982 old_size = info->size;
11983 }
11984#endif
11985
11986 old_size = objspace_malloc_size(objspace, ptr, old_size);
11987 TRY_WITH_GC(new_size, mem = realloc(ptr, new_size));
11988 new_size = objspace_malloc_size(objspace, mem, new_size);
11989
11990#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
11991 {
11992 struct malloc_obj_info *info = mem;
11993 info->size = new_size;
11994 mem = info + 1;
11995 }
11996#endif
11997
11998 objspace_malloc_increase(objspace, mem, new_size, old_size, MEMOP_TYPE_REALLOC);
11999
12000 RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC(heap_xrealloc);
12001 return mem;
12002}
12003
12004#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE && USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
12005
12006#define MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE 100
12007#define MALLOC_INFO_SIZE_SIZE 10
12008static size_t malloc_info_gen_cnt[MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE];
12009static size_t malloc_info_gen_size[MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE];
12010static size_t malloc_info_size[MALLOC_INFO_SIZE_SIZE+1];
12011static st_table *malloc_info_file_table;
12012
12013static int
12014mmalloc_info_file_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t dmy)
12015{
12016 const char *file = (void *)key;
12017 const size_t *data = (void *)val;
12018
12019 fprintf(stderr, "%s\t%"PRIdSIZE"\t%"PRIdSIZE"\n", file, data[0], data[1]);
12020
12021 return ST_CONTINUE;
12022}
12023
12024__attribute__((destructor))
12025void
12026rb_malloc_info_show_results(void)
12027{
12028 int i;
12029
12030 fprintf(stderr, "* malloc_info gen statistics\n");
12031 for (i=0; i<MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE; i++) {
12032 if (i == MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE-1) {
12033 fprintf(stderr, "more\t%"PRIdSIZE"\t%"PRIdSIZE"\n", malloc_info_gen_cnt[i], malloc_info_gen_size[i]);
12034 }
12035 else {
12036 fprintf(stderr, "%d\t%"PRIdSIZE"\t%"PRIdSIZE"\n", i, malloc_info_gen_cnt[i], malloc_info_gen_size[i]);
12037 }
12038 }
12039
12040 fprintf(stderr, "* malloc_info size statistics\n");
12041 for (i=0; i<MALLOC_INFO_SIZE_SIZE; i++) {
12042 int s = 16 << i;
12043 fprintf(stderr, "%d\t%"PRIdSIZE"\n", s, malloc_info_size[i]);
12044 }
12045 fprintf(stderr, "more\t%"PRIdSIZE"\n", malloc_info_size[i]);
12046
12047 if (malloc_info_file_table) {
12048 fprintf(stderr, "* malloc_info file statistics\n");
12049 st_foreach(malloc_info_file_table, mmalloc_info_file_i, 0);
12050 }
12051}
12052#else
12053void
12054rb_malloc_info_show_results(void)
12055{
12056}
12057#endif
12058
12059static void
12060objspace_xfree(rb_objspace_t *objspace, void *ptr, size_t old_size)
12061{
12062 if (!ptr) {
12063 /*
12064 * ISO/IEC 9899 says "If ptr is a null pointer, no action occurs" since
12065 * its first version. We would better follow.
12066 */
12067 return;
12068 }
12069#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
12070 struct malloc_obj_info *info = (struct malloc_obj_info *)ptr - 1;
12071 ptr = info;
12072 old_size = info->size;
12073
12074#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
12075 {
12076 int gen = (int)(objspace->profile.count - info->gen);
12077 int gen_index = gen >= MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE ? MALLOC_INFO_GEN_SIZE-1 : gen;
12078 int i;
12079
12080 malloc_info_gen_cnt[gen_index]++;
12081 malloc_info_gen_size[gen_index] += info->size;
12082
12083 for (i=0; i<MALLOC_INFO_SIZE_SIZE; i++) {
12084 size_t s = 16 << i;
12085 if (info->size <= s) {
12086 malloc_info_size[i]++;
12087 goto found;
12088 }
12089 }
12090 malloc_info_size[i]++;
12091 found:;
12092
12093 {
12094 st_data_t key = (st_data_t)info->file, d;
12095 size_t *data;
12096
12097 if (malloc_info_file_table == NULL) {
12098 malloc_info_file_table = st_init_numtable_with_size(1024);
12099 }
12100 if (st_lookup(malloc_info_file_table, key, &d)) {
12101 /* hit */
12102 data = (size_t *)d;
12103 }
12104 else {
12105 data = malloc(xmalloc2_size(2, sizeof(size_t)));
12106 if (data == NULL) rb_bug("objspace_xfree: can not allocate memory");
12107 data[0] = data[1] = 0;
12108 st_insert(malloc_info_file_table, key, (st_data_t)data);
12109 }
12110 data[0] ++;
12111 data[1] += info->size;
12112 };
12113 if (0 && gen >= 2) { /* verbose output */
12114 if (info->file) {
12115 fprintf(stderr, "free - size:%"PRIdSIZE", gen:%d, pos: %s:%"PRIdSIZE"\n",
12116 info->size, gen, info->file, info->line);
12117 }
12118 else {
12119 fprintf(stderr, "free - size:%"PRIdSIZE", gen:%d\n",
12120 info->size, gen);
12121 }
12122 }
12123 }
12124#endif
12125#endif
12126 old_size = objspace_malloc_size(objspace, ptr, old_size);
12127
12128 objspace_malloc_increase(objspace, ptr, 0, old_size, MEMOP_TYPE_FREE) {
12129 free(ptr);
12130 RB_DEBUG_COUNTER_INC(heap_xfree);
12131 }
12132}
12133
12134static void *
12135ruby_xmalloc0(size_t size)
12136{
12137 return objspace_xmalloc0(&rb_objspace, size);
12138}
12139
12140void *
12141ruby_xmalloc_body(size_t size)
12142{
12143 if ((ssize_t)size < 0) {
12144 negative_size_allocation_error("too large allocation size");
12145 }
12146 return ruby_xmalloc0(size);
12147}
12148
12149void
12150ruby_malloc_size_overflow(size_t count, size_t elsize)
12151{
12152 rb_raise(rb_eArgError,
12153 "malloc: possible integer overflow (%"PRIuSIZE"*%"PRIuSIZE")",
12154 count, elsize);
12155}
12156
12157void *
12158ruby_xmalloc2_body(size_t n, size_t size)
12159{
12160 return objspace_xmalloc0(&rb_objspace, xmalloc2_size(n, size));
12161}
12162
12163static void *
12164objspace_xcalloc(rb_objspace_t *objspace, size_t size)
12165{
12166 void *mem;
12167
12168 size = objspace_malloc_prepare(objspace, size);
12169 TRY_WITH_GC(size, mem = calloc1(size));
12170 return objspace_malloc_fixup(objspace, mem, size);
12171}
12172
12173void *
12174ruby_xcalloc_body(size_t n, size_t size)
12175{
12176 return objspace_xcalloc(&rb_objspace, xmalloc2_size(n, size));
12177}
12178
12179#ifdef ruby_sized_xrealloc
12180#undef ruby_sized_xrealloc
12181#endif
12182void *
12183ruby_sized_xrealloc(void *ptr, size_t new_size, size_t old_size)
12184{
12185 if ((ssize_t)new_size < 0) {
12186 negative_size_allocation_error("too large allocation size");
12187 }
12188
12189 return objspace_xrealloc(&rb_objspace, ptr, new_size, old_size);
12190}
12191
12192void *
12193ruby_xrealloc_body(void *ptr, size_t new_size)
12194{
12195 return ruby_sized_xrealloc(ptr, new_size, 0);
12196}
12197
12198#ifdef ruby_sized_xrealloc2
12199#undef ruby_sized_xrealloc2
12200#endif
12201void *
12202ruby_sized_xrealloc2(void *ptr, size_t n, size_t size, size_t old_n)
12203{
12204 size_t len = xmalloc2_size(n, size);
12205 return objspace_xrealloc(&rb_objspace, ptr, len, old_n * size);
12206}
12207
12208void *
12209ruby_xrealloc2_body(void *ptr, size_t n, size_t size)
12210{
12211 return ruby_sized_xrealloc2(ptr, n, size, 0);
12212}
12213
12214#ifdef ruby_sized_xfree
12215#undef ruby_sized_xfree
12216#endif
12217void
12218ruby_sized_xfree(void *x, size_t size)
12219{
12220 if (x) {
12221 objspace_xfree(&rb_objspace, x, size);
12222 }
12223}
12224
12225void
12226ruby_xfree(void *x)
12227{
12228 ruby_sized_xfree(x, 0);
12229}
12230
12231void *
12232rb_xmalloc_mul_add(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z) /* x * y + z */
12233{
12234 size_t w = size_mul_add_or_raise(x, y, z, rb_eArgError);
12235 return ruby_xmalloc(w);
12236}
12237
12238void *
12239rb_xcalloc_mul_add(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z) /* x * y + z */
12240{
12241 size_t w = size_mul_add_or_raise(x, y, z, rb_eArgError);
12242 return ruby_xcalloc(w, 1);
12243}
12244
12245void *
12246rb_xrealloc_mul_add(const void *p, size_t x, size_t y, size_t z) /* x * y + z */
12247{
12248 size_t w = size_mul_add_or_raise(x, y, z, rb_eArgError);
12249 return ruby_xrealloc((void *)p, w);
12250}
12251
12252void *
12253rb_xmalloc_mul_add_mul(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z, size_t w) /* x * y + z * w */
12254{
12255 size_t u = size_mul_add_mul_or_raise(x, y, z, w, rb_eArgError);
12256 return ruby_xmalloc(u);
12257}
12258
12259void *
12260rb_xcalloc_mul_add_mul(size_t x, size_t y, size_t z, size_t w) /* x * y + z * w */
12261{
12262 size_t u = size_mul_add_mul_or_raise(x, y, z, w, rb_eArgError);
12263 return ruby_xcalloc(u, 1);
12264}
12265
12266/* Mimic ruby_xmalloc, but need not rb_objspace.
12267 * should return pointer suitable for ruby_xfree
12268 */
12269void *
12270ruby_mimmalloc(size_t size)
12271{
12272 void *mem;
12273#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
12274 size += sizeof(struct malloc_obj_info);
12275#endif
12276 mem = malloc(size);
12277#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
12278 if (!mem) {
12279 return NULL;
12280 }
12281 else
12282 /* set 0 for consistency of allocated_size/allocations */
12283 {
12284 struct malloc_obj_info *info = mem;
12285 info->size = 0;
12286#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
12287 info->gen = 0;
12288 info->file = NULL;
12289 info->line = 0;
12290#endif
12291 mem = info + 1;
12292 }
12293#endif
12294 return mem;
12295}
12296
12297void
12298ruby_mimfree(void *ptr)
12299{
12300#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
12301 struct malloc_obj_info *info = (struct malloc_obj_info *)ptr - 1;
12302 ptr = info;
12303#endif
12304 free(ptr);
12305}
12306
12307void *
12308rb_alloc_tmp_buffer_with_count(volatile VALUE *store, size_t size, size_t cnt)
12309{
12310 void *ptr;
12311 VALUE imemo;
12312 rb_imemo_tmpbuf_t *tmpbuf;
12313
12314 /* Keep the order; allocate an empty imemo first then xmalloc, to
12315 * get rid of potential memory leak */
12316 imemo = rb_imemo_tmpbuf_auto_free_maybe_mark_buffer(NULL, 0);
12317 *store = imemo;
12318 ptr = ruby_xmalloc0(size);
12319 tmpbuf = (rb_imemo_tmpbuf_t *)imemo;
12320 tmpbuf->ptr = ptr;
12321 tmpbuf->cnt = cnt;
12322 return ptr;
12323}
12324
12325void *
12326rb_alloc_tmp_buffer(volatile VALUE *store, long len)
12327{
12328 long cnt;
12329
12330 if (len < 0 || (cnt = (long)roomof(len, sizeof(VALUE))) < 0) {
12331 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "negative buffer size (or size too big)");
12332 }
12333
12334 return rb_alloc_tmp_buffer_with_count(store, len, cnt);
12335}
12336
12337void
12338rb_free_tmp_buffer(volatile VALUE *store)
12339{
12340 rb_imemo_tmpbuf_t *s = (rb_imemo_tmpbuf_t*)ATOMIC_VALUE_EXCHANGE(*store, 0);
12341 if (s) {
12342 void *ptr = ATOMIC_PTR_EXCHANGE(s->ptr, 0);
12343 s->cnt = 0;
12344 ruby_xfree(ptr);
12345 }
12346}
12347
12348#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
12349/*
12350 * call-seq:
12351 * GC.malloc_allocated_size -> Integer
12352 *
12353 * Returns the size of memory allocated by malloc().
12354 *
12355 * Only available if ruby was built with +CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE+.
12356 */
12357
12358static VALUE
12359gc_malloc_allocated_size(VALUE self)
12360{
12361 return UINT2NUM(rb_objspace.malloc_params.allocated_size);
12362}
12363
12364/*
12365 * call-seq:
12366 * GC.malloc_allocations -> Integer
12367 *
12368 * Returns the number of malloc() allocations.
12369 *
12370 * Only available if ruby was built with +CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE+.
12371 */
12372
12373static VALUE
12374gc_malloc_allocations(VALUE self)
12375{
12376 return UINT2NUM(rb_objspace.malloc_params.allocations);
12377}
12378#endif
12379
12380void
12381rb_gc_adjust_memory_usage(ssize_t diff)
12382{
12383 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
12384 if (diff > 0) {
12385 objspace_malloc_increase(objspace, 0, diff, 0, MEMOP_TYPE_REALLOC);
12386 }
12387 else if (diff < 0) {
12388 objspace_malloc_increase(objspace, 0, 0, -diff, MEMOP_TYPE_REALLOC);
12389 }
12390}
12391
12392/*
12393 ------------------------------ WeakMap ------------------------------
12394*/
12395
12396struct weakmap {
12397 st_table *obj2wmap; /* obj -> [ref,...] */
12398 st_table *wmap2obj; /* ref -> obj */
12399 VALUE final;
12400};
12401
12402#define WMAP_DELETE_DEAD_OBJECT_IN_MARK 0
12403
12404#if WMAP_DELETE_DEAD_OBJECT_IN_MARK
12405static int
12406wmap_mark_map(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12407{
12408 rb_objspace_t *objspace = (rb_objspace_t *)arg;
12409 VALUE obj = (VALUE)val;
12410 if (!is_live_object(objspace, obj)) return ST_DELETE;
12411 return ST_CONTINUE;
12412}
12413#endif
12414
12415static void
12416wmap_compact(void *ptr)
12417{
12418 struct weakmap *w = ptr;
12419 if (w->wmap2obj) rb_gc_update_tbl_refs(w->wmap2obj);
12420 if (w->obj2wmap) rb_gc_update_tbl_refs(w->obj2wmap);
12421 w->final = rb_gc_location(w->final);
12422}
12423
12424static void
12425wmap_mark(void *ptr)
12426{
12427 struct weakmap *w = ptr;
12428#if WMAP_DELETE_DEAD_OBJECT_IN_MARK
12429 if (w->obj2wmap) st_foreach(w->obj2wmap, wmap_mark_map, (st_data_t)&rb_objspace);
12430#endif
12431 rb_gc_mark_movable(w->final);
12432}
12433
12434static int
12435wmap_free_map(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12436{
12437 VALUE *ptr = (VALUE *)val;
12438 ruby_sized_xfree(ptr, (ptr[0] + 1) * sizeof(VALUE));
12439 return ST_CONTINUE;
12440}
12441
12442static void
12443wmap_free(void *ptr)
12444{
12445 struct weakmap *w = ptr;
12446 st_foreach(w->obj2wmap, wmap_free_map, 0);
12447 st_free_table(w->obj2wmap);
12448 st_free_table(w->wmap2obj);
12449}
12450
12451static int
12452wmap_memsize_map(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12453{
12454 VALUE *ptr = (VALUE *)val;
12455 *(size_t *)arg += (ptr[0] + 1) * sizeof(VALUE);
12456 return ST_CONTINUE;
12457}
12458
12459static size_t
12460wmap_memsize(const void *ptr)
12461{
12462 size_t size;
12463 const struct weakmap *w = ptr;
12464 size = sizeof(*w);
12465 size += st_memsize(w->obj2wmap);
12466 size += st_memsize(w->wmap2obj);
12467 st_foreach(w->obj2wmap, wmap_memsize_map, (st_data_t)&size);
12468 return size;
12469}
12470
12471static const rb_data_type_t weakmap_type = {
12472 "weakmap",
12473 {
12474 wmap_mark,
12475 wmap_free,
12476 wmap_memsize,
12477 wmap_compact,
12478 },
12479 0, 0, RUBY_TYPED_FREE_IMMEDIATELY
12480};
12481
12482static VALUE wmap_finalize(RB_BLOCK_CALL_FUNC_ARGLIST(objid, self));
12483
12484static VALUE
12485wmap_allocate(VALUE klass)
12486{
12487 struct weakmap *w;
12488 VALUE obj = TypedData_Make_Struct(klass, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12489 w->obj2wmap = rb_init_identtable();
12490 w->wmap2obj = rb_init_identtable();
12491 w->final = rb_func_lambda_new(wmap_finalize, obj, 1, 1);
12492 return obj;
12493}
12494
12495static int
12496wmap_live_p(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE obj)
12497{
12498 if (SPECIAL_CONST_P(obj)) return TRUE;
12499 if (is_pointer_to_heap(objspace, (void *)obj)) {
12500 void *poisoned = asan_unpoison_object_temporary(obj);
12501
12502 enum ruby_value_type t = BUILTIN_TYPE(obj);
12503 int ret = (!(t == T_NONE || t >= T_FIXNUM || t == T_ICLASS) &&
12504 is_live_object(objspace, obj));
12505
12506 if (poisoned) {
12507 asan_poison_object(obj);
12508 }
12509
12510 return ret;
12511 }
12512 return TRUE;
12513}
12514
12515static int
12516wmap_final_func(st_data_t *key, st_data_t *value, st_data_t arg, int existing)
12517{
12518 VALUE wmap, *ptr, size, i, j;
12519 if (!existing) return ST_STOP;
12520 wmap = (VALUE)arg, ptr = (VALUE *)*value;
12521 for (i = j = 1, size = ptr[0]; i <= size; ++i) {
12522 if (ptr[i] != wmap) {
12523 ptr[j++] = ptr[i];
12524 }
12525 }
12526 if (j == 1) {
12527 ruby_sized_xfree(ptr, i * sizeof(VALUE));
12528 return ST_DELETE;
12529 }
12530 if (j < i) {
12531 SIZED_REALLOC_N(ptr, VALUE, j + 1, i);
12532 ptr[0] = j;
12533 *value = (st_data_t)ptr;
12534 }
12535 return ST_CONTINUE;
12536}
12537
12538/* :nodoc: */
12539static VALUE
12540wmap_finalize(RB_BLOCK_CALL_FUNC_ARGLIST(objid, self))
12541{
12542 st_data_t orig, wmap, data;
12543 VALUE obj, *rids, i, size;
12544 struct weakmap *w;
12545
12546 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12547 /* Get reference from object id. */
12548 if ((obj = id2ref_obj_tbl(&rb_objspace, objid)) == Qundef) {
12549 rb_bug("wmap_finalize: objid is not found.");
12550 }
12551
12552 /* obj is original referenced object and/or weak reference. */
12553 orig = (st_data_t)obj;
12554 if (st_delete(w->obj2wmap, &orig, &data)) {
12555 rids = (VALUE *)data;
12556 size = *rids++;
12557 for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
12558 wmap = (st_data_t)rids[i];
12559 st_delete(w->wmap2obj, &wmap, NULL);
12560 }
12561 ruby_sized_xfree((VALUE *)data, (size + 1) * sizeof(VALUE));
12562 }
12563
12564 wmap = (st_data_t)obj;
12565 if (st_delete(w->wmap2obj, &wmap, &orig)) {
12566 wmap = (st_data_t)obj;
12567 st_update(w->obj2wmap, orig, wmap_final_func, wmap);
12568 }
12569 return self;
12570}
12571
12572struct wmap_iter_arg {
12573 rb_objspace_t *objspace;
12574 VALUE value;
12575};
12576
12577static VALUE
12578wmap_inspect_append(rb_objspace_t *objspace, VALUE str, VALUE obj)
12579{
12580 if (SPECIAL_CONST_P(obj)) {
12581 return rb_str_append(str, rb_inspect(obj));
12582 }
12583 else if (wmap_live_p(objspace, obj)) {
12584 return rb_str_append(str, rb_any_to_s(obj));
12585 }
12586 else {
12587 return rb_str_catf(str, "#<collected:%p>", (void*)obj);
12588 }
12589}
12590
12591static int
12592wmap_inspect_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12593{
12594 struct wmap_iter_arg *argp = (struct wmap_iter_arg *)arg;
12595 rb_objspace_t *objspace = argp->objspace;
12596 VALUE str = argp->value;
12597 VALUE k = (VALUE)key, v = (VALUE)val;
12598
12599 if (RSTRING_PTR(str)[0] == '#') {
12600 rb_str_cat2(str, ", ");
12601 }
12602 else {
12603 rb_str_cat2(str, ": ");
12604 RSTRING_PTR(str)[0] = '#';
12605 }
12606 wmap_inspect_append(objspace, str, k);
12607 rb_str_cat2(str, " => ");
12608 wmap_inspect_append(objspace, str, v);
12609
12610 return ST_CONTINUE;
12611}
12612
12613static VALUE
12614wmap_inspect(VALUE self)
12615{
12616 VALUE str;
12617 VALUE c = rb_class_name(CLASS_OF(self));
12618 struct weakmap *w;
12619 struct wmap_iter_arg args;
12620
12621 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12622 str = rb_sprintf("-<%"PRIsVALUE":%p", c, (void *)self);
12623 if (w->wmap2obj) {
12624 args.objspace = &rb_objspace;
12625 args.value = str;
12626 st_foreach(w->wmap2obj, wmap_inspect_i, (st_data_t)&args);
12627 }
12628 RSTRING_PTR(str)[0] = '#';
12629 rb_str_cat2(str, ">");
12630 return str;
12631}
12632
12633static inline bool
12634wmap_live_entry_p(rb_objspace_t *objspace, st_data_t key, st_data_t val)
12635{
12636 return wmap_live_p(objspace, (VALUE)key) && wmap_live_p(objspace, (VALUE)val);
12637}
12638
12639static int
12640wmap_each_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12641{
12642 rb_objspace_t *objspace = (rb_objspace_t *)arg;
12643
12644 if (wmap_live_entry_p(objspace, key, val)) {
12645 rb_yield_values(2, (VALUE)key, (VALUE)val);
12646 return ST_CONTINUE;
12647 }
12648 else {
12649 return ST_DELETE;
12650 }
12651}
12652
12653/* Iterates over keys and objects in a weakly referenced object */
12654static VALUE
12655wmap_each(VALUE self)
12656{
12657 struct weakmap *w;
12658 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
12659
12660 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12661 st_foreach(w->wmap2obj, wmap_each_i, (st_data_t)objspace);
12662 return self;
12663}
12664
12665static int
12666wmap_each_key_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12667{
12668 rb_objspace_t *objspace = (rb_objspace_t *)arg;
12669
12670 if (wmap_live_entry_p(objspace, key, val)) {
12671 rb_yield((VALUE)key);
12672 return ST_CONTINUE;
12673 }
12674 else {
12675 return ST_DELETE;
12676 }
12677}
12678
12679/* Iterates over keys and objects in a weakly referenced object */
12680static VALUE
12681wmap_each_key(VALUE self)
12682{
12683 struct weakmap *w;
12684 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
12685
12686 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12687 st_foreach(w->wmap2obj, wmap_each_key_i, (st_data_t)objspace);
12688 return self;
12689}
12690
12691static int
12692wmap_each_value_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12693{
12694 rb_objspace_t *objspace = (rb_objspace_t *)arg;
12695
12696 if (wmap_live_entry_p(objspace, key, val)) {
12697 rb_yield((VALUE)val);
12698 return ST_CONTINUE;
12699 }
12700 else {
12701 return ST_DELETE;
12702 }
12703}
12704
12705/* Iterates over keys and objects in a weakly referenced object */
12706static VALUE
12707wmap_each_value(VALUE self)
12708{
12709 struct weakmap *w;
12710 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
12711
12712 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12713 st_foreach(w->wmap2obj, wmap_each_value_i, (st_data_t)objspace);
12714 return self;
12715}
12716
12717static int
12718wmap_keys_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12719{
12720 struct wmap_iter_arg *argp = (struct wmap_iter_arg *)arg;
12721 rb_objspace_t *objspace = argp->objspace;
12722 VALUE ary = argp->value;
12723
12724 if (wmap_live_entry_p(objspace, key, val)) {
12725 rb_ary_push(ary, (VALUE)key);
12726 return ST_CONTINUE;
12727 }
12728 else {
12729 return ST_DELETE;
12730 }
12731}
12732
12733/* Iterates over keys and objects in a weakly referenced object */
12734static VALUE
12735wmap_keys(VALUE self)
12736{
12737 struct weakmap *w;
12738 struct wmap_iter_arg args;
12739
12740 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12741 args.objspace = &rb_objspace;
12742 args.value = rb_ary_new();
12743 st_foreach(w->wmap2obj, wmap_keys_i, (st_data_t)&args);
12744 return args.value;
12745}
12746
12747static int
12748wmap_values_i(st_data_t key, st_data_t val, st_data_t arg)
12749{
12750 struct wmap_iter_arg *argp = (struct wmap_iter_arg *)arg;
12751 rb_objspace_t *objspace = argp->objspace;
12752 VALUE ary = argp->value;
12753
12754 if (wmap_live_entry_p(objspace, key, val)) {
12755 rb_ary_push(ary, (VALUE)val);
12756 return ST_CONTINUE;
12757 }
12758 else {
12759 return ST_DELETE;
12760 }
12761}
12762
12763/* Iterates over values and objects in a weakly referenced object */
12764static VALUE
12765wmap_values(VALUE self)
12766{
12767 struct weakmap *w;
12768 struct wmap_iter_arg args;
12769
12770 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12771 args.objspace = &rb_objspace;
12772 args.value = rb_ary_new();
12773 st_foreach(w->wmap2obj, wmap_values_i, (st_data_t)&args);
12774 return args.value;
12775}
12776
12777static int
12778wmap_aset_update(st_data_t *key, st_data_t *val, st_data_t arg, int existing)
12779{
12780 VALUE size, *ptr, *optr;
12781 if (existing) {
12782 size = (ptr = optr = (VALUE *)*val)[0];
12783 ++size;
12784 SIZED_REALLOC_N(ptr, VALUE, size + 1, size);
12785 }
12786 else {
12787 optr = 0;
12788 size = 1;
12789 ptr = ruby_xmalloc0(2 * sizeof(VALUE));
12790 }
12791 ptr[0] = size;
12792 ptr[size] = (VALUE)arg;
12793 if (ptr == optr) return ST_STOP;
12794 *val = (st_data_t)ptr;
12795 return ST_CONTINUE;
12796}
12797
12798/* Creates a weak reference from the given key to the given value */
12799static VALUE
12800wmap_aset(VALUE self, VALUE key, VALUE value)
12801{
12802 struct weakmap *w;
12803
12804 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12805 if (FL_ABLE(value)) {
12806 define_final0(value, w->final);
12807 }
12808 if (FL_ABLE(key)) {
12809 define_final0(key, w->final);
12810 }
12811
12812 st_update(w->obj2wmap, (st_data_t)value, wmap_aset_update, key);
12813 st_insert(w->wmap2obj, (st_data_t)key, (st_data_t)value);
12814 return nonspecial_obj_id(value);
12815}
12816
12817/* Retrieves a weakly referenced object with the given key */
12818static VALUE
12819wmap_lookup(VALUE self, VALUE key)
12820{
12821 st_data_t data;
12822 VALUE obj;
12823 struct weakmap *w;
12824 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
12825 GC_ASSERT(wmap_live_p(objspace, key));
12826
12827 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12828 if (!st_lookup(w->wmap2obj, (st_data_t)key, &data)) return Qundef;
12829 obj = (VALUE)data;
12830 if (!wmap_live_p(objspace, obj)) return Qundef;
12831 return obj;
12832}
12833
12834/* Retrieves a weakly referenced object with the given key */
12835static VALUE
12836wmap_aref(VALUE self, VALUE key)
12837{
12838 VALUE obj = wmap_lookup(self, key);
12839 return obj != Qundef ? obj : Qnil;
12840}
12841
12842/* Returns +true+ if +key+ is registered */
12843static VALUE
12844wmap_has_key(VALUE self, VALUE key)
12845{
12846 return RBOOL(wmap_lookup(self, key) != Qundef);
12847}
12848
12849/* Returns the number of referenced objects */
12850static VALUE
12851wmap_size(VALUE self)
12852{
12853 struct weakmap *w;
12854 st_index_t n;
12855
12856 TypedData_Get_Struct(self, struct weakmap, &weakmap_type, w);
12857 n = w->wmap2obj->num_entries;
12858#if SIZEOF_ST_INDEX_T <= SIZEOF_LONG
12859 return ULONG2NUM(n);
12860#else
12861 return ULL2NUM(n);
12862#endif
12863}
12864
12865/*
12866 ------------------------------ GC profiler ------------------------------
12867*/
12868
12869#define GC_PROFILE_RECORD_DEFAULT_SIZE 100
12870
12871static bool
12872current_process_time(struct timespec *ts)
12873{
12874#if defined(HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME) && defined(CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID)
12875 {
12876 static int try_clock_gettime = 1;
12877 if (try_clock_gettime && clock_gettime(CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID, ts) == 0) {
12878 return true;
12879 }
12880 else {
12881 try_clock_gettime = 0;
12882 }
12883 }
12884#endif
12885
12886#ifdef RUSAGE_SELF
12887 {
12888 struct rusage usage;
12889 struct timeval time;
12890 if (getrusage(RUSAGE_SELF, &usage) == 0) {
12891 time = usage.ru_utime;
12892 ts->tv_sec = time.tv_sec;
12893 ts->tv_nsec = (int32_t)time.tv_usec * 1000;
12894 return true;
12895 }
12896 }
12897#endif
12898
12899#ifdef _WIN32
12900 {
12901 FILETIME creation_time, exit_time, kernel_time, user_time;
12902 ULARGE_INTEGER ui;
12903
12904 if (GetProcessTimes(GetCurrentProcess(),
12905 &creation_time, &exit_time, &kernel_time, &user_time) != 0) {
12906 memcpy(&ui, &user_time, sizeof(FILETIME));
12907#define PER100NSEC (uint64_t)(1000 * 1000 * 10)
12908 ts->tv_nsec = (long)(ui.QuadPart % PER100NSEC);
12909 ts->tv_sec = (time_t)(ui.QuadPart / PER100NSEC);
12910 return true;
12911 }
12912 }
12913#endif
12914
12915 return false;
12916}
12917
12918static double
12919getrusage_time(void)
12920{
12921 struct timespec ts;
12922 if (current_process_time(&ts)) {
12923 return ts.tv_sec + ts.tv_nsec * 1e-9;
12924 }
12925 else {
12926 return 0.0;
12927 }
12928}
12929
12930
12931static inline void
12932gc_prof_setup_new_record(rb_objspace_t *objspace, unsigned int reason)
12933{
12934 if (objspace->profile.run) {
12935 size_t index = objspace->profile.next_index;
12936 gc_profile_record *record;
12937
12938 /* create new record */
12939 objspace->profile.next_index++;
12940
12941 if (!objspace->profile.records) {
12942 objspace->profile.size = GC_PROFILE_RECORD_DEFAULT_SIZE;
12943 objspace->profile.records = malloc(xmalloc2_size(sizeof(gc_profile_record), objspace->profile.size));
12944 }
12945 if (index >= objspace->profile.size) {
12946 void *ptr;
12947 objspace->profile.size += 1000;
12948 ptr = realloc(objspace->profile.records, xmalloc2_size(sizeof(gc_profile_record), objspace->profile.size));
12949 if (!ptr) rb_memerror();
12950 objspace->profile.records = ptr;
12951 }
12952 if (!objspace->profile.records) {
12953 rb_bug("gc_profile malloc or realloc miss");
12954 }
12955 record = objspace->profile.current_record = &objspace->profile.records[objspace->profile.next_index - 1];
12956 MEMZERO(record, gc_profile_record, 1);
12957
12958 /* setup before-GC parameter */
12959 record->flags = reason | (ruby_gc_stressful ? GPR_FLAG_STRESS : 0);
12960#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
12961 record->allocated_size = malloc_allocated_size;
12962#endif
12963#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL && GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY
12964#ifdef RUSAGE_SELF
12965 {
12966 struct rusage usage;
12967 if (getrusage(RUSAGE_SELF, &usage) == 0) {
12968 record->maxrss = usage.ru_maxrss;
12969 record->minflt = usage.ru_minflt;
12970 record->majflt = usage.ru_majflt;
12971 }
12972 }
12973#endif
12974#endif
12975 }
12976}
12977
12978static inline void
12979gc_prof_timer_start(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
12980{
12981 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
12982 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
12983#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
12984 record->prepare_time = objspace->profile.prepare_time;
12985#endif
12986 record->gc_time = 0;
12987 record->gc_invoke_time = getrusage_time();
12988 }
12989}
12990
12991static double
12992elapsed_time_from(double time)
12993{
12994 double now = getrusage_time();
12995 if (now > time) {
12996 return now - time;
12997 }
12998 else {
12999 return 0;
13000 }
13001}
13002
13003static inline void
13004gc_prof_timer_stop(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13005{
13006 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13007 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
13008 record->gc_time = elapsed_time_from(record->gc_invoke_time);
13009 record->gc_invoke_time -= objspace->profile.invoke_time;
13010 }
13011}
13012
13013#define RUBY_DTRACE_GC_HOOK(name) \
13014 do {if (RUBY_DTRACE_GC_##name##_ENABLED()) RUBY_DTRACE_GC_##name();} while (0)
13015static inline void
13016gc_prof_mark_timer_start(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13017{
13018 RUBY_DTRACE_GC_HOOK(MARK_BEGIN);
13019#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13020 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13021 gc_prof_record(objspace)->gc_mark_time = getrusage_time();
13022 }
13023#endif
13024}
13025
13026static inline void
13027gc_prof_mark_timer_stop(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13028{
13029 RUBY_DTRACE_GC_HOOK(MARK_END);
13030#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13031 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13032 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
13033 record->gc_mark_time = elapsed_time_from(record->gc_mark_time);
13034 }
13035#endif
13036}
13037
13038static inline void
13039gc_prof_sweep_timer_start(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13040{
13041 RUBY_DTRACE_GC_HOOK(SWEEP_BEGIN);
13042 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13043 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
13044
13045 if (record->gc_time > 0 || GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL) {
13046 objspace->profile.gc_sweep_start_time = getrusage_time();
13047 }
13048 }
13049}
13050
13051static inline void
13052gc_prof_sweep_timer_stop(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13053{
13054 RUBY_DTRACE_GC_HOOK(SWEEP_END);
13055
13056 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13057 double sweep_time;
13058 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
13059
13060 if (record->gc_time > 0) {
13061 sweep_time = elapsed_time_from(objspace->profile.gc_sweep_start_time);
13062 /* need to accumulate GC time for lazy sweep after gc() */
13063 record->gc_time += sweep_time;
13064 }
13065 else if (GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL) {
13066 sweep_time = elapsed_time_from(objspace->profile.gc_sweep_start_time);
13067 }
13068
13069#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13070 record->gc_sweep_time += sweep_time;
13071 if (heap_pages_deferred_final) record->flags |= GPR_FLAG_HAVE_FINALIZE;
13072#endif
13073 if (heap_pages_deferred_final) objspace->profile.latest_gc_info |= GPR_FLAG_HAVE_FINALIZE;
13074 }
13075}
13076
13077static inline void
13078gc_prof_set_malloc_info(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13079{
13080#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13081 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13082 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
13083 record->allocate_increase = malloc_increase;
13084 record->allocate_limit = malloc_limit;
13085 }
13086#endif
13087}
13088
13089static inline void
13090gc_prof_set_heap_info(rb_objspace_t *objspace)
13091{
13092 if (gc_prof_enabled(objspace)) {
13093 gc_profile_record *record = gc_prof_record(objspace);
13094 size_t live = objspace->profile.total_allocated_objects_at_gc_start - objspace->profile.total_freed_objects;
13095 size_t total = objspace->profile.heap_used_at_gc_start * HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT;
13096
13097#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13098 record->heap_use_pages = objspace->profile.heap_used_at_gc_start;
13099 record->heap_live_objects = live;
13100 record->heap_free_objects = total - live;
13101#endif
13102
13103 record->heap_total_objects = total;
13104 record->heap_use_size = live * sizeof(RVALUE);
13105 record->heap_total_size = total * sizeof(RVALUE);
13106 }
13107}
13108
13109/*
13110 * call-seq:
13111 * GC::Profiler.clear -> nil
13112 *
13113 * Clears the GC profiler data.
13114 *
13115 */
13116
13117static VALUE
13118gc_profile_clear(VALUE _)
13119{
13120 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13121 void *p = objspace->profile.records;
13122 objspace->profile.records = NULL;
13123 objspace->profile.size = 0;
13124 objspace->profile.next_index = 0;
13125 objspace->profile.current_record = 0;
13126 if (p) {
13127 free(p);
13128 }
13129 return Qnil;
13130}
13131
13132/*
13133 * call-seq:
13134 * GC::Profiler.raw_data -> [Hash, ...]
13135 *
13136 * Returns an Array of individual raw profile data Hashes ordered
13137 * from earliest to latest by +:GC_INVOKE_TIME+.
13138 *
13139 * For example:
13140 *
13141 * [
13142 * {
13143 * :GC_TIME=>1.3000000000000858e-05,
13144 * :GC_INVOKE_TIME=>0.010634999999999999,
13145 * :HEAP_USE_SIZE=>289640,
13146 * :HEAP_TOTAL_SIZE=>588960,
13147 * :HEAP_TOTAL_OBJECTS=>14724,
13148 * :GC_IS_MARKED=>false
13149 * },
13150 * # ...
13151 * ]
13152 *
13153 * The keys mean:
13154 *
13155 * +:GC_TIME+::
13156 * Time elapsed in seconds for this GC run
13157 * +:GC_INVOKE_TIME+::
13158 * Time elapsed in seconds from startup to when the GC was invoked
13159 * +:HEAP_USE_SIZE+::
13160 * Total bytes of heap used
13161 * +:HEAP_TOTAL_SIZE+::
13162 * Total size of heap in bytes
13163 * +:HEAP_TOTAL_OBJECTS+::
13164 * Total number of objects
13165 * +:GC_IS_MARKED+::
13166 * Returns +true+ if the GC is in mark phase
13167 *
13168 * If ruby was built with +GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL+, you will also have access
13169 * to the following hash keys:
13170 *
13171 * +:GC_MARK_TIME+::
13172 * +:GC_SWEEP_TIME+::
13173 * +:ALLOCATE_INCREASE+::
13174 * +:ALLOCATE_LIMIT+::
13175 * +:HEAP_USE_PAGES+::
13176 * +:HEAP_LIVE_OBJECTS+::
13177 * +:HEAP_FREE_OBJECTS+::
13178 * +:HAVE_FINALIZE+::
13179 *
13180 */
13181
13182static VALUE
13183gc_profile_record_get(VALUE _)
13184{
13185 VALUE prof;
13186 VALUE gc_profile = rb_ary_new();
13187 size_t i;
13188 rb_objspace_t *objspace = (&rb_objspace);
13189
13190 if (!objspace->profile.run) {
13191 return Qnil;
13192 }
13193
13194 for (i =0; i < objspace->profile.next_index; i++) {
13195 gc_profile_record *record = &objspace->profile.records[i];
13196
13197 prof = rb_hash_new();
13198 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("GC_FLAGS")), gc_info_decode(0, rb_hash_new(), record->flags));
13199 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("GC_TIME")), DBL2NUM(record->gc_time));
13200 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("GC_INVOKE_TIME")), DBL2NUM(record->gc_invoke_time));
13201 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_USE_SIZE")), SIZET2NUM(record->heap_use_size));
13202 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_TOTAL_SIZE")), SIZET2NUM(record->heap_total_size));
13203 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_TOTAL_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->heap_total_objects));
13204 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("MOVED_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->moved_objects));
13205 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("GC_IS_MARKED")), Qtrue);
13206#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13207 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("GC_MARK_TIME")), DBL2NUM(record->gc_mark_time));
13208 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("GC_SWEEP_TIME")), DBL2NUM(record->gc_sweep_time));
13209 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("ALLOCATE_INCREASE")), SIZET2NUM(record->allocate_increase));
13210 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("ALLOCATE_LIMIT")), SIZET2NUM(record->allocate_limit));
13211 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_USE_PAGES")), SIZET2NUM(record->heap_use_pages));
13212 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_LIVE_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->heap_live_objects));
13213 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_FREE_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->heap_free_objects));
13214
13215 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("REMOVING_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->removing_objects));
13216 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("EMPTY_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->empty_objects));
13217
13218 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HAVE_FINALIZE")), RBOOL(record->flags & GPR_FLAG_HAVE_FINALIZE));
13219#endif
13220
13221#if RGENGC_PROFILE > 0
13222 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("OLD_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->old_objects));
13223 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("REMEMBERED_NORMAL_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->remembered_normal_objects));
13224 rb_hash_aset(prof, ID2SYM(rb_intern("REMEMBERED_SHADY_OBJECTS")), SIZET2NUM(record->remembered_shady_objects));
13225#endif
13226 rb_ary_push(gc_profile, prof);
13227 }
13228
13229 return gc_profile;
13230}
13231
13232#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13233#define MAJOR_REASON_MAX 0x10
13234
13235static char *
13236gc_profile_dump_major_reason(unsigned int flags, char *buff)
13237{
13238 unsigned int reason = flags & GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_MASK;
13239 int i = 0;
13240
13241 if (reason == GPR_FLAG_NONE) {
13242 buff[0] = '-';
13243 buff[1] = 0;
13244 }
13245 else {
13246#define C(x, s) \
13247 if (reason & GPR_FLAG_MAJOR_BY_##x) { \
13248 buff[i++] = #x[0]; \
13249 if (i >= MAJOR_REASON_MAX) rb_bug("gc_profile_dump_major_reason: overflow"); \
13250 buff[i] = 0; \
13251 }
13252 C(NOFREE, N);
13253 C(OLDGEN, O);
13254 C(SHADY, S);
13255#if RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC
13256 C(OLDMALLOC, M);
13257#endif
13258#undef C
13259 }
13260 return buff;
13261}
13262#endif
13263
13264static void
13265gc_profile_dump_on(VALUE out, VALUE (*append)(VALUE, VALUE))
13266{
13267 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13268 size_t count = objspace->profile.next_index;
13269#ifdef MAJOR_REASON_MAX
13270 char reason_str[MAJOR_REASON_MAX];
13271#endif
13272
13273 if (objspace->profile.run && count /* > 1 */) {
13274 size_t i;
13275 const gc_profile_record *record;
13276
13277 append(out, rb_sprintf("GC %"PRIuSIZE" invokes.\n", objspace->profile.count));
13278 append(out, rb_str_new_cstr("Index Invoke Time(sec) Use Size(byte) Total Size(byte) Total Object GC Time(ms)\n"));
13279
13280 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
13281 record = &objspace->profile.records[i];
13282 append(out, rb_sprintf("%5"PRIuSIZE" %19.3f %20"PRIuSIZE" %20"PRIuSIZE" %20"PRIuSIZE" %30.20f\n",
13283 i+1, record->gc_invoke_time, record->heap_use_size,
13284 record->heap_total_size, record->heap_total_objects, record->gc_time*1000));
13285 }
13286
13287#if GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL
13288 const char *str = "\n\n" \
13289 "More detail.\n" \
13290 "Prepare Time = Previously GC's rest sweep time\n"
13291 "Index Flags Allocate Inc. Allocate Limit"
13292#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
13293 " Allocated Size"
13294#endif
13295 " Use Page Mark Time(ms) Sweep Time(ms) Prepare Time(ms) LivingObj FreeObj RemovedObj EmptyObj"
13296#if RGENGC_PROFILE
13297 " OldgenObj RemNormObj RemShadObj"
13298#endif
13299#if GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY
13300 " MaxRSS(KB) MinorFLT MajorFLT"
13301#endif
13302 "\n";
13303 append(out, rb_str_new_cstr(str));
13304
13305 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
13306 record = &objspace->profile.records[i];
13307 append(out, rb_sprintf("%5"PRIuSIZE" %4s/%c/%6s%c %13"PRIuSIZE" %15"PRIuSIZE
13308#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
13309 " %15"PRIuSIZE
13310#endif
13311 " %9"PRIuSIZE" %17.12f %17.12f %17.12f %10"PRIuSIZE" %10"PRIuSIZE" %10"PRIuSIZE" %10"PRIuSIZE
13312#if RGENGC_PROFILE
13313 "%10"PRIuSIZE" %10"PRIuSIZE" %10"PRIuSIZE
13314#endif
13315#if GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY
13316 "%11ld %8ld %8ld"
13317#endif
13318
13319 "\n",
13320 i+1,
13321 gc_profile_dump_major_reason(record->flags, reason_str),
13322 (record->flags & GPR_FLAG_HAVE_FINALIZE) ? 'F' : '.',
13323 (record->flags & GPR_FLAG_NEWOBJ) ? "NEWOBJ" :
13324 (record->flags & GPR_FLAG_MALLOC) ? "MALLOC" :
13325 (record->flags & GPR_FLAG_METHOD) ? "METHOD" :
13326 (record->flags & GPR_FLAG_CAPI) ? "CAPI__" : "??????",
13327 (record->flags & GPR_FLAG_STRESS) ? '!' : ' ',
13328 record->allocate_increase, record->allocate_limit,
13329#if CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE
13330 record->allocated_size,
13331#endif
13332 record->heap_use_pages,
13333 record->gc_mark_time*1000,
13334 record->gc_sweep_time*1000,
13335 record->prepare_time*1000,
13336
13337 record->heap_live_objects,
13338 record->heap_free_objects,
13339 record->removing_objects,
13340 record->empty_objects
13341#if RGENGC_PROFILE
13342 ,
13343 record->old_objects,
13344 record->remembered_normal_objects,
13345 record->remembered_shady_objects
13346#endif
13347#if GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY
13348 ,
13349 record->maxrss / 1024,
13350 record->minflt,
13351 record->majflt
13352#endif
13353
13354 ));
13355 }
13356#endif
13357 }
13358}
13359
13360/*
13361 * call-seq:
13362 * GC::Profiler.result -> String
13363 *
13364 * Returns a profile data report such as:
13365 *
13366 * GC 1 invokes.
13367 * Index Invoke Time(sec) Use Size(byte) Total Size(byte) Total Object GC time(ms)
13368 * 1 0.012 159240 212940 10647 0.00000000000001530000
13369 */
13370
13371static VALUE
13372gc_profile_result(VALUE _)
13373{
13374 VALUE str = rb_str_buf_new(0);
13375 gc_profile_dump_on(str, rb_str_buf_append);
13376 return str;
13377}
13378
13379/*
13380 * call-seq:
13381 * GC::Profiler.report
13382 * GC::Profiler.report(io)
13383 *
13384 * Writes the GC::Profiler.result to <tt>$stdout</tt> or the given IO object.
13385 *
13386 */
13387
13388static VALUE
13389gc_profile_report(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE self)
13390{
13391 VALUE out;
13392
13393 out = (!rb_check_arity(argc, 0, 1) ? rb_stdout : argv[0]);
13394 gc_profile_dump_on(out, rb_io_write);
13395
13396 return Qnil;
13397}
13398
13399/*
13400 * call-seq:
13401 * GC::Profiler.total_time -> float
13402 *
13403 * The total time used for garbage collection in seconds
13404 */
13405
13406static VALUE
13407gc_profile_total_time(VALUE self)
13408{
13409 double time = 0;
13410 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13411
13412 if (objspace->profile.run && objspace->profile.next_index > 0) {
13413 size_t i;
13414 size_t count = objspace->profile.next_index;
13415
13416 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
13417 time += objspace->profile.records[i].gc_time;
13418 }
13419 }
13420 return DBL2NUM(time);
13421}
13422
13423/*
13424 * call-seq:
13425 * GC::Profiler.enabled? -> true or false
13426 *
13427 * The current status of GC profile mode.
13428 */
13429
13430static VALUE
13431gc_profile_enable_get(VALUE self)
13432{
13433 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13434 return RBOOL(objspace->profile.run);
13435}
13436
13437/*
13438 * call-seq:
13439 * GC::Profiler.enable -> nil
13440 *
13441 * Starts the GC profiler.
13442 *
13443 */
13444
13445static VALUE
13446gc_profile_enable(VALUE _)
13447{
13448 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13449 objspace->profile.run = TRUE;
13450 objspace->profile.current_record = 0;
13451 return Qnil;
13452}
13453
13454/*
13455 * call-seq:
13456 * GC::Profiler.disable -> nil
13457 *
13458 * Stops the GC profiler.
13459 *
13460 */
13461
13462static VALUE
13463gc_profile_disable(VALUE _)
13464{
13465 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13466
13467 objspace->profile.run = FALSE;
13468 objspace->profile.current_record = 0;
13469 return Qnil;
13470}
13471
13472/*
13473 ------------------------------ DEBUG ------------------------------
13474*/
13475
13476static const char *
13477type_name(int type, VALUE obj)
13478{
13479 switch (type) {
13480#define TYPE_NAME(t) case (t): return #t;
13481 TYPE_NAME(T_NONE);
13482 TYPE_NAME(T_OBJECT);
13483 TYPE_NAME(T_CLASS);
13484 TYPE_NAME(T_MODULE);
13485 TYPE_NAME(T_FLOAT);
13486 TYPE_NAME(T_STRING);
13487 TYPE_NAME(T_REGEXP);
13488 TYPE_NAME(T_ARRAY);
13489 TYPE_NAME(T_HASH);
13490 TYPE_NAME(T_STRUCT);
13491 TYPE_NAME(T_BIGNUM);
13492 TYPE_NAME(T_FILE);
13493 TYPE_NAME(T_MATCH);
13494 TYPE_NAME(T_COMPLEX);
13495 TYPE_NAME(T_RATIONAL);
13496 TYPE_NAME(T_NIL);
13497 TYPE_NAME(T_TRUE);
13498 TYPE_NAME(T_FALSE);
13499 TYPE_NAME(T_SYMBOL);
13500 TYPE_NAME(T_FIXNUM);
13501 TYPE_NAME(T_UNDEF);
13502 TYPE_NAME(T_IMEMO);
13503 TYPE_NAME(T_ICLASS);
13504 TYPE_NAME(T_MOVED);
13505 TYPE_NAME(T_ZOMBIE);
13506 case T_DATA:
13507 if (obj && rb_objspace_data_type_name(obj)) {
13508 return rb_objspace_data_type_name(obj);
13509 }
13510 return "T_DATA";
13511#undef TYPE_NAME
13512 }
13513 return "unknown";
13514}
13515
13516static const char *
13517obj_type_name(VALUE obj)
13518{
13519 return type_name(TYPE(obj), obj);
13520}
13521
13522const char *
13523rb_method_type_name(rb_method_type_t type)
13524{
13525 switch (type) {
13526 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_ISEQ: return "iseq";
13527 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_ATTRSET: return "attrest";
13528 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_IVAR: return "ivar";
13529 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_BMETHOD: return "bmethod";
13530 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_ALIAS: return "alias";
13531 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_REFINED: return "refined";
13532 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_CFUNC: return "cfunc";
13533 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_ZSUPER: return "zsuper";
13534 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_MISSING: return "missing";
13535 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_OPTIMIZED: return "optimized";
13536 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_UNDEF: return "undef";
13537 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_NOTIMPLEMENTED: return "notimplemented";
13538 }
13539 rb_bug("rb_method_type_name: unreachable (type: %d)", type);
13540}
13541
13542/* from array.c */
13543# define ARY_SHARED_P(ary) \
13544 (GC_ASSERT(!FL_TEST((ary), ELTS_SHARED) || !FL_TEST((ary), RARRAY_EMBED_FLAG)), \
13545 FL_TEST((ary),ELTS_SHARED)!=0)
13546# define ARY_EMBED_P(ary) \
13547 (GC_ASSERT(!FL_TEST((ary), ELTS_SHARED) || !FL_TEST((ary), RARRAY_EMBED_FLAG)), \
13548 FL_TEST((ary), RARRAY_EMBED_FLAG)!=0)
13549
13550static void
13551rb_raw_iseq_info(char *buff, const int buff_size, const rb_iseq_t *iseq)
13552{
13553 if (buff_size > 0 && ISEQ_BODY(iseq) && ISEQ_BODY(iseq)->location.label && !RB_TYPE_P(ISEQ_BODY(iseq)->location.pathobj, T_MOVED)) {
13554 VALUE path = rb_iseq_path(iseq);
13555 VALUE n = ISEQ_BODY(iseq)->location.first_lineno;
13556 snprintf(buff, buff_size, " %s@%s:%d",
13557 RSTRING_PTR(ISEQ_BODY(iseq)->location.label),
13558 RSTRING_PTR(path),
13559 n ? FIX2INT(n) : 0 );
13560 }
13561}
13562
13563static int
13564str_len_no_raise(VALUE str)
13565{
13566 long len = RSTRING_LEN(str);
13567 if (len < 0) return 0;
13568 if (len > INT_MAX) return INT_MAX;
13569 return (int)len;
13570}
13571
13572const char *
13573rb_raw_obj_info(char *buff, const int buff_size, VALUE obj)
13574{
13575 int pos = 0;
13576 void *poisoned = asan_poisoned_object_p(obj);
13577 asan_unpoison_object(obj, false);
13578
13579#define BUFF_ARGS buff + pos, buff_size - pos
13580#define APPENDF(f) if ((pos += snprintf f) >= buff_size) goto end
13581 if (SPECIAL_CONST_P(obj)) {
13582 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "%s", obj_type_name(obj)));
13583
13584 if (FIXNUM_P(obj)) {
13585 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " %ld", FIX2LONG(obj)));
13586 }
13587 else if (SYMBOL_P(obj)) {
13588 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " %s", rb_id2name(SYM2ID(obj))));
13589 }
13590 }
13591 else {
13592#define TF(c) ((c) != 0 ? "true" : "false")
13593#define C(c, s) ((c) != 0 ? (s) : " ")
13594 const int type = BUILTIN_TYPE(obj);
13595 const int age = RVALUE_FLAGS_AGE(RBASIC(obj)->flags);
13596
13597 if (is_pointer_to_heap(&rb_objspace, (void *)obj)) {
13598 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "%p [%d%s%s%s%s%s%s] %s ",
13599 (void *)obj, age,
13600 C(RVALUE_UNCOLLECTIBLE_BITMAP(obj), "L"),
13601 C(RVALUE_MARK_BITMAP(obj), "M"),
13602 C(RVALUE_PIN_BITMAP(obj), "P"),
13603 C(RVALUE_MARKING_BITMAP(obj), "R"),
13604 C(RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED_BITMAP(obj), "U"),
13605 C(rb_objspace_garbage_object_p(obj), "G"),
13606 obj_type_name(obj)));
13607 }
13608 else {
13609 /* fake */
13610 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "%p [%dXXXX] %s",
13611 (void *)obj, age,
13612 obj_type_name(obj)));
13613 }
13614
13615 if (internal_object_p(obj)) {
13616 /* ignore */
13617 }
13618 else if (RBASIC(obj)->klass == 0) {
13619 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(temporary internal)"));
13620 }
13621 else if (RTEST(RBASIC(obj)->klass)) {
13622 VALUE class_path = rb_class_path_cached(RBASIC(obj)->klass);
13623 if (!NIL_P(class_path)) {
13624 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(%s)", RSTRING_PTR(class_path)));
13625 }
13626 }
13627
13628#if GC_DEBUG
13629 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "@%s:%d", RANY(obj)->file, RANY(obj)->line));
13630#endif
13631
13632 switch (type) {
13633 case T_NODE:
13634 UNEXPECTED_NODE(rb_raw_obj_info);
13635 break;
13636 case T_ARRAY:
13637 if (FL_TEST(obj, ELTS_SHARED)) {
13638 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "shared -> %s",
13639 rb_obj_info(RARRAY(obj)->as.heap.aux.shared_root)));
13640 }
13641 else if (FL_TEST(obj, RARRAY_EMBED_FLAG)) {
13642 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "[%s%s] len: %ld (embed)",
13643 C(ARY_EMBED_P(obj), "E"),
13644 C(ARY_SHARED_P(obj), "S"),
13645 RARRAY_LEN(obj)));
13646 }
13647 else {
13648 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "[%s%s%s] len: %ld, capa:%ld ptr:%p",
13649 C(ARY_EMBED_P(obj), "E"),
13650 C(ARY_SHARED_P(obj), "S"),
13651 C(RARRAY_TRANSIENT_P(obj), "T"),
13652 RARRAY_LEN(obj),
13653 ARY_EMBED_P(obj) ? -1L : RARRAY(obj)->as.heap.aux.capa,
13654 (void *)RARRAY_CONST_PTR_TRANSIENT(obj)));
13655 }
13656 break;
13657 case T_STRING: {
13658 if (STR_SHARED_P(obj)) {
13659 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " [shared] len: %ld", RSTRING_LEN(obj)));
13660 }
13661 else {
13662 if (STR_EMBED_P(obj)) APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " [embed]"));
13663
13664 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " len: %ld, capa: %" PRIdSIZE, RSTRING_LEN(obj), rb_str_capacity(obj)));
13665 }
13666 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " \"%.*s\"", str_len_no_raise(obj), RSTRING_PTR(obj)));
13667 break;
13668 }
13669 case T_SYMBOL: {
13670 VALUE fstr = RSYMBOL(obj)->fstr;
13671 ID id = RSYMBOL(obj)->id;
13672 if (RB_TYPE_P(fstr, T_STRING)) {
13673 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, ":%s id:%d", RSTRING_PTR(fstr), (unsigned int)id));
13674 }
13675 else {
13676 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(%p) id:%d", (void *)fstr, (unsigned int)id));
13677 }
13678 break;
13679 }
13680 case T_MOVED: {
13681 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "-> %p", (void*)rb_gc_location(obj)));
13682 break;
13683 }
13684 case T_HASH: {
13685 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "[%c%c] %"PRIdSIZE,
13686 RHASH_AR_TABLE_P(obj) ? 'A' : 'S',
13687 RHASH_TRANSIENT_P(obj) ? 'T' : ' ',
13688 RHASH_SIZE(obj)));
13689 break;
13690 }
13691 case T_CLASS:
13692 case T_MODULE:
13693 {
13694 VALUE class_path = rb_class_path_cached(obj);
13695 if (!NIL_P(class_path)) {
13696 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "%s", RSTRING_PTR(class_path)));
13697 }
13698 else {
13699 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(annon)"));
13700 }
13701 break;
13702 }
13703 case T_ICLASS:
13704 {
13705 VALUE class_path = rb_class_path_cached(RBASIC_CLASS(obj));
