13706 if (!NIL_P(class_path)) {
13707 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "src:%s", RSTRING_PTR(class_path)));
13708 }
13709 break;
13710 }
13711 case T_OBJECT:
13712 {
13713 uint32_t len = ROBJECT_NUMIV(obj);
13714
13715 if (RANY(obj)->as.basic.flags & ROBJECT_EMBED) {
13716 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(embed) len:%d", len));
13717 }
13718 else {
13719 VALUE *ptr = ROBJECT_IVPTR(obj);
13720 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "len:%d ptr:%p", len, (void *)ptr));
13721 }
13722 }
13723 break;
13724 case T_DATA: {
13725 const struct rb_block *block;
13726 const rb_iseq_t *iseq;
13727 if (rb_obj_is_proc(obj) &&
13728 (block = vm_proc_block(obj)) != NULL &&
13729 (vm_block_type(block) == block_type_iseq) &&
13730 (iseq = vm_block_iseq(block)) != NULL) {
13731 rb_raw_iseq_info(BUFF_ARGS, iseq);
13732 }
13733 else if (rb_ractor_p(obj)) {
13734 rb_ractor_t *r = (void *)DATA_PTR(obj);
13735 if (r) {
13736 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "r:%d", r->pub.id));
13737 }
13738 }
13739 else {
13740 const char * const type_name = rb_objspace_data_type_name(obj);
13741 if (type_name) {
13742 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "%s", type_name));
13743 }
13744 }
13745 break;
13746 }
13747 case T_IMEMO: {
13748 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "<%s> ", rb_imemo_name(imemo_type(obj))));
13749
13750 switch (imemo_type(obj)) {
13751 case imemo_ment:
13752 {
13753 const rb_method_entry_t *me = &RANY(obj)->as.imemo.ment;
13754
13755 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, ":%s (%s%s%s%s) type:%s alias:%d owner:%p defined_class:%p",
13756 rb_id2name(me->called_id),
13757 METHOD_ENTRY_VISI(me) == METHOD_VISI_PUBLIC ? "pub" :
13758 METHOD_ENTRY_VISI(me) == METHOD_VISI_PRIVATE ? "pri" : "pro",
13759 METHOD_ENTRY_COMPLEMENTED(me) ? ",cmp" : "",
13760 METHOD_ENTRY_CACHED(me) ? ",cc" : "",
13761 METHOD_ENTRY_INVALIDATED(me) ? ",inv" : "",
13762 me->def ? rb_method_type_name(me->def->type) : "NULL",
13763 me->def ? me->def->alias_count : -1,
13764 (void *)me->owner, // obj_info(me->owner),
13765 (void *)me->defined_class)); //obj_info(me->defined_class)));
13766
13767 if (me->def) {
13768 switch (me->def->type) {
13769 case VM_METHOD_TYPE_ISEQ:
13770 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, " (iseq:%s)", obj_info((VALUE)me->def->body.iseq.iseqptr)));
13771 break;
13772 default:
13773 break;
13774 }
13775 }
13776
13777 break;
13778 }
13779 case imemo_iseq: {
13780 const rb_iseq_t *iseq = (const rb_iseq_t *)obj;
13781 rb_raw_iseq_info(BUFF_ARGS, iseq);
13782 break;
13783 }
13784 case imemo_callinfo:
13785 {
13786 const struct rb_callinfo *ci = (const struct rb_callinfo *)obj;
13787 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(mid:%s, flag:%x argc:%d, kwarg:%s)",
13788 rb_id2name(vm_ci_mid(ci)),
13789 vm_ci_flag(ci),
13790 vm_ci_argc(ci),
13791 vm_ci_kwarg(ci) ? "available" : "NULL"));
13792 break;
13793 }
13794 case imemo_callcache:
13795 {
13796 const struct rb_callcache *cc = (const struct rb_callcache *)obj;
13797 VALUE class_path = cc->klass ? rb_class_path_cached(cc->klass) : Qnil;
13798 const rb_callable_method_entry_t *cme = vm_cc_cme(cc);
13799
13800 APPENDF((BUFF_ARGS, "(klass:%s cme:%s%s (%p) call:%p",
13801 NIL_P(class_path) ? (cc->klass ? "??" : "<NULL>") : RSTRING_PTR(class_path),
13802 cme ? rb_id2name(cme->called_id) : "<NULL>",
13803 cme ? (METHOD_ENTRY_INVALIDATED(cme) ? " [inv]" : "") : "",
13804 (void *)cme,
13805 (void *)vm_cc_call(cc)));
13806 break;
13807 }
13808 default:
13809 break;
13810 }
13811 }
13812 default:
13813 break;
13814 }
13815#undef TF
13816#undef C
13817 }
13818 end:
13819 if (poisoned) {
13820 asan_poison_object(obj);
13821 }
13822
13823 return buff;
13824#undef APPENDF
13825#undef BUFF_ARGS
13826}
13827
13828#if RGENGC_OBJ_INFO
13829#define OBJ_INFO_BUFFERS_NUM 10
13830#define OBJ_INFO_BUFFERS_SIZE 0x100
13831static int obj_info_buffers_index = 0;
13832static char obj_info_buffers[OBJ_INFO_BUFFERS_NUM][OBJ_INFO_BUFFERS_SIZE];
13833
13834static const char *
13835obj_info(VALUE obj)
13836{
13837 const int index = obj_info_buffers_index++;
13838 char *const buff = &obj_info_buffers[index][0];
13839
13840 if (obj_info_buffers_index >= OBJ_INFO_BUFFERS_NUM) {
13841 obj_info_buffers_index = 0;
13842 }
13843
13844 return rb_raw_obj_info(buff, OBJ_INFO_BUFFERS_SIZE, obj);
13845}
13846#else
13847static const char *
13848obj_info(VALUE obj)
13849{
13850 return obj_type_name(obj);
13851}
13852#endif
13853
13854MJIT_FUNC_EXPORTED const char *
13855rb_obj_info(VALUE obj)
13856{
13857 return obj_info(obj);
13858}
13859
13860void
13861rb_obj_info_dump(VALUE obj)
13862{
13863 char buff[0x100];
13864 fprintf(stderr, "rb_obj_info_dump: %s\n", rb_raw_obj_info(buff, 0x100, obj));
13865}
13866
13867MJIT_FUNC_EXPORTED void
13868rb_obj_info_dump_loc(VALUE obj, const char *file, int line, const char *func)
13869{
13870 char buff[0x100];
13871 fprintf(stderr, "<OBJ_INFO:%s@%s:%d> %s\n", func, file, line, rb_raw_obj_info(buff, 0x100, obj));
13872}
13873
13874#if GC_DEBUG
13875
13876void
13877rb_gcdebug_print_obj_condition(VALUE obj)
13878{
13879 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13880
13881 fprintf(stderr, "created at: %s:%d\n", RANY(obj)->file, RANY(obj)->line);
13882
13883 if (BUILTIN_TYPE(obj) == T_MOVED) {
13884 fprintf(stderr, "moved?: true\n");
13885 }
13886 else {
13887 fprintf(stderr, "moved?: false\n");
13888 }
13889 if (is_pointer_to_heap(objspace, (void *)obj)) {
13890 fprintf(stderr, "pointer to heap?: true\n");
13891 }
13892 else {
13893 fprintf(stderr, "pointer to heap?: false\n");
13894 return;
13895 }
13896
13897 fprintf(stderr, "marked? : %s\n", MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_MARK_BITS(obj), obj) ? "true" : "false");
13898 fprintf(stderr, "pinned? : %s\n", MARKED_IN_BITMAP(GET_HEAP_PINNED_BITS(obj), obj) ? "true" : "false");
13899 fprintf(stderr, "age? : %d\n", RVALUE_AGE(obj));
13900 fprintf(stderr, "old? : %s\n", RVALUE_OLD_P(obj) ? "true" : "false");
13901 fprintf(stderr, "WB-protected?: %s\n", RVALUE_WB_UNPROTECTED(obj) ? "false" : "true");
13902 fprintf(stderr, "remembered? : %s\n", RVALUE_REMEMBERED(obj) ? "true" : "false");
13903
13904 if (is_lazy_sweeping(objspace)) {
13905 fprintf(stderr, "lazy sweeping?: true\n");
13906 fprintf(stderr, "swept?: %s\n", is_swept_object(objspace, obj) ? "done" : "not yet");
13907 }
13908 else {
13909 fprintf(stderr, "lazy sweeping?: false\n");
13910 }
13911}
13912
13913static VALUE
13914gcdebug_sentinel(RB_BLOCK_CALL_FUNC_ARGLIST(obj, name))
13915{
13916 fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: object %s(%p) is inadvertently collected\n", (char *)name, (void *)obj);
13917 return Qnil;
13918}
13919
13920void
13921rb_gcdebug_sentinel(VALUE obj, const char *name)
13922{
13923 rb_define_finalizer(obj, rb_proc_new(gcdebug_sentinel, (VALUE)name));
13924}
13925
13926#endif /* GC_DEBUG */
13927
13928#if GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS
13929/*
13930 * call-seq:
13931 * GC.add_stress_to_class(class[, ...])
13932 *
13933 * Raises NoMemoryError when allocating an instance of the given classes.
13934 *
13935 */
13936static VALUE
13937rb_gcdebug_add_stress_to_class(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE self)
13938{
13939 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13940
13941 if (!stress_to_class) {
13942 stress_to_class = rb_ary_tmp_new(argc);
13943 }
13944 rb_ary_cat(stress_to_class, argv, argc);
13945 return self;
13946}
13947
13948/*
13949 * call-seq:
13950 * GC.remove_stress_to_class(class[, ...])
13951 *
13952 * No longer raises NoMemoryError when allocating an instance of the
13953 * given classes.
13954 *
13955 */
13956static VALUE
13957rb_gcdebug_remove_stress_to_class(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE self)
13958{
13959 rb_objspace_t *objspace = &rb_objspace;
13960 int i;
13961
13962 if (stress_to_class) {
13963 for (i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
13964 rb_ary_delete_same(stress_to_class, argv[i]);
13965 }
13966 if (RARRAY_LEN(stress_to_class) == 0) {
13967 stress_to_class = 0;
13968 }
13969 }
13970 return Qnil;
13971}
13972#endif
13973
13974/*
13975 * Document-module: ObjectSpace
13976 *
13977 * The ObjectSpace module contains a number of routines
13978 * that interact with the garbage collection facility and allow you to
13979 * traverse all living objects with an iterator.
13980 *
13981 * ObjectSpace also provides support for object finalizers, procs that will be
13982 * called when a specific object is about to be destroyed by garbage
13983 * collection. See the documentation for
13984 * <code>ObjectSpace.define_finalizer</code> for important information on
13985 * how to use this method correctly.
13986 *
13987 * a = "A"
13988 * b = "B"
13989 *
13990 * ObjectSpace.define_finalizer(a, proc {|id| puts "Finalizer one on #{id}" })
13991 * ObjectSpace.define_finalizer(b, proc {|id| puts "Finalizer two on #{id}" })
13992 *
13993 * a = nil
13994 * b = nil
13995 *
13996 * _produces:_
13997 *
13998 * Finalizer two on 537763470
13999 * Finalizer one on 537763480
14000 */
14001
14002/*
14003 * Document-class: ObjectSpace::WeakMap
14004 *
14005 * An ObjectSpace::WeakMap object holds references to
14006 * any objects, but those objects can get garbage collected.
14007 *
14008 * This class is mostly used internally by WeakRef, please use
14009 * +lib/weakref.rb+ for the public interface.
14010 */
14011
14012/* Document-class: GC::Profiler
14013 *
14014 * The GC profiler provides access to information on GC runs including time,
14015 * length and object space size.
14016 *
14017 * Example:
14018 *
14019 * GC::Profiler.enable
14020 *
14021 * require 'rdoc/rdoc'
14022 *
14023 * GC::Profiler.report
14024 *
14025 * GC::Profiler.disable
14026 *
14027 * See also GC.count, GC.malloc_allocated_size and GC.malloc_allocations
14028 */
14029
14030#include "gc.rbinc"
14031
14032void
14033Init_GC(void)
14034{
14035#undef rb_intern
14036 VALUE rb_mObjSpace;
14037 VALUE rb_mProfiler;
14038 VALUE gc_constants;
14039
14040 rb_mGC = rb_define_module("GC");
14041
14042 gc_constants = rb_hash_new();
14043 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("DEBUG")), RBOOL(GC_DEBUG));
14044 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("BASE_SLOT_SIZE")), SIZET2NUM(BASE_SLOT_SIZE));
14045 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("RVALUE_SIZE")), SIZET2NUM(sizeof(RVALUE)));
14046 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT")), SIZET2NUM(HEAP_PAGE_OBJ_LIMIT));
14047 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_SIZE")), SIZET2NUM(HEAP_PAGE_BITMAP_SIZE));
14048 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("HEAP_PAGE_SIZE")), SIZET2NUM(HEAP_PAGE_SIZE));
14049 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("SIZE_POOL_COUNT")), LONG2FIX(SIZE_POOL_COUNT));
14050 rb_hash_aset(gc_constants, ID2SYM(rb_intern("RVARGC_MAX_ALLOCATE_SIZE")), LONG2FIX(size_pool_slot_size(SIZE_POOL_COUNT - 1)));
14051 OBJ_FREEZE(gc_constants);
14052 /* internal constants */
14053 rb_define_const(rb_mGC, "INTERNAL_CONSTANTS", gc_constants);
14054
14055 rb_mProfiler = rb_define_module_under(rb_mGC, "Profiler");
14056 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "enabled?", gc_profile_enable_get, 0);
14057 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "enable", gc_profile_enable, 0);
14058 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "raw_data", gc_profile_record_get, 0);
14059 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "disable", gc_profile_disable, 0);
14060 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "clear", gc_profile_clear, 0);
14061 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "result", gc_profile_result, 0);
14062 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "report", gc_profile_report, -1);
14063 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mProfiler, "total_time", gc_profile_total_time, 0);
14064
14065 rb_mObjSpace = rb_define_module("ObjectSpace");
14066
14067 rb_define_module_function(rb_mObjSpace, "each_object", os_each_obj, -1);
14068
14069 rb_define_module_function(rb_mObjSpace, "define_finalizer", define_final, -1);
14070 rb_define_module_function(rb_mObjSpace, "undefine_finalizer", undefine_final, 1);
14071
14072 rb_define_module_function(rb_mObjSpace, "_id2ref", os_id2ref, 1);
14073
14074 rb_vm_register_special_exception(ruby_error_nomemory, rb_eNoMemError, "failed to allocate memory");
14075
14076 rb_define_method(rb_cBasicObject, "__id__", rb_obj_id, 0);
14077 rb_define_method(rb_mKernel, "object_id", rb_obj_id, 0);
14078
14079 rb_define_module_function(rb_mObjSpace, "count_objects", count_objects, -1);
14080
14081 {
14082 VALUE rb_cWeakMap = rb_define_class_under(rb_mObjSpace, "WeakMap", rb_cObject);
14083 rb_define_alloc_func(rb_cWeakMap, wmap_allocate);
14084 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "[]=", wmap_aset, 2);
14085 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "[]", wmap_aref, 1);
14086 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "include?", wmap_has_key, 1);
14087 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "member?", wmap_has_key, 1);
14088 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "key?", wmap_has_key, 1);
14089 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "inspect", wmap_inspect, 0);
14090 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "each", wmap_each, 0);
14091 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "each_pair", wmap_each, 0);
14092 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "each_key", wmap_each_key, 0);
14093 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "each_value", wmap_each_value, 0);
14094 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "keys", wmap_keys, 0);
14095 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "values", wmap_values, 0);
14096 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "size", wmap_size, 0);
14097 rb_define_method(rb_cWeakMap, "length", wmap_size, 0);
14098 rb_include_module(rb_cWeakMap, rb_mEnumerable);
14099 }
14100
14101 /* internal methods */
14102 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "verify_internal_consistency", gc_verify_internal_consistency_m, 0);
14103 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "verify_transient_heap_internal_consistency", gc_verify_transient_heap_internal_consistency, 0);
14104#if MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE
14105 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "malloc_allocated_size", gc_malloc_allocated_size, 0);
14106 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "malloc_allocations", gc_malloc_allocations, 0);
14107#endif
14108 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "compact", gc_compact, 0);
14109 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "auto_compact", gc_get_auto_compact, 0);
14110 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "auto_compact=", gc_set_auto_compact, 1);
14111 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "latest_compact_info", gc_compact_stats, 0);
14112#if !GC_COMPACTION_SUPPORTED
14113 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "verify_compaction_references", rb_f_notimplement, -1);
14114#endif
14115
14116#if GC_DEBUG_STRESS_TO_CLASS
14117 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "add_stress_to_class", rb_gcdebug_add_stress_to_class, -1);
14118 rb_define_singleton_method(rb_mGC, "remove_stress_to_class", rb_gcdebug_remove_stress_to_class, -1);
14119#endif
14120
14121 {
14122 VALUE opts;
14123 /* GC build options */
14124 rb_define_const(rb_mGC, "OPTS", opts = rb_ary_new());
14125#define OPT(o) if (o) rb_ary_push(opts, rb_fstring_lit(#o))
14126 OPT(GC_DEBUG);
14127 OPT(USE_RGENGC);
14128 OPT(RGENGC_DEBUG);
14129 OPT(RGENGC_CHECK_MODE);
14130 OPT(RGENGC_PROFILE);
14131 OPT(RGENGC_ESTIMATE_OLDMALLOC);
14132 OPT(GC_PROFILE_MORE_DETAIL);
14133 OPT(GC_ENABLE_LAZY_SWEEP);
14134 OPT(CALC_EXACT_MALLOC_SIZE);
14135 OPT(MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE);
14136 OPT(MALLOC_ALLOCATED_SIZE_CHECK);
14137 OPT(GC_PROFILE_DETAIL_MEMORY);
14138 OPT(GC_COMPACTION_SUPPORTED);
14139#undef OPT
14140 OBJ_FREEZE(opts);
14141 }
14142}
14143
14144#ifdef ruby_xmalloc
14145#undef ruby_xmalloc
14146#endif
14147#ifdef ruby_xmalloc2
14148#undef ruby_xmalloc2
14149#endif
14150#ifdef ruby_xcalloc
14151#undef ruby_xcalloc
14152#endif
14153#ifdef ruby_xrealloc
14154#undef ruby_xrealloc
14155#endif
14156#ifdef ruby_xrealloc2
14157#undef ruby_xrealloc2
14158#endif
14159
14160void *
14161ruby_xmalloc(size_t size)
14162{
14163#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
14164 ruby_malloc_info_file = __FILE__;
14165 ruby_malloc_info_line = __LINE__;
14166#endif
14167 return ruby_xmalloc_body(size);
14168}
14169
14170void *
14171ruby_xmalloc2(size_t n, size_t size)
14172{
14173#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
14174 ruby_malloc_info_file = __FILE__;
14175 ruby_malloc_info_line = __LINE__;
14176#endif
14177 return ruby_xmalloc2_body(n, size);
14178}
14179
14180void *
14181ruby_xcalloc(size_t n, size_t size)
14182{
14183#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
14184 ruby_malloc_info_file = __FILE__;
14185 ruby_malloc_info_line = __LINE__;
14186#endif
14187 return ruby_xcalloc_body(n, size);
14188}
14189
14190void *
14191ruby_xrealloc(void *ptr, size_t new_size)
14192{
14193#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
14194 ruby_malloc_info_file = __FILE__;
14195 ruby_malloc_info_line = __LINE__;
14196#endif
14197 return ruby_xrealloc_body(ptr, new_size);
14198}
14199
14200void *
14201ruby_xrealloc2(void *ptr, size_t n, size_t new_size)
14202{
14203#if USE_GC_MALLOC_OBJ_INFO_DETAILS
14204 ruby_malloc_info_file = __FILE__;
14205 ruby_malloc_info_line = __LINE__;
14206#endif
14207 return ruby_xrealloc2_body(ptr, n, new_size);
14208}
